It feels like home’s so far away... Hehe. You don’t have to give me that look—I won’t just get up and leave in the middle of the night. Traveling with you is so much fun, after all. And besides...if I leave, it looks like a certain someone’ll get lonely and start crying~
That’s a wrap for the world’s greatest gunslinger’s special show! Hope you had fun!♪
Now, if that wasn’t a total misfire...
Let’s go out with a bang!
You’ve got the best seat in the house!

Memo: CharacterProfileMB

Text:
Backstabber
Song by rionos

I feel like the mermaid who melted in the waves
Left all alone, vanishing without a trace
Promises nearly forgotten
Are all that stay afloat

Behind these smiles we force ourselves to wear
We each have our dreams
But, we always kill our feelings deep down inside
One by one

Don’t stop now—I’ve got to move forward
Until twilight looms on the horizon

Unable to let them out
I locked my feelings away
But once again, with a little time
My heart will heal these wounds
Please, tell me why...
Why did you throw me away?

I walk alone underneath the cloudy sky
Looking everywhere for you
Then, I realized I was still in the same place
Trapped with nowhere to go

Here I am, sinking to the ground
But, it's not like anyone can see me anyway

Drifting away from me
Are pieces of dreams I no longer have
As I chase after them
My body’s tainted with lies
I’m sorry... Forgive me

My tears shine in the mirror
My body’s about to crumble, my heart’s in pieces
But, I still wanted someone to take me in
So I let them go, and have been waiting quietly
But even then, I’ve known about them all along
Signs that you were a backstabber

Unable to let them out
I locked my feelings away
But once again, with a little time
My heart will heal these wounds
Please, tell me why...
Why did you throw me away?

Backstabber

I feel like a mermaid that
is melting in the waves
I faded away from here
Where you left me
I feel like a missing map
that’s floating in the waves
You will forget it

Now I’m like a mermaid who
has lost all her laughter
Then I faded away
But I’m dreaming
And I killed my heart so that
I won’t want anything
One by one by one

Don’t stop, I can’t stop
I have to move forward
Before the twilight overtakes me

I couldn’t tell you anything
Couldn’t open my mind
I closed up and shut down
I want to tell you everything
Want to open my mind
Now our time’s up, breakdown
Why did you go?
Why did you go?
Why did you leave the mermaid?

I feel like a mermaid who’s
swimming in cloudy sky
I’m looking for your back
that I can’t find
I feel like a mermaid who
can’t move from the same place
I’m stuck here to you

Crouching down and down
No one’s looking at me
Someone else’s eyes overtake me

Couldn’t be with you forever
Couldn’t follow my dream
I closed up and shut down
I didn’t want to lie to you
Want to say sorry
Now our time’s up, breakdown
Why did you go?
Why did you go?
Why did you leave the mermaid?

I know my body has no energy
I know my heart is torn to pieces
I want you to hug me, but I want you to admit
Your heart was growing away from me, but
I was always trying to forget it
I loved you so much, but you only sold me out

I couldn’t tell you anything
Couldn’t open my mind
I closed up and shut down
I want to tell you everything
Want to open my mind
Now our time’s up, breakdown
Why did you go?
Why did you go?
Why did you leave the mermaid?

An apprentice handmaiden working at the Duke’s estate who aspires to be a full-fledged handmaiden. After Monica had been driven away from one estate after another for being a witch, the Duke takes her in. She is a calm, reserved girl who hates fighting, but always tries her best.

Everglow
Song by Daoko

Goodbye to the sunset
A lonely voice echoes vibrantly in my mind
Long ago, here and now
People’s prayers resound
with melodies of the heart

In the rain-filled streets, I sway to-and-fro
With my weeping heart
Right now, I wish you were here,
smiling with me

I waited for sunrise, checking my calendar
Tomorrow’s the day I stop crying
I asked time and again
“If I can be free, will I be saved?”

Goodbye forever
My heart longs to stay, but I have to go on
This unending journey will take me
To where the moonlight shines

Every time I blink
The world changes—it makes me dizzy
As time goes on
We’ll become bubbles in the wind

In between the gray clouds
The blue sky starts shining through
Sunlight fills the room
I’ve seen this sight before

I waited for sunrise, hiding into the night
When my growing fears began to overflow
In my heart, an amber glow from long ago
Shines bright

I dreamed telling myself
“There’s nothing to fear”
I weave my dreams together,
but it’s time to go back
To where I’m alive

Goodbye to days long ago
Here I go again, hitting the trail
I hold your hand in mine
As our journey brings us closer together
Endlessly, endlessly

The flower petals fall and dance
To where the moonlight shines
To where the moonlight shines

Everglow

Saying goodbye to the sunset
Your sad melody echoes through the darkest sky
Long, long ago, here now, and gone
People have lived, prayed, and sang a song
with their fragile memories

The rain won’t stop falling
Drizzling, blurred streets
My heart is soaking too
Can’t tell how much I wish you were here
Wanna laugh with you right now

Waiting for sunrise
All day, you’re on my mind
I don’t know what to do
Tomorrow I won’t be crying
I’m talking to myself again and again
If I’m free, will I be saved?

Now is the time to say goodbye
I must move forward
Knowing that I’m not ready for it

behind a Grimm old fairy tale

but to no avail

So, I scream and chant

Never ends

Never ends

Text:
“I’m sure you’ll do great,” my mother smiled.
I watched her, and all my brothers and sisters
wave goodbye to me as I stepped into the
carriage bound for the city.

Living in a poor farming village with tons
of children is...difficult to say the least...
From a very early age, I learned just how hard
my parents worked to support us.

Which is why, following my family’s rule,
I left home at the age of 12—just as all my
older sisters had done.

If I go somewhere that has a lot of people,
there’s bound to be work to do.
I’d be lying if I said I wasn’t worried...

But with just as much anticipation overflowing
in me, I ventured into a new town.

I had heard that both my mom and sisters
used to work as handmaidens, which is why
I wanted to follow in their footsteps.

There are people who would say that
being a handmaiden is the perfect job for
country folk like us who’ve never had
any form of schooling...

But I’ve always wanted to
become a handmaiden.
It’s been my goal ever since I was younger,
when I realized just how much
I enjoy taking care of people.

I’d become a handmaiden...and one day,
I’d have that fateful encounter,
just like my mother did.
I’d meet the master I’m destined to serve,
and work to make him happy...
That was my dream.

To achieve that dream, I believed I could
overcome any hardship...
It never even crossed my mind that
a witch couldn’t become a handmaiden...

“There’s no way in hell I’d employ a witch.”

With those words, my master banished me
from his estate.

Hah... Not again...
After being flung outside, my entire body
aching, I slowly limped away.

I wonder how many times this makes...
I’ve worked for many masters.
At the beginning, everyone is so nice to me,
“You’re such a hard worker,” they smile.

But the second they find out I’m a witch...
they change.

I’ve got no allowance...and barely enough
money for food tomorrow...
Why does being a witch mean
I have to suffer like this...?
Are...witches not allowed to be handmaidens...?

“Working is very tough.
It’s not all fun and games.”
That was what my sister wrote in one
of the letters she used to send me.

But those letters, and the remittances she
sent with them stopped coming a while ago...
I wonder if my sisters also had the same
troubles I’m having...

“You’re a hard worker, Monica.
I’m sure you’ll do great.”
That’s what my mother always used to say,
but...I feel like I’m about to break.

Witches can’t become handmaidens...
Witches aren’t allowed to have dreams...

No one taught me any of this...!

No matter how hard I try, that hard work
will never pay off...because I’m a witch.

If that’s the case...then is there
any point in trying at all?

At what felt like my 100th master’s estate,
I was finally captured by the Knights of Longinus.

My master was such a nice man.
He knew I was a witch,
yet still let me stay with him...

But...he was just keeping me so that
he could hand me over to the Church.
I was never truly welcome there.

I wonder if witches aren’t allowed
to have dreams...

I wanted to become a handmaiden and
be of use to others...but I guess that dream
will never come true.

At that moment...the knights that were
dragging me away went flying, and a strange
man and woman rescued me.

The place they brought me to...was a large
mansion—the new mansion I was to work at.

...This...is it... This is my fateful encounter...
Mom, I finally met him—the master that
I’m destined to serve.

To my dear family back home,

Right now, I’m working at my master’s estate
as an apprentice handmaiden.
He rescued me when I got caught up in the
Witch Hunt, and agreed to let me stay with him.

My master is fighting everyday to save other
girls who are in the same situation I am.
His goal is to save every single witch out there,
and it seems he has a long, cruel journey
ahead of him.

So in order to help ease his troubles even just
a little bit, I want to serve as his handmaiden
and take care of him.

I plan to spare no effort in attending to him
each and every day.

There are still times when I get discouraged...
but right now, I feel like the happiest girl
in the world.

Sincerely, Monica.

The world has been destroyed.

A country incinerated by hellfire.
A kingdom consumed by crystals.
An empire purged by the Tree of Life.

These calamities—known as “Curses”—
appeared without warning and laid waste to
every single nation.

But, I refuse to let that stop me.
Because above all else, as the one entrusted
with the “Staff” by Her Holiness, I don’t want
to lose anyone important to me ever again.

With my heart filled with determination,
I took my first step into the ravaged world.
To search this vast land for the one and only
“Successor.”

“Be a ruler who can protect the weak.”
That was the lesson I learned from my parents.

But, I failed to live up to what they taught me.
I lost everything,
and was the only one left alive.
I fell into despair, but the one who saved me
was Her Holiness, the Pope.

Everyone has a small
glimmer of light inside them.
When they’re happy.
When they’re having fun.
When they’ve met the one they love.

That light fills their hearts with warmth.
And there’s someone who can take their own
light and share it with everyone.

Someone whose kindness towards others can
illuminate anyone’s path.

That person was Her Holiness.

One day, Her Holiness called me into
the deepest part of the cathedral.

There are two relics that have existed since
the beginning of the Church of Longinus’s
2000-year history.

The Baptismal Fire that was bestowed
by God—the “Lance of Longinus.”
The Divine Oak that descended
from Heaven—the “Staff of Tikkun.”

These two sacred treasures—said to awaken
when the world comes to an end—were now
in the hands of Her Holiness.

“I am not long for this world.”

A black infestation begins to spread
throughout Her Holiness’s body.

“Find the ‘Successor’ of the Staff.
The fate of the world is at stake.”

She held the Staff out to me,
but I couldn’t accept it.

After all, I couldn’t even save my homeland,
so the idea of me saving the world was...

As I stood there trembling,
Her Holiness gently smiled at me.

“There is no need to worry.
I have absolute faith that you can do it.”

And so, I set foot on my journey to
search for the “Successor.”
Soon after that, the “Curses”
engulfed the world.

As I wander from one country to the next,
all the worries I had bottled up begin crawling
back into my mind.
If I don’t find the Successor,
the world will truly be destroyed.
The fate of the world depends on me...

Her Holiness told me not to worry, but even if
I searched every corner of the world,
that doesn’t mean I can meet every single
person out there.
I don’t even know what kind of person
the “Successor” is to begin with...

What if I was unable to meet them?
What if I did, but didn’t know?
What if...they’ve already fallen victim
to the Curses...?

...No! Do not lose heart! Because this time...
This time, I will protect everyone with
my own two hands...!
If I don’t, then what would be the point of
everything I’ve done until now...?

I’m the only one—
the only one who can do this...

The world’s already being destroyed.
That’s what I learned throught this journey.

The Curses encroached upon the land,
overrunning it with creatures
I’ve never seen before.
Nowhere was safe.

But, people were still living.
After experiencing pain, sadness,
the loss of loved ones, despair that
plunged their worlds into darkness...
they discovered light inside themselves.

Someone’s kindness, a smile they remember,
bright memories of a loved one—everyone had
a gentle light shining through the despair
in their hearts.

That’s right.
The world hasn’t been destroyed just yet.
As long as someone keeps another close
to their heart, that light will never die!

This world can’t help but tremble as it stands
on its last legs, and that’s why it can’t help
but shine.

The waning flame inside of me began burning
bright red once more.

The very last place I visited was Fran—
the country of flowers.

I couldn’t find the Successor anywhere else,
so that means they must be here...

But, what if they aren’t here, either?
That very thought terrifies me.
At this point though, there’s just no more time
to search through the entire world again...

I pray as I take my first step inside
Fran’s largest city. And then...

...Ah. There’s no mistake about it.
With a light so warm and gentle,
that person is undoubtedly the one
chosen by the Staff—the Successor.

The real journey to save the world starts now.

But, I’m not worried.
I already know that as long as people keep
others in their hearts, light will never vanish
from the world.

“Nice to meet you. I know this is sudden,
but would you like to join me in saving
the world?”

My life has been filled with nothing but
misery and despair.

When I was a child, my mother had an affair
and walked out on us.

I was left with my father—
a jobless gambling addict.
Because of him, the little money I earned
all but disappeared into the gambling houses.

Today, a group of men violently open
the front door.
They’re debt collectors who’ve
come for my father.

But there was nothing of monetary value
left in our home.
So they set their eyes on
the next best thing—me.

“There’s a buyer out there for everything—
even a dirty brat like you,” one man sneered.
His eyes creep up and down my body,
evaluating its worth.

That was when I became a witch.

I guess the rumors were true—
witches are born when their emotions
go out of control.

I shook my arms free, using all my strength
to send the man flying across the room.
The moment his body slammed against
the wall, he quickly lost consciousness.

I feel hot—like fire’s coursing
through my veins...
Is this...power?
The power...of a witch?

It was easy driving the men out of my home,
including my poor excuse of a father.
For the first time in my life...
I felt proud of myself.

From here on out,
my life’s going to get better—
I will break free from this hellhole.
But, it didn’t take long for me to realize
just how naive I was.

My father returned, bringing the Knights of
Longinus along with him.

I still remember how he looked to this day—
happily clutching that small leather bag
he received from the Church.

There was probably a handful of
gold coins inside that bag...
That was all I was worth to him.

As the Knights inflicted wound after wound
upon my body, I desperately made
my escape...
But I had no idea where to go.

I just ran, and ran, and ran...
until I was walking down a road
I’d never seen before.

I was light-headed from
all the pain and hunger,
and my body shivered from the sudden rain
that taunted me as it poured down.

All that power that was flowing within me just
vanished into thin air, leaving my body with
barely any strength to move.

As I finally collapsed from exhaustion,
I asked myself one question
deep inside my heart.

...Why was I even...born?

Everything was fading to black.
The last thing I heard was the sound of
a horse as it came closer...and closer...

When I awoke, I felt warmth...
and a sweet fragrance I’d never
smelled before.

It took some time before realizing that I was
laying in a soft bed, wrapped in clean sheets.

The moment I had fainted in the rain,
the Duke of Fran came to my rescue.

He knew I was a witch, yet he didn’t hand me
over to the Church.

In fact, he knew everything about me,
and took me in to be his attendant.

...To this day, I remember how the Duke
looked at me...with his warm smile.

As someone who was betrayed by her parents,
I couldn’t believe the Duke’s kindness
right away.

Is he trying to earn my trust just so he can
do something terrible to me later?

Or...is he scheming something else?
Something that I just can’t put my finger on...?

I had all those doubts running through
my mind even while I served him.

But before long, one month passed,
then three months, then half a year...
I became busier the more I was accustomed
to my job, but the Duke didn’t change at all.

As unreliable as he was,
his kindness knew no bounds.
So before I knew it, I began thinking...

...That for the first time in my life,
I might’ve met the one person I could trust
with all my heart.

Several years passed in the blink of an eye.

One day—a genuinely normal day—
the Duke smiled as he’s always done,
and said to me...

“Thank you as always.
I’m glad you’re here for me, Iris.”

I must’ve heard those words countless times.
But for some reason, hearing them again
suddenly made me realize.

...This is the place I can call home.
And this hopelessly warm-hearted man
is the person I can serve for as long as I live.

...My lord.
From this day forward, no matter what kind
of hardships we may face, I shall remain
by your side.

Because...that is exactly what I was born to do.

Shall I tell you an old story?
The dull fable of a nameless fortune teller—
the secret tale of her and I...

I was but a mere fortune teller on the street...
My readings were renowned for their accuracy,
so crowds would gather around me
day after day.

But, a reading is just a reading—
not a prophecy... It’s nothing absolute.

Nonetheless, not a day went by without
a visitor who had complete trust in
my divinations.

I can’t take responsibility for such blind faith...
No future is set in stone, after all.
The future is something we shape
with our own hands.

One day, the chief minister from
the Church of Longinus paid me a visit...
A rare occurrence indeed.

The Church has the teachings from God,
so I would have never taken them as people
interested in fortune telling...
She even visited me
without any sort of escort...
Such a strange person.

“What brings you to me, my dear?
It appears you didn’t come to simply
have your fortune told...”
She was surprised,
saying I was right on the mark.
That was more intuition than divination,
though.

She suddenly lowered her head to me—
begging for me to use my powers of divination
to guide those who lost their way.

I thought her to be yet another blind believer
of my divination, but there was something...
peculiar about her.

On top of that, to bear the fates of The World
and The Wheel of Fortune...at the same time...

It looks like something interesting is
on the horizon.

I thought the followers of the Church to be
more of an obedient group that listened
without question...

But she was...different—
she actually had a head on her shoulders.

And she wanted me to use my powers for
helping strangers, not for self-indulgence...
A first in my book.

It sounded as though going with her would be
anything but boring...so I took her hand.

As a nun of the Church, I read the fortunes of
followers who lost their way, advising them
on how they could solve their problems.

I was out of place for not having a shred
of religious faith in me...
But, my life had never been so perfect.

My fortune telling and the Church’s
teachings—these two things have made people
not only seek salvation, but also work harder
to earn the future they desired.

This wasn’t accomplished by my power alone...
I’m sure I have her to thank.

With her being one of the Church’s elite,
there weren’t any chances for the two of us
to meet...but I still remember the loving look
in her eyes.

Some years later, I heard a rumor that
she became the Pope.

I couldn’t expect anything less from someone
of her character and ability...
I think I’ll go and congratulate her.

I was entertaining the idea of visiting her...
when she suddenly came knocking at my door.

“Use your damn divination to expose witches.”
That was the first thing that came out
of her mouth.
Who is this?
She was nothing like the person I knew...
It was as if some doppleganger was parading
around in her body.

But, I only knew her
from the few times we met.
Power can change a person,
though I was under the impression
she wasn’t that type...

With those thoughts in mind,
I obeyed the Pope’s commands and
used my powers to seek out witches.
I found them lurking in places high and low—
from hidden villages, to even the Church.

I don’t remember the exact number...
Though, I wonder why she suddenly gave
the order to search for witches...

Something’s amiss...
But what...?

It was noisy in the town square.
All the witches I found were rounded up.
What...was happening...?

As I stood there with my heart racing,
the Pope quietly spoke...
“Kill them.”
What...are you saying?!
The next moment, the Knights raised
their swords in unison.

The Witch Hunt had begun...
It wouldn’t be long before this horrendous act
was repeated in every corner of the world.

Was this the reason she made me use
my powers—the reason she called out to me
on the street...?
No. I remember those loving eyes.

They’re different from the eyes I see now,
beaming as witches are executed.
I’m sure her heart is...

Wait for me...
We’ve only met a few times...but I will return.
My cards reveal to me someone else who
bears the fate of The World on his shoulders.
I will find this chosen one,
and come back for you.

My story is also my big sis’s story.
The only reason I’m here is because of her,
after all.

My sixth birthday...was when I accidentally
realized I had strange powers.
I didn’t learn they were the powers of a witch
until much later.

Mommy, Daddy! Look at what I can do!

When I showed off my powers to them,
their expressions immedietly dropped,
and I was thrown out of the house like
a bag of garbage.

“Disgusting,” they spat.
“If I knew you were going to be a witch,
I would never have given birth to you.”

I didn’t understand what had happened.
But, this door was never going to open
for me again.
And when I realized that,
tears began falling from my eyes.

The door opened again,
and the one who came flying out...was Big Sis.

“It’ll be okay,” she said, before holding out
a stuffed bear she had made for me.

My mind struggled to keep up,
but I accepted her present.
Then Big Sis pulled me into her warm embrace.
“Happy birthday,” she hummed.

You can’t, Big Sis...
You’re going to be kicked out, too...

Tears streamed down my face,
and once they started, they never stopped.
I held the stuffed bear close to my chest
and wept in Big Sis’s arms.

After that, the two of us went into hiding.
Everyday was tough, but just knowing Big Sis
was waiting for me at home...was all I needed
to be happy.

But...I guess witches really aren’t allowed
to find happiness.

The Inquisition appeared without warning.
They had found out I was a witch.

While I shook in fear, Big Sis turned to me
and gave me an awkward smile.

“I’m not a witch, so they won’t capture me.
Sol, you go get a headstart and I’ll catch up.”

I believed those words.
How could I not? I was so scared...
The Inquisition’s famous for their cruel
torture methods.
Not a single witch captured has ever
returned from there.

I escaped outside the city and
waited for Big Sis.
But no matter how long I waited,
she never came.

Where is she...? Did something happen...?
Worry began welling up inside me,
and I remembered that awkward smile.

That’s right...! Why didn’t I realize it...?!
Big Sis only ever gives that kind of smile...
when she’s telling one of her bad lies...

My worries only grew from there,
and soon, I caught wind of a rumor.
That a witch named Lunalynn had
been captured.

Big Sis isn’t even a witch...
Why did they capture her?!

...It was for me.
She let herself get captured
so I could run away.

Of all the witches captured by The Inquisition,
not a single one has ever come back.
They’re all tortured in the cruelest ways...

Big Sis...
You’ve always protected me, and yet I haven’t
done a single thing for you in return...
This can’t be how it ends...

Whenever I was sad or felt like crying, I would
hug the stuffed animal Big Sis gave me—
the bear that was filled with
her love and warmth.

...That’s right. She’s always been
the one saving me.
But now it’s my turn to do the saving.
I’m going to save you, Big Sis...!

I wanted to go to where Big Sis was,
but a huge mountain of ice blocked my path.
That’s when I met the nice Duke.

His curse dissolving staff helped us climb to
the summit, and there, we saw Big Sis...
who had become a Witch of Qlipha.

Big Sis would never hurt a fly...
How could she...?
All of a sudden, the ice started showing us
her memories.

The Inquisition’s torture methods were
far crueler than the rumors made them out
to be, and Big Sis’s heart broke from the pain.
That’s how the Curse that freezes everything
was born.

For them to do such horrible things to you...
Just you wait, Big Sis. I’m coming to save you.

Big Sis, there are so many things
I’m thankful to you for...and I’m not
just talking about this bear.
You’ve given me more than
I could ever ask for.

So I’m begging you...
Don’t say such a sad thing like “Goodbye...”
I don’t want to go home to an empty house
anymore.

No one can get through to a witch
that’s gone berserk.
But I continued to try.

Because I know that Big Sis is kind.
Whenever I was crying, she would always
be there by my side.
Please...come back to me, Big Sis!

Suddenly, I felt Mister’s staff connect
my voice with Big Sis.

“...Sol? Were you the one who
called out to me?”

A warm light starts dissolving the land of ice.
Welcome back, Big Sis.

Big Sis and I are now living together
in Mister’s country.
It’s a wonderful place where us witches
aren’t discriminated against.

She never stopped apologizing to me, saying
that it was all her fault that I got injured.

You’re the one covered in wounds,
but you’re still only worried about me...
You never change, huh, Big Sis?

There’s no need to apologize though.
If it’s for you, Big Sis, then I’ll do anything.

“Why...?” You can’t even figure
that much out, Big Sis?!
Hah... I had a hunch,
but you really don’t know, huh?

This is the perfect opportunity,
so I’ll tell you why.
It’s not because we’re sisters,
or because you saved me.
The reason is much simpler than that.
Much more important than that.

It’s because...I love you, Big Sis!!

It was not my intention
to be a ruler of any sort.

But, I had no choice other than to assert
my claim to the throne.
To put an end to this long conflict for
the crown, and return peace to my country—
the Kingdom of Vyde.

As the old stories go, a mighty weapon was
forged by our forefathers to fell tyrants—
“Executioner.”
I used the sword to massacre many a brethren,
and ascend the throne.

...Had I fought alone,
I am certain I would have met my end.
I owe everything to Ophelia,
who stood by my side the entire time.

She is this kingdom’s finest royal guard,
and my dear friend since childhood.
To me, there is no one else I consider family.
So, I presented Executioner to her,
requesting her to do the unthinkable.

...I had her promise to kill me.

...Executioner has but one purpose—
to strike down tyrants.

As Ophelia and I stood at the throne,
I proclaimed to her.

“I have no doubt that I will one day
descend down the path of tyranny,
as my royal brethren did before me.
When that time comes, Ophelia,
I want you to swear to me...
You will take Executioner...and kill me.”

...I know Ophelia. While full of kindness and
loyalty, she possesses a fragile heart—
one that will surely be crushed by
the sheer weight of this promise.

After staining that sword with my blood,
Ophelia would certainly turn it upon herself
and pierce right through her own heart.

...I know this is the tragedy that awaits,
and yet...I am too weak to convey what
my heart truly desires—for Ophelia to die
together with me.

Pathetic... I am nothing but a coward.

As Ophelia’s hands quivered upon receiving
my sword, she spoke through the tears
welling in her eyes.

“I alone cannot bear the weight of this sword,
Your Majesty. Thus...please allow me to make
but one request. Just as you have requested
of me, I, too, wish for you to take my life into
your hands.”

As Ophelia’s anxious words leave her mouth,
she takes her own knightly blade, “Oathkeeper,” and presents it to me.

“Should a time arise in which I betray
my loyalty to you...I beg of you, Your Majesty.
Please, take this sword and—!”

I did not give her a chance to finish her words,
when I swiftly took her sword into my hands.

“...Thank you, Ophelia.”

Tears run down our cheeks.
Our promise to take each other’s lives was,
to us, our solace.

On this day, we vowed to entrust our fates
and our swords to one another...
as if binding our lives together in chains.

Hordes of sinister creatures
as far as the eye could see...
People fleeing in panic...
Soldiers dying one after another...

These infernal creatures appeared out of
nowhere, threatening to destroy the kingdom.

I escaped to safety.
But in that moment, I noticed Ophelia was
nowhere to be found.
I had a paralyzing feeling that something
terrible was to happen...

However, it was too late.
Ominous lights enveloped every horde of
creatures that were laying siege to the palace.

I noticed immediately—
That light... It’s... It’s her...!

She transformed into something that was
no longer recognizable as a human...
All to protect me...
All to protect this country!

Ophelia... Ophelia!!

I knew my voice would not reach her,
but I shouted her name over and over again...

The cursed crystals corrode the land.
The source of this Curse is Ophelia,
who has transformed into a Witch of Qlipha.

I am sure she must be in so much pain...
suffering all alone.
The only one with any chance of stopping her
is me... No, I must stop her.

I take Oathkeeper, my fingers gripping tightly around its hilt.

...It was I who forced Ophelia into making
that promise... Now I am to kill her?
...Ah, I see. In the end, I’m no different
from my brothers.
That is why...when I end her life,
I will just as soon end my own.

But, the crystals besieged the land, impeding
my journey with one danger after another.
It was then and there that I met the Duke.

He possessed a staff capable of weakening
the power of the Curse...
If I could borrow this power, then perhaps...!

Wait for me just a little longer, Ophelia...
I will come for you. I swear.

Ophelia!

We stood atop her altar
surrounded by crystals.
Ophelia had completely
descended into madness.
As we crossed swords, I screamed to her.

I lost you, and for that, I finally realized...!
If a ruler must walk their path alone,
then I am not befitting of a queen after all!

And the one thing I truly needed was not
that promise—it was you!
So I beg you... Come back to me...!

The two of us go in for the kill.
Our swords collide in a thunderous clash.
Plummeting from the sky, Executioner drives
its blade into a crystal atop the altar,
cleaving it into two...

The battle has reached its end.

Unconscious, Ophelia starts to collapse,
but I catch her before she hits the altar floor.
The ominous lights vanished, and the light of
dawn bathed the altar in its warm shine.

...Welcome back, Ophelia.

...The Curse completely vanished.
The land was scarred beyond recognition,
leaving our castle in ruins.
There, my beloved friend stands at my side
as I proclaim to her.

...Ophelia.
When I lost you,
my heart fell into hopelessness...
Then I realized something that freed me
from my despair.

Why I was able to become the queen
of this land...and why I was able to keep
fighting until I saved you...
It was all because I loved you.

Dear Ophelia, allow me to once again
make my request.
From this day forth, I wish for nothing else
but for you to stay by my side.
Forever, until death do us part.

Tears pour from Ophelia’s eyes as I take
her by the hands.
“We no longer needed any chains to bind our lives together.” I said to her.

“The sword is not the master of our fate.
We are our own masters.”

The cursed lightning storm rains down
throughout Lupus.
Some say it’s the wrath of the gods,
but it’s actually Cerberus’s tears.
She cries because the loneliness is too much
for her to bear.

“I’m right here, Big Sis... I wanna see you...”

Then it happened.
The cursed thunderstorm suddenly vanished.
That’s never happened before...

Come to think of it, I’ve heard of a group
that’s going around lifting Curses.
If I ask them, maybe they can save Cerberus.

They might be scary...but I told myself
I wouldn’t run away anymore.
So, I made up my mind to search for them.

Master was such a kind person.
He not only travels the world lifting the Curse,
but he also said he’d help save Cerberus.

She waits on the summit,
concealed inside the cursed lightning storm.
It’s dangerous to go by myself,
so I’m lucky to have Master’s help.

But, I can’t just keep relying on other people...
I gotta get stronger so I can at least
protect Cerberus.

After all, the reason she went berserk...
was because of me...

I hear the sounds of footsteps in the soil.
Red eyes float in the darkness.

The night was dark,
and Cerberus clung to me tightly.
But, I couldn’t protect her.

I knew I had to run,
but all my legs could do was tremble...
The creatures saw me frozen with fear
and laughed.

With a howl, they plunge towards us.
Sharp claws pin me down,
and flithy fangs tear at my neck.
Then, it happened.

“Big Sis... NOOOOO!”

Her scream was joined by the sudden
downpour of lightning.
That’s my last memory with Cerberus.

When I woke up, I was alone at the bottom
of a cliff, and the cursed lightning was
blanketing the land.

Master said the reason our powers go berserk
is because we lose control of our feelings.

The powers of a witch come from within.
Terror and despair caused Cerberus to
transform into a Witch of Qlipha.

It’s all my fault.
If only I had courage back then...
If only I’d been able to protect her...!

That’s why I decided—
no matter what happens, I won’t cry anymore.
I’ll get stronger so she won’t ever get sad again!

I feel determination burning in my heart,
and I look up towards the mystical mountain.
She’s there...waiting inside the violent
lightning storm.

Wait for me.
Big Sis is gonna save you.

Cerberus was crying alone inside
the mountain shrine.
Lightning was violently striking everything
around her...as if it were barricading her heart.

Once a Witch of Qlipha goes berserk,
no one can reach them.
But lucky for us, Master’s staff can.

Cerberus, Big Sis is here.
It’s okay now.

When I called out to calm her down,
the lightning weakened,
and she looked at me in surprise.
Tears start to well up in her eyes.

Thank goodness, she’s back to normal.
But as I stood there relieved,
her face started to twist in anguish.

“You’re lying...! Big Sis isn’t here...!
She can’t be, because I...I killed her!”

She let out a heartbreaking scream,
and the lightning enveloped her once more...

In the center of the violent lightning,
Cerberus was there weeping.

What am I doing?
Didn’t I say I’d get stronger so that
I can save her?!

She’s crying right before my eyes,
calling out to me the entire time,
“Big Sis. Big Sis...”
If I don’t save her now, when will I?!

I run towards her with all my might,
only to be struck by a lightning bolt.

The electricity flows throughout my body,
cutting deep into my soul.
I desperately grit my teeth to stop myself
from screaming.

This... This doesn’t hurt at all...
This is nothing compared to the pain she’s in...!

I stand up, and another lightning bolt
strikes me down.
My mangled body is engulfed in flames,
burning and crippling my legs.

The lightning attacks me relentlessly,
tearing through me with each strike.

But...I get back up.
I can’t bear to see her cry anymore.

The lightning rained down on me
as I reached Cerberus.
She was trembling...so I embraced her
as gently as I could.

It’s okay. You don’t have to be scared anymore.
Now, let’s go home.

Light starts to peek through the thunderclouds.
I see the color of her eyes return to normal,
and I felt myself quietly drift away.

When I open my eyes, I was on a bed.
Cerberus sees me wake up, and hugs me
with tears running down her face.
She won’t stop apologizing,
so I gently stroked her small face.

I’m the one who’s sorry.
I came so late to save you.
And...I’m so glad that you’re safe.

And then we sat there for hours,
chatting about everything and nothing.
After all, we have tons of catching up to do.
We need to make up for all the time
we spent apart.

Huh? You wanna hear more about Master,
Cerberus? You like him that much, huh?
Hmm...

We don’t have to rush, you know.
We’re gonna be together forever, right?

Now then, for my next story,
I think I’ll talk about the time I met Master.

I owe her my life.

As a child, I was infected by a terrible disease
that left me hanging between life and death.

No one thought there was any hope for me to
survive, so everyone gave up... Even me.

But, there was one person who didn’t—Fortina.

She kept my spirits up as I suffered through
nightmares, sacrificing her own sleep
to nurse me.

“Stop! You’re going to get yourself infected, too. Just leave me alone...”

I rejected her help,
but that didn’t dissuade her at all.
She looked like an angel...praying to God
day after day...

Thanks to Fortina’s exhaustive efforts
in nursing me, I managed to survive.

This plague is potent enough to
wipe out an entire village...
It’s nothing short of a miracle that I was saved.

And the one who performed that miracle
was Fortina.
I’m here today only because she persisted
against the odds that were stacked against her.

If this is the “will of God,” as she often says,
then that must mean I was kept alive
to protect her.

So I made a vow—not to God, but to myself...
Fortina saved me, so I’ll devote this life of mine
to her.

I will protect Fortina...
This I swear...with unbending resolve.

Many years since then...the village was
once again devastated by a plague—
the same one that infected me as a child.

With each passing day,
more and more people die...
But, what’s more concerning is how much of
an emotional strain it all has been for Fortina.

She’s apparently been praying at the Church
ever since the plague started spreading...
I just hope she’s eating properly this time.

Feeling uneasy, I go to the Church to check
on her...but what I found there was Fortina—
transformed into a witch.

She looked pale with fear,
so I embraced her as strongly as I could.
It’s going to be okay, Fortina...
I’m sorry for not noticing
what happened to you.
It must’ve been so terrifying...

If this is one of “God’s trials” that you usually
talk about, then I’ll face it alongside you.

I won’t let you suffer alone...
I vowed to always protect you, after all.

Everything will be okay.
If the two us are together,
I’m sure we can get through this.

Sometime later...a Letter of Summons
came from the Pope for Fortina.
My blood froze, fearing that she had been
targeted by the Witch Hunt, but it seemed like
she was being summoned to have
her humanity restored.

But in that letter...it was also written that
I was to accompany her.
Why would it...?

Maybe I’m just overthinking it,
but something doesn’t feel right here...

We proceeded with caution as we presented ourselves to the Pope...
It was then that she started cursing at Fortina for being a witch.

I became livid and challenged her accusations.
“Fortina...a witch of calamity?!
That’s just...ridiculous...!”

But then the Pope turned her lance on me...
contorting the world before my very eyes.

What...is...this...?
My vision...my memories...my mind...
are all becoming consumed.

Something begins to wipe my slate clean...
No, wait... Don’t take that memory...
Don’t take her away from me...!

It feels as if...a long time ago,
there was someone smiling at me.

That smile was as bright as sunshine...
and it saved my life.
I loved it with all my heart.

I vowed to myself that no matter the cost,
I would protect it—protect the ray of light
that saved me...

Wait... Don’t leave me...
Don’t take her away from me...
For...na...

It felt as if something had
scattered to the wind...
Something that seemed very important to me...

When I finally came to, the body of a witch
I’d never seen before was laying motionless
before me.

When did I defeat a witch...?
How strange. My memories feel faint,
and my mind clouded.

It was then that Her Holiness called for me...
Ah, yes. I remember now.
I am...the Grand Master of
the Knights of Longinus.

I swore undying loyalty to Her Holiness for
saving my life as a child...
That is who I am—
Grand Master Florence...

“Your Holiness, I have exterminated this witch
who dares trespass against you,” I said,
kneeling before her.

Yes... Everything shall be done as
Her Holiness wishes...
This I swear...with unbending resolve.

I was then ordered to seek out a man
in possession of a magic staff.
He appears to be an evil fiend spreading
disaster throughout the world with
his coven of witches...
I must dispose of him immediately...
for Her Holiness.

I finally found the man with the staff...
and soon engaged him in combat.

But just before I could strike him down...
a bright light emanated from his staff.
As I was bathed in its light,
countless memories buried within me
began to resurface.

Agh... Who...is...this...girl?
A witch—no, that is not true. She is...
For...tina... That’s right... Fortina!
The one I vowed to protect was her,
not the Pope!

I remembered everything...
What have I done...?
She saved my life, yet...
I nearly ended hers in cold blood!
If only I could just die by your hands...
Oh, how relieving that would be...

But if that were to happen,
I wouldn’t be able to save you.
Even if I’ve lost all hope of ever seeing you
smile again...I’ll stop at nothing to save you.
Wait for me, Fortina...I’m on my way!

I was raised in a very peaceful village.
It’s said that the ones who settled here long
ago were the mighty Vikings—our ancestors.

Since I was just a kid,
I knew absolutely nothing about the Vikings.
So before bed each night, I’d ask Dad to tell me
all kinds of stories about our great ancestors.

Heart-pounding adventures,
awe-inspiring battles,
and even festive banquets!
The warriors of the sea were so cool
and powerful!

And so I made my decision—one day,
I was going to become a Viking!

As I got bigger, I learned more and more skills
that an aspiring Viking would need to know.
Like how to row a boat,
and how to use a handaxe.

Then that fateful day came—
the day the Curse fell from the sky.

The world I’d known all my life—
the beautiful lakes, the green mountains...
Everything was crushed by crystals.
...Even my family.

Everything I loved was lost in an instant...
But, I didn’t cry.

I’m a Viking...
Vikings are supposed to be strong...!

Everyone was preparing the ships to
evacuate the remaining survivors.
But then out of nowhere, cursed creatures
appeared and attacked us.

I have to protect everyone...!
I stood up against the creatures without
even a second thought.

...I know it was stupid.
I’m nowhere near as powerful
as a real Viking, after all.

And as expected, I didn’t last too long at all.
They beat me up so hard,
I could barely even stand...
Nevertheless, I was somehow able to
distract the creatures long enough
for everyone to escape.

In the end, I wonder if I looked
even just a little cool...

The piercing sound of steel
brought me back to my senses.
I could make out an eerie light getting
cleaved into two.
Standing within the crystal fragments was...
a black-caped hero...

That was the day I met Queen Amleth!

Queen Amleth saved me, flipping her cape
and leaving without even giving me time
to thank her.

It was my first time seeing Her Highness.
She was so pretty...so cool...

She was exactly like the Vikings
I admired so much...!

If only I was as strong as her...

I was empty inside after losing everything,
but something hot started to flood back in.
I felt...admiration.

It ignited a fire inside me, burning away
my despair and painting over
my blackened heart.

I found a ragged cloak and put it on,
standing up as majestically as Queen Amleth.
With emotions overflowing, I ran at full speed.

Without realizing it, my wounds had healed,
and energy started to surge through me!

...So light. I feel so light!
I feel like I can fly!

Now, I can be as strong as Queen Amleth...!

That’s right! At that moment,
I became a witch.
A Viking witch!

I became a witch, and without hesitation
decided to help those affected by the Curse.

But I was still weak as a Viking,
and nowhere near as strong as Queen Amleth.

In the battle against the endless horde
of creatures, the light from the crystals
slowly consumed me.

It made me have nightmares...
of my village in ruins...
and the cries of the people I couldn’t save.

And when it looked like I was gonna get
swallowed up by my despair...

Someone saved me—my second hero...
Hehehe... That was you, Master!

Queen Amleth and Master—
the one who inspired me to fight,
and the one who reached out to me.
You two are my aspirations—my heroes.

I still have a long road ahead of me
if I wanna become a true Viking,
but I’ll take it one step at a time.

There’s nothing left for me in
the ruins of my past, after all.

That’s why, I’ve decided to only look forward.

One day, when this is all over...
I hope my adventures will become
someone’s bedtime story.

I am useless in the face of death.
...And can only stand by and watch
as people lose their lives.

But...there is one thing I can do—
Watch over those that have departed
from this world.

I learned that was what a gravekeeper does.
My dad taught me—he was a gravekeeper, too.

My dad, my dog Laila, and me—
the three of us lived in a small village
in the middle of nowhere.

I heard Mom died giving birth to me...
And Dad’s so quiet and clumsy,
he can’t cook or clean to save his life.
So, I learned how to do all the chores myself.

Maybe that’s why I like to
take care of people so much.
Everyone in the village actively avoided us,
calling us gravekeepers “bad omens...”
But, I didn’t mind.

Because I was happily doing my own thing.

Laila died at the end of summer.
Dad said it was from old age.

I held her in my arms until her last breath.

I’ll never forget the feeling of her body
suddenly getting heavy, and the feeling
of something important slowly leaving it...

The next day, I made a grave for Laila
so that she’d be able to rest in peace.

I’m sure that was when
I truly became a gravekeeper.

The disease came to the village
soon after that...

And people died one by one—
left out to rot because everyone else was
scared of catching the disease.

Dad refused to let me help as he began
burying the abandoned bodies.

One by one, all by himself...

In the end, Dad died to the same disease.

And when I was burying Dad,
I finally realized...
that humans really are useless
in the face of death.

A few days passed,
and this time I was the one that got sick.

Bedridden with a high fever,
I soon realized there were people
outside my house.

It was all the remaining survivors,
led by the priest.

“This all started because
those two gravekeepers handle the dead!
They’re the ones that spread the disease!”

They sounded so angry,
like they were about to break in any second.

But for some reason, I wasn’t scared...
Because either way,
I’ll get to see Dad and Laila soon.

In my feverish state, I heard the sound
of a dog howling in the distance.
I knew whose howl it was instantly.

Laila...?
Did you come to get me...?

...I don’t remember anything after that.

When I came to,
I was alone in the graveyard,
and had these two things
growing out of my head.

Strangely, I felt Laila’s warmth around me,
and softly laughed to myself.

The villagers that were surrounding
my house were all long gone.

All that remained were ruins of houses
that had once made up this village...
and bodies that had yet to be buried.

A village no one would come to anymore...
and a bunch of people who would slowly
be forgotten...
Who’s going to send them off?
Who’s going to watch over them?
What would Dad do...?

What had to be done was in plain sight—
Do what a gravekeeper needs to do.
That’s my job.

It’s...something only I can do.

Ever since the thundercloud covered the sky,
everyday’s been filled with bangs and booms...
It’s gotten so loud around here lately.
At this rate, no one’s gonna be able to
get a good rest.

I did hear that the lord of a country is
traveling around dispelling Curses.
If I go with him, there’s bound to be
something I can do to help.

I mean, I’m probably the only
gravekeeping witch out there, right?
There’s no need to worry—Laila’s with me.

I’ll be off then, Dad...everyone...
When I get back, I’ll tell you guys
all about my adventures!

There’s another Charlotte inside me.
We’ve been inseparable since the day
she came into my life.

But the only one who knows this is me.
I’m all she has, just as she’s all I have.

She’s kinda crazy, flipping out over
things she doesn’t like.
But she loves snacks—just like me.

So, when it looks like she’s
about to lose it, I start snacking.
That way, she’ll stay put...and never come out.

The other Charlotte’s violent,
but she’s actually super sweet.
Whenever I get hurt, she always throws
a fit and stands up for me.

But, it looks like people are scared of her...
Every time she comes out, everyone runs away,
screaming, “Witch!”

I gotta protect her.
She’s pretty sensitive about how people
feel about her, and it doesn’t take much
provoking for her to blow up...
So, I cast a spell.

This spell gives me a magic smile...
A happy person always beams with joy.
So, as long as I’m smiling,
I’m sure she’ll keep her anger in check.

That’s why I decided to cast this magic spell...
and wear this “happy mask.”

I can’t let anyone else know about her.
I’m sure they’ll be just like Mommy and Daddy
and call me a “crazy kid.”

If they said that, she’ll come out again.
That’s why I hid her away underneath
my happy mask.

Hiding things is my specialty.
No one needs to know the truth except for me.
She’s here for me, and I’m here for her...
We don’t need anyone else!

If I can bury everything underneath
this happy mask, then no one...
will ever know the truth.

The other Charlotte’s a witch,
so the Knights of Longinus have
always been after her.
Everyone hates witches, after all.

That’s why I hid her underneath
my happy mask, keeping her safe from
the Church this whole time.

Then one day, just like any other day,
a knight found me walking through town,
so I tried to run away.

But this knight took the snacks that I—
that she loves, and trampled on them,
crushing them into hundreds of pieces.

The shock of seeing her favorite snacks
ruined caused her to snap.
She cracked my happy mask wide open
and broke free...taking control of my body.

When I came to, everything around me
was in shambles, like someone had gone
on a rampage...
Hehe... Ahh, it happened again.

I put my happy mask on to cover myself up
from anyone who’d look at me in fear.
“Maximum smileage.
Happiness is in full bloom.
Smiles are happy magic.”

I chanted those magic words again and again.
Whenever I do, she—I can rest a bit easier.

It’s okay—I have her, and she has me.
We aren’t alone. We’re witches,
but we’re in this together.

We won’t be unhappy...
We’re not unhappy...

Something made the other Charlotte go
on a rampage again.
But, that day was different.

A man with a staff cheered me up, saying,
“It must have been tough being all alone.”

Alone? What are you talking about?
She’s with me... Oh, I see.
He’s got me all figured out.

He knew exactly what was hidden
under my happy mask...
Having learned everything,
he held his hand out to me and said,
“Come with me.”

“What’cha think?” I asked my other self.
But I already had my answer—
I’m...gonna trust him.

If this ends up being some kind of trick,
I’ll just hide myself again.
So I prayed that this man wouldn’t betray me,
and took his hand, hoping I could finally say
goodbye to my happy mask.

“We’re here to enforce justice.”
the Knights said as they rescued my village.

My heart was stolen by those radiant Knights,
with their silver armor and shining swords.

Knights are honorable symbols of justice.
They themselves are my aspirations.

Against my parents’ wishes, I fled home
and pursued my shining silver dream.

I’m going to join the knighthood.
I will become an honorable knight.

Sometime after I was dispatched to a unit as
a squire...a new recruit was put under my care.

She was a scrawny girl, definitely not someone
fit enough to be a knight...

But surely she came here because she wanted
to become a knight of justice—just like me.

So I had to support and guide her
in every way I could...

It didn’t look like she could make it through
the intense training, so I kept supporting.
I reprimanded her, cheered for her...

I truly believed it would all help her grow...

Lately, it feels like people are watching,
even laughing at me...
Am I imagining things?

One day, our commander was
exposed for corruption.
Knights are enforcers of justice.
Failure and defeat mustn’t exist,
let alone corruption...

Yet, instead of seeking repentance,
he dismissed it all.
Even now, he sits on the commander’s chair
like nothing ever happened.

He won’t even reflect on what he’s done...
Does he have no pride or conviction
as a knight?

I complained about how
his punishment was handled,
thinking it was the right thing to do.
But in the end...

I was suspended from duty.
I don’t understand—I stood up to corruption,
yet I’m the one being punished?!

No... I can’t let myself get discouraged.
I am to become a knight—a knight of justice.

Several days into my suspension...
everyone’s wallets went missing
while they were out.
Theft this time, huh...?
This unit has completely rotten.

Then a rumor spread,
claiming that the culprit was...me.

I was on suspension and
wanted revenge, they said...
Please, enough with the insults.

Unlike them, I’ve lived my life diligently.
So if they have time to talk,
they have time to search.
I’m sure the wallets are
as good as gone by now, though.

...What? Everyone’s wallets were found?
In my room?

All my beloved comrades, the commander—
each and every one of them insulted
and sneered at me.
I was innocent...yet I couldn’t defend myself.

It was endless torment...
I didn’t know what to do.
Then, that recruit stepped out from the room.
Thank goodness, she’s here...!
But, the relief only lasted a moment.
She looked at me with the same scornful eyes
as everyone else, and laughed.

I see... So that’s how it is.
This commotion was a trap,
plotted by everyone to frame me.

She was the only one I truly trusted...
But in the end, she, too, was laughing
behind my back, calling me annoying
and irritating.

What’s justice...? What should I strive for...?
I don’t know... I just don’t know anymore...

I’ve made it this far believing
hard work would pay off...

But, the ideals I pursued were fleeting—
the justice I admired was nowhere to be found.

I was enveloped in total darkness,
but a beam of light shone through.
You were that light...and you helped me
remember that silver light I once admired.

That’s right... That...was my dream—
to be strong and gentle...
To be someone virtuous who
could protect everyone...
Someone like you.

I now know my calling.
This sword will not rest until
my ideals become reality.
I will persist in my faith in justice...
and my faith in you.

Growing up, I had a pair of sisters as
my childhood friends.

The three of us were the best of friends,
and as we grew up, that never changed.

Even after I left the village for work,
I continued to exchange letters
with them frequently.

...Until that letter arrived.

One day, I received a letter from
the younger sister.

I was thrilled to receive another letter
from my best friend, but the moment
I started reading, my face froze.

The letter said that the Church had
captured her older sister...for being a witch.

“I’m the one that’s the witch, so why is Big Sis
the one that has to be captured?”

So said the letter, but I knew why.

For that was the choice the older sister made
to save her younger sister.

And that choice now left the younger sister
alone and in despair.

I want to save them, but what should I do?

There was only one thing I could do—
go to the Church and testify to her
not being a witch.

But, there’s a chance I’ll be labelled as
an accomplice and get arrested, too.

The inquisitor there is known for
using cruel torture methods.
If I’m caught, I might be...

I kept hesitating...and hesitating...

And in the end, I locked the letter away
in my closet and pretended that I had
never read it.

While I closed my eyes and lost myself in
hesitation, you saved my best friends.

...I feel ashamed for running away.

My lord...I want to become someone like you.
Someone who, no matter the danger,
can risk their life for those who are
important to them.

Who are those two?

Well...until I manage to apologize to them...
it’s a secret.

One day, I received a letter—
the first one since coming to my lord’s estate.

I knew who sent it.
And exactly because of that,
I couldn’t bring myself to open it.

It’s her...

Did she get impatient with me since I’ve been
running away from her plea for help for so long?

I’m happy for the letter...but I can’t open it...
Not with the way I am right now.

Because if I open up the letter,
they’ll be able to see just how
weak and ugly I really am.

Those two are kind,
so I’m sure they’d forgive me.

Actually...if I dodge their questions well,
I can probably cover up all my faults.

But if I do that, I’ll really never
be able to face those two.

So I looked away from the letter—
from her gaze...

I know that all this is meaningless.

Because looking away and locking up
my emotions can’t make things disappear.

Life is a series of choices.
Even if you can put a problem off momentarily,
you can’t run away from it forever.

So after much hesitation, I made my decision.

With shaking hands, I opened the letter.
My eyes were greeted with a handwriting that
I was all too familiar with.

“I’m so happy to see you again.
Would you like to have some tea together?
Of course, my sister will be there, too.”

I couldn’t read the rest as my eyes
were brimming with tears.
I was so happy...but...also sorry that
she had to be the one to break the ice.

At this rate, it’ll just be a repeat of before.
I need to have courage...
to face her...and myself.
I’m going to see them—my best friends.

I hated witches.

My reason was simple—
because Mom and Dad hated them.
I wanted my parents to think
I was their good little girl,
so I said all sorts of bad things about witches.

In the picture books I used to read,
witches were depicted as terrifying monsters
that had big horns and claws.
They disguised themselves as normal humans
and wrecked havoc on people.

That’s why, even when that girl saved me from
a rabid dog...I was really cautious at first.

Because...I thought that since she lived
all by herself in the forest,
she might have actually been a witch.

With a single wave of her hand, the rabid dog
scurried away with its tail between its legs.
It looked just like magic...

But, my eyes had deceived me.

Because in actuality, she had used incense
that dogs hate the smell of to get rid of it.

She wasn’t a witch at all—just a simple scholar
who started living in the woods because
she hated how noisy town life was.

After that, the two of us started
getting to know one another.
I really liked talking to her,
even if she was a bit strange.

But one day...
That girl...was captured by
the Knights of Longinus.

That girl was dragged to the gallows.
Loud curses poured out from
the crowd around her.

“Filthy witch. Face your punishment.”
“Die! Die! Die!!”

No, you’re wrong...
That girl’s not a witch...!

I wanted to tell everyone the truth,
but the words never made it to my lips.
...And then, she was gone.

Why did she have to die...?
Why...?!

My body’s hot.
My chest aches.
I knew I couldn’t let people see me cry,
but my tears wouldn’t stop.
It was then...I heard someone scream.

“Witch! There’s a witch over there!”

Everyone’s terrfied gazes...were on me.

A long horn...and claws on my left hand...
My body...looked identical to the witches
in my picture books.

Ah... Aahh...!
No... This can’t be real...!

As if trying to escape reality, I raced home.
I thought that maybe this was all
just a bad dream...

...All I remember is the look of pure fear
on my parents’ faces, and the Church’s knights
rushing towards me.

“We didn’t call the Knights here!”
The desperation in my parents’ voices
made it seem like they were pleading
for their lives.

How truthful their words really were though...
was something I’d never get to find out...

I keep running all night long,
passing through the forest I met
that girl in without being spotted.

That was the first time I had traveled
that far from town.
I was born there... I grew up there...
But no one in town will take my side anymore...

...Why did I become a witch?
Did I do something bad?
Has this been my destiny
from the day I was born?

Or...was it because I talked to her—
No! There’s no way that’s the case!

Yeah... Of course.
This all must be a dream.
When I wake up, I’m sure everyone
will be back to their normal selves.

After all, I’ve always been
nothing but a good girl!

That’s why, I need to hurry and wake up.
I’ll wake up, and go visit that girl...

I wonder how much time
has passed since then...

I’m so hungry.
My body’s freezing.
But with the way I am now,
there’s nowhere for me to go.

Following the sound of running water,
I somehow make it to the river
to quench my thirst.

But...then I see my reflection in the water—
my big horn and sharp claws.

No... No...! I don’t want to see them!
Please...just disappear...!
Why won’t you disappear...?!

With tears streaming down my face,
I claw at my reflection in the water.
But...not only could my claws not feel
how cold the water was, no matter how
roughly I treated them, they didn’t
even get a scratch on them.

I thrash them against a boulder,
but only the boulder breaks.
Right now, I’m sure even a ferocious wolf
would take one look at me and run...

Ahh... I’m...no longer human.
Someone... Anyone...
Please...save me...

10, 20, 30...
Not a single shot I fired hit its mark.

Despite all my training, day in and day out,
I see no improvement.
Why? It’s enough to make anyone
begin to doubt themselves.

Losing out to my own frustration,
I pounded the table in anger.
The sudden commotion shook a nearby officer
abruptly from his daydream, but I paid no mind.

I hate using firearms.
The world I see as I focus my eyes
over the barrel, the smell of gunpowder
wafting under my nose—
it all reminds me of that day.

When I was young, I lived in a village
out on the borderlands.

It was a dull sort of place, nothing much to it.
A childhood spent between tiring farm chores
and dreadful boredom.

So when I heard news that knights from
the Church of Longinus would be paying us
a visit, I nearly leapt with joy.

As a child, I fantasized about joining
those holy knights on their Witch Hunts.

“Hey Ma, you think they’ll tell me
’bout their adventures?”

Seeing me restless and excited,
my mother simply smiled.

Then the day came, and the Knights arrived.

The sight of them, looking down from high atop
their horses, adorned in their glistening armor,
was simply overwhelming.

Not one of us could speak.
My excitement gave way to awe.

Finally, one of those knights I had so long
adored broke the silence.

“We have word there is a witch among you.”

And just like that, it all began.

I looked on as the people I had grown up with
were dragged away, tossed into a raging fire
in the town square.

One after another they burned,
until it was my own mother’s turn...

She called out to me...

Screaming through the flames
and the smoke and the pain.
Again and again and again...

I don’t remember much after that.

But the scene remained seared in my mind
from that day on...

The memories traumatized me.

The smell of burning flesh and sounds of death
and torment haunted me, shackling me from
moving forward.

And they all come roaring back every time
I pull the trigger...

But now I’ve found something to live for.

For the drowsy officer there
on the training range.
For my fellow soldiers.
I need to overcome my past to defend them.

It is for them I choose to wield my weapon.

At last, the time has come—
the battlefield awaits.

Everything is different from that fateful day.
My comrades... My enemy...

But, I know what I must do.
That hasn’t changed.
I march into battle to fight for my comrades,
and to protect the citizens.

But, my anxiety and my trauma still
torment me like shackles...

Do I have what it takes to pull the trigger
without hesitation? Without fear?

Will my anxiety bring misfortune to my
comrades—to him?
That was my only concern.

My comrades are hurt,
and the enemies close in...
I’m the only one left.
My unit...has fallen.

I had to do something...
Then, I felt a warm light
radiating from behind me.
He, and all my new friends
were smiling at me.

That’s right—I’m not alone.
We all fight for the same ambitions...
Now’s the time! I pulled the trigger.

The bullet flew straight...towards the enemy...
piercing through him!
Ma...I finally did it. I protected everyone...

My fears have yet to disappear,
and I’m certain they will continue to
haunt me relentlessly.

Thus...I swear to stand alongside those fears
and continue to fight to break these shackles.
I’m stronger now, so...I know I’ll be okay.

I’ve been a witch for as long as I could
remember, living with Granny on a mountain.

There was a small village located down on
the foothill, but everyone was so frightened
of me that they chased us out.

I try to help Granny out, but...I’m just no use...
I go down to the village to sell her flowers,
but the villagers just stay away from me.
“Get lost!” they yell.
“A witch’s flowers? How disgusting!”

Granny’s always telling me that I’ll get through
to them eventually, but I’m only ever able to
sell flowers to the occasional traveler...
Today, just like most days,
I couldn’t sell a single one.

They’re all so pretty, too...
Is everything really my fault?

Once again, because of me,
no flowers were sold...

When I’d come home crying,
Granny always gave me a warm hug.
“There’s no need to cry.
Nothing is your fault...”

I’ve been told all my life that witches are
to blame for all the calamities and evils
in this world...
Plagues, poverty, disasters—
everything bad happens because I’m cursed...

The only person who’d never call me evil...
was Granny.

“Your magic power is just what makes you
special. God gave you this gift so that
you can be you. That’s why, there’s nothing
to be ashamed of... Be proud of who you are!”

“I was too late to see just how special you are.
So, at the very least, you need to get
your head on straight, and live!”
Granny looked kind of downhearted,
but did her best to smile for me.

I still don’t understand why Granny looked
so sad...but I felt the sheer amount
of love in her words.
So, I’ll stop agonizing over my fate as a witch...

At least, that’s what I thought I’d do...

One day, a disease spread
throughout the village.
Come to think of it...a traveler who
bought flowers from me some time ago
mentioned something similar.

They said a neighboring village
was hit by some disease.
“Did that make its way here...?”
That was the most thought I gave it at the time.

But, the villagers seemed
to be acting differently.
They were in an uproar, calling the disease
a curse, and blaming its spread on
a witch—on me.

“Those wretched flowers you sell are cursed...
You used them to spread this disease!”

How could they say such things...?!
Granny only grew these flowers to
heal the pain in everyone’s hearts...

Feeling mortified and powerless to
defend myself, I ran back home
to the mountain.

“All they say to me is ‘Witch! Witch! Witch...!’
I hate them all...”
When Granny heard how upset I was,
she said to me,

“Don’t resent them.
The villagers are just tired.
Their hearts have grown weary,
gripped with fear...
They can’t help but feel distressed.
They’re close to their breaking point.
So, they just chose poorly in how to
escape from it all...”

“It’ll be okay. The day you get through to them
will come. So, let’s send everyone flowers...
and pray their hearts can be saved.”

Granny prayed these flowers would heal everyone’s hearts...and that one day
they could share their anxieties and fears
with someone else, so that together,
we can [――], and grow.

I couldn’t catch the most
important part of what Granny said.
When I was about to ask her to repeat herself...
I smelled something burning outside.
“It can’t be...”

I opened the front door...only to see
the flower garden in flames.

Before I knew it, the villagers had
surrounded our home, torches in hand.
“With that witch here, we’ll all be doomed!”
they shouted, before hurling their torches at us.

Why...? All we did was live in peace...

“Burn in hell, you damn witch!”
shouted a villager, his rifle aimed at me.
He fired, but in that instant...something gentle
and warm wrapped itself around me.

And then I watched helplessly...as Granny
collapsed slowly towards the ground.

“Granny! Stay with me!”
As I held her in my arms, Granny smiled at me
with a look of relief in her eyes.

“It’s okay... Take that sad look off your face.
Smile...like the beautiful flower you are...”
Then, she was gone...

“Don’t resent them...”
I’m sure that’s what you’d say, right Granny?
But, I’m sorry... I can’t stop.
I can’t stop...hating them
for everything they’ve done!

I mean, they think that just because
I’m a witch, it’s perfectly fine to fear me...
hate me...and steal everything I love!
How can I even begin to forgive them?!

These monsters...all deserve to die!

When I came to, I was drifting
through darkness...unable to put an end
to these evil thoughts that made my heart
overflow...with hatred.

Then...a gentle light shone
through the darkness.
I felt something emanating from it—
a love that put my heart at ease...
like Granny’s smile once did.
I reached towards the light,
and a man holding a staff took my hand.

His hand was gentle...
One that heals people, just like Granny...
The moment I touched him,
my memories started coming back to me.
I remembered what Granny said that day,
when she gently scolded me for being upset.

“Use the flowers to connect the hearts
of people...like a tree connecting the sky
with the soil...so that together, we can
[cultivate these bonds], and grow...”
Those were her words.

Granny...
Right now, I’m traveling the world to heal
everyone whose hearts are suffering with
grief and despair.
He’s here, too, of course...
So, don’t worry about me.

This world’s full of tears,
but I’ll turn it into one full of flowers...
There’s so much love in the flowers
you gave me...and I won’t rest until
I’ve covered the entire world with them.

In the 15 years I’ve been alive,
I’ve never once fallen in love.

I’m a nobleman’s daughter...
so I always assumed that me choosing
the man I married was out of the question.

I admit though—I was a little hopeful
when the marriage proposal came.

I thought that maybe if I got married to
a handsome prince, even I might be able to
enjoy a beautiful fairy-tale romance.

...But, that dream never came true.

My fiancé was an awful man.
He would lock women in his estate and
do whatever he wanted with them.

But he never paid attention to me—
I was too young.

I watched the women get
punched and kicked...
Ahh, it must’ve hurt...

Everyone hated him...
but no one dared to go against him.
They feared the consequences.
So instead, they struggled through
each day covered in scars.

The beautiful romance that I had always
dreamed of was smashed to pieces
right before my eyes.

There was no way I could forgive him.
This man who had trampled all over my love...
I would never forgive him.

I snuck into the town’s church and told
the priest about the atrocities that were
taking place.

...But the priest rejected everything I said,
and instead accused me of being a filthy witch.

The priest...was an accomplice of that man
from the very beginning.

My parents resented me for being a witch.

“All you had to do was
obey that man’s every word...”
“You should have just let him take you
like all the other women...”

Hehe... Ahahaha...!
There really is no such thing
as a fairy-tale romance.

Living happily ever after with
Prince Charming...? That’ll never happen.

While I continued laughing in
the dark basement, something began
crawling out from my shadow.

They were black thorny vines that took
a tight hold on my heart—
proof of me being a witch.

“You don’t need to look at
any of this filth anymore...”
They whisper, wrapping me in a tight embrace.

Ahh, it stings a bit...
But...it feels much better than the cold floor.

The black thorns pierce deep into my skin,
while the endless number of vines grow with
a will of their own.

And, as if they reject this cruel world,
yet also yearn for its warmth...
they break, and break,
and break and break and break—

Before I knew it, I had lost consciousness.

As I laid in the embrace of the thorny vines,
I had a dream.

It was about a prince and his knight
who came to save me...
A truly impossible dream.

I knew it wasn’t real, but...I was almost
in tears at how happy I was in it.

This is what I had always wanted.
But my dream faded all too soon,
as though it had been taken away from me.

I opened my eyes to the same
cold basement floor.
...But, hehe, what a surprise...

The prince and his knight from my dream
were right in front of me!

The prince punished the horrible man
and his accomplices. And with that,
I was finally released from the estate.

All the poor, imprisoned women were
also able to return to their homes.

...It was finally over.

I’m a witch, so I have no home to
go back to...but that’s fine.
Because I get to stay with my prince—
The love of my life that even
appeared to me in my dreams.

Hehehe... Ahh...this warm and fuzzy feeling...
So this is true love.

I will always love you, my prince.
Forever and ever. Hehehe...

That day, I snuck the crown out of the house,
and I put it on her head.
Then, I pretended to be her knight
and served her.

I did it all because I wanted to spend
more time with her—that scared and quiet girl.

We made a promise—to one day go outside
the village without any worries.

“...Priscilla, I’ll protect you.”

We were connected, in that both our families
decended from the witch who founded
our village.

In that miserable village that dreaded us,
Zara and Skuld were the only ones who
would come out and play.

...But, I was so happy.

Some time after Skuld returned to
her hometown, and Zara joined the military,
I invited Priscilla to go outside the village
for the first time.

She had been crushed ever since
the two had left, so I wanted to cheer her up...
even if just a little.

Priscilla was worried about stepping outside, but...it’s okay—I’ll protect you.

I held her hand so she wouldn’t get lost,
and the two of us had so much fun.

It was my first time seeing a village so lively...
My first time in forever seeing Priscilla’s smile.

That...was our last happy memory together.

On the way home, these men in black
suddenly appeared and surrounded us.

“...Our witch...! Our beloved witch!”

Every man was shouting,
their eyes cast onto Priscilla.

Having no idea who these men were,
I drew my sword and ran towards them.

I have to protect Priscilla...!

But I was powerless...
There were simply too many of them.

Injured, I kneeled helplessly as one of
the men came to finish me off.

It was then that Priscilla screamed,
and flames engulfed everything around us.

The air reeked of burning embers,
and a cold blade was aimed at my throat.
Standing there dazed, I heared Priscilla’s voice.

“...I’ll go. So please... Please spare Rean!”

No... No way... Don’t do this!

...That explosion was Priscilla’s power.
She became a witch to protect me,
and those men took her away
in exchange for my life.

Priscilla... Priscilla...!!

I kept calling to her as she left,
forced to wear a crown identical to
the one in our village.

When the carriage carrying Priscilla vanished
into the distance, someone spoke.

“...We will return our witch to where
she belongs. You are not needed.”

Ahh... From the very beginning,
these men never intended to
keep their promise.

Am I going to die here, unable to protect her...?
I can’t let that happen... I can’t...!

Before I knew it, the rage...and the shame
from not being able to keep my promise had
granted me magical power.
One of the men noticed my transformation,
but he was too late.

I won’t let you get away with this...
I will defeat every last one of you...!

I returned to the village, snuck into my house
and stole the crown.

It was a gorgeous crown, said to have been
worn by the witch who founded the village.
To me, it was a symbol of the promise
we made.

It’s the same as the one
they forced her to wear—
the mark of a witch.

On an old paper hidden with the crown,
I read about the group who took Priscilla.

They were a secret society created
by aristocrats—a society that
worshipped the witch.
The witch was rescued by traitors
within the society, allowing her to make
her way here to found this village.

And ever since then,
the society has been searching...
Searching for the village of traitors,
and the witch they were to worship.

If I were to have become a witch sooner,
I could have protected her...

No, it’s too late for excuses.
That’s why, I’m going to go save her now.

I...probably won’t ever return to this village.
After all, if Priscilla and I stay here,
we’ll just be tools to keep
the witch’s bloodline alive.

Wait for me, Priscilla...!
I’ll keep the promise I made to you.
And I will never, ever give up until
we’re together again!

When I was a little brat, I was tossed into
a garbage dump, and have been surviving
all alone ever since.

I gotta have the worst luck in the world
to have been born here...
Sooner or later, I’ll kick the bucket
and join the mountain of trash...
That’s how life is for brats like us.

I’d accepted my fate a long time ago...
but then Miss Val came into my life.

I was covered in food scraps, but not even that
could dissuade her from bringin’ me home
to her orphanage.

Since then, I started livin’ there...
along with Miss Val and other punks.

In the beginning,
everythin’ was confusin’ to me.
I had an actual place to go home to,
warm food...people who’d wait for me
to come home...
Nothin’ but firsts for me.

They were all things I thought belonged to
