a world that was far beyond my reach...

The punks’d come to me, but I didn’t know
how to deal with ’em...
So, I stubbornly kept shuttin’ ’em out.

But they didn’t give up.
They kept talkin’ to me over and over again... and it was only a matter of time until
I finally opened up.
Next thing I knew, I was their big sister.

The world’s messed up,
but things might be a bit better now...
At least, that’s what I thought.
But in the end, the world’s just a pile of crap.
A witch’s flames burned everythin’ down—
the town, the waterways...
and even the orphanage.

I’ll never forgive ya, Witch of Flames!
But, I wonder why...?
Whenever I think that, I remember somethin’
Miss Val told me long ago.

“Violence doesn’t solve anything...
The true answer is forgiveness.”

I’m sorry, Miss Val...but...I can’t...
I can’t forgive this!

When I tried goin’ to the orphanage,
I met a strange guy.
He had a staff that snuffed out
the cursed flames blockin’ my path
in the blink of an eye.

Thanks to him, I could keep goin’,
but this guy says some weird stuff.
You’ll save every single witch?
Heh... Yeah, good luck with that one.

The Witch of Flames is everyone’s enemy.
There’s nothin’ out there
that’ll change my mind.

Miss Val, you’d probably say,
“The true answer is forgiveness...”
But I just can’t forgive the witch
who murdered ya.

Refusin’ to let go of my hatred,
we made our way to the orphanage...
but I wasn’t ready for what was waitin’ for us.

Miss Val...? Wh-Why’s she here?
She’s supposed to be...
Wait, am I seein’ things?
She’s the Witch of Flames?!
Dammit, what the hell’s goin’ on?!

Miss Val burned everythin’ down as if
releasin’ her uncontainable anger...
But it felt as if somewhere...she was cryin’...

I dunno what happened to Miss Val...
but I gotta do somethin’!
I’m her family, so it’s up to me to stop her!

Dammit! It’s no good. My voice can’t reach her.
What should I do? Am I really that useless?!

Then I remembered that lord’s words...
and his goal to save every single witch.

I denied ya once, and I know it ain’t
my duty to say anythin’, but...if you’re really
gonna save every witch out there...

I beg ya... Save Miss Val...!
Lord...please, lend me your power!

There’re so many things
I wanna tell ya, Miss Val.
I’d like to think I survived this far on my own,
but in reality, I was saved by a lotta people.
Without ’em, I wouldn’t have made it this far.

And ever since I met ya, I’ve felt as if
I can live life to the fullest,
even in this crappy world.
If there’s anyone like you,
or the people that saved me out there,
then this world ain’t that bad.

This is our world,
and I don’t wanna lose any of it!

Then the flames died down...
But before they could flare up again,
the lord and I quickly headed towards Miss Val.

She kept mutterin’ the word “hate,”
but I definitely heard somethin’ else—
“Someone, save me...”
Miss Val, I knew it...

The lord readied his staff, but he started to collapse, still feelin’ the effects of the flames.

Get a hold of yerself!
I held the lord up with one hand,
and reached for his staff with the other.
If just one of us ain’t gonna cut it,
then I’ll lend you my power too...

Let’s do this, Lord...!
Miss Val, come back to us!
Return to the gentle person ya once were!

In an instant, rays of light
poured down around us.
They gently put out the flames,
and soothed Miss Val’s heart.

I quickly rushed over to her...
but she just shook off my hand.
Her eyes were still ragin’ with dark flames...

“This world took my children away from me.
I’ll have it pay...by burning everything
to ashes.”

Miss Val’s words... They’re the same as mine
back when I lived in the garbage dump...
I thought there was nothing for me
in this piece of crap world.

But...didn’t ya teach me differently, Miss Val?
Ya once spoke of hope,
so don’t you deny this world...
Don’t you deny yerself!

If you can’t let go of yer grudge,
then leave it be...
Let me be the one to take
that weight off your shoulders...
I’m yer family, after all.
That’s what family’s for, right?

“Belle, I knew you were a kind girl.”

The dark flames were gone from her eyes.
She felt warm...just like the time
she found me in the garbage dump...
Miss Val has come back to us.

Miss Val, no matter where ya go,
I’ll be sure to find ya.
So, let’s go together and see
if this world really is a pile of crap or not...
And if yer grudge ever takes hold of you
again...I’ll be there to stop ya.

“Professor, where might I find
today’s documents?”

After she pondered for a few moments,
I was silently handed the papers.

The professor, who is also my master,
is often thought to be unfriendly
among her colleagues.
But I know she is just slightly awkward.

Recently, her research has not been
going well, and the exhaustion seems
to have caught up to her.

I poured her a cup of tea to try and help her
relieve some of the fatigue, but its contents
have yet to diminish.

This country that I live in is conducting
research on witches.

The professor specializes in the field of
cursed creatures, but I know very little
about her work since she hasn’t once
talked about it around me.

I also never thought to ask about it.

Instead, I did the housework for
the busy professor, while also studying
medicine in hopes of maybe helping
with her research.

I was living every day to the fullest,
and that was good enough for me.

One day, the professor told me to visit
her laboratory together with her.

It was quite unusual...since she tends to
keep her research private.

As soon as we arrived, she handed me
a pile of documents and said,

“Take these and leave this country
immediately.”

It took me a while to understand
what she was saying...

Why...? Have I done something wrong?

No matter what I asked though,
the professor never said a word.

I returned to my room,
and though still in a daze, started packing.

The professor abandoned me...
That was all I had managed to understand.

(Why...? Why won’t you give me a reason?)

Regardless of my opinions though,
the professor’s words cannot be changed.

I began packing the documents she had
given me into my bag...but my hands froze.

“Report on the human experiments...
Wh-What...? What is this...?”

The documents appealed to the King about
some of the experiments being conducted
in this country.

Lists of the inhumane practices used
went on for pages.

I tried to understand what it all meant,
but then, the door behind me opened suddenly.

“Traitorous witch! Hand over the documents!”

There stood the Church’s soldiers,
and a hideous-looking creature,
chained by its neck.

...N-No... That’s not...

This creature... It can’t be...!!

And then...darkness consumed me...
and I lost control.

At that time, Professor...
I thought that you had betrayed me...

That the mutual trust we had for one another...
was nothing but an illusion.

But...I was wrong. You tried to protect me.
The one who didn’t see that...
the one who didn’t understand that...was me.

In the end, I was unable to live up
to your expectations.
I let everything go to waste,
even the precious documents
you entrusted to me...

Why wasn’t I able to realize it?
Why...am I so useless...?

At the end of the long nightmare,
I was invited to Master’s estate.

With him, there’s a chance I’ll discover
a way to turn those cursed creatures—
to turn you back to normal.

And a chance that this time...
I’ll be able to properly protect
the one I serve until the very end.

Which is why, Professor, I’ll be taking
a temporary leave from work.

And once all has been taken care of,
I do hope then you’ll drink that tea
I prepared for you...

I was born into a family of—
what many would call—samurai.

’Twas one renowned for its swordsmanship—
rumored to teach children how to swing
a weapon before they’re even able to stand.

Of course, ’twas not too far from the truth.
My two older brothers and I were taught
proper gripping techniques as soon as
we were able to speak.

“In this house, one’s worth lies in
the strength of their blade.”

Everytime my father spoke those words,
he and my brothers glanced in my direction.

From the moment I was born,
no one anticipated that I’d be able to
accomplish anything.

I’m a girl, and on top of that, I’m small.
With brothers such as mine,
’tis inevitable that I’d be overlooked.

However, I wanted to prove myself at all costs.
Conceding defeat was not an option.

When the time came to choose
my first real blade, I chose a great katana
without even a second thought.

For if I wielded a large weapon that even men
don’t use, I thought I’d earn their praise.

Anything can be mastered—
even a great katana that’s too heavy to control.
One needs just to swing it again...
and again...and again...

And after practicing the katana
countless hours each day,
I eventually became strong enough to
endure a full day’s worth of training.

I even won my first sparring matches
against my brothers.

It looks like I indeed chose
the weapon perfect for me.

However, the more confidence I gained,
the less my father and brothers spoke to me.

Then one day, I was ordered to undergo
a training pilgrimage in the land across the sea.

My brothers and I made our way towards
the faraway land on a trade ship.
I believed I’d finally be acknowledged
if I could bring something back
to show for my efforts.

But well into our voyage, I found myself
suddenly surrounded by the ship’s crew.
With their weapons at the ready, ’twas clear
that they were no mere amateurs.

Then my brothers appeared,
cutting through the mob.
My eldest brother pulled out a letter
and handed it to me.

“Kill her. Make it look like an accident
and dispose of her in the sea...”

’Twas my father’s handwriting.

From the start,
this journey was but a ploy to kill me.

With his blade pointed straight at me,
my eldest brother spoke.

“It is tradition that the strongest succeeds
as the head of the family. But, a woman
must not be allowed the same honor.
For should she find a husband,
he will try and assert his superiority,
and her family would be ridiculed for
marrying off such an unruly woman.”

“You are far too strong.
Thus, to preserve the honor of our great family,
I will have you die...!”

Till now, I thought they would
acknowledge me if I worked hard.
But, apparently that was all
one big misunderstanding.

If I really was just leading myself on though...
they should’ve said so from the beginning...!

I...I just wanted the chance to be
recognized by you all...!

When the last assailant breathed their last,
I stood on deck, untouched by even
the slightest drop of blood.

The ocean breeze begins to cool
my body from the heat of battle.

Fighting is the only thing I can do.
Aside from training and growing stronger,
I know nothing.

But...what do I fight for? And for whom?

No longer do I have a place to call home,
let alone a reason for fighting.
The seagulls cry overhead,
and land approaches on the horizon.

Still without a clear answer,
I drifted towards this new land,
drawn in by the wind and the waves.

My lord, when we met at the end of my travels,
it all became clear to me.

That you—the one who accepted me—
are whom I am to serve.

And I knew that if you acknowledged me,
I could surely sever ties with my past self.

From the day I was born,
I was but a blade without a master.
Yet, you provided me with what I had been
searching for this whole time.

A reason to fight, a home,
as well as...acknowledgement...praise...
and a place by your side...

From this point on, I will grow even stronger,
and it will all be for you.

I shall become the blade that cleaves
every obstacle in your path...

You have my word—
your kindness will be repaid.

All I remember about my father is the feeling
of his big hand softly petting my head.

My grandmother told me that
he was a soldier...and that he died in battle.

Yes. Since the day I was born, this country
has been in a constant state of war.

On the border, in a village said to have been
founded by a witch, I was born and raised
by my grandmother.

When my sickly mother heard of
my father’s death, she collapsed,
and has been hospitalized
in the capital ever since.

I’m only able to visit her
once or twice each year.

Despite that though, it’s thanks to those three
that I never succumbed to loneliness.

I have three childhood friends.

Two have the same peach colored hair—
the energetic Rean,
and the quiet, gentle Priscilla.
And the third is a slightly older girl that
came from outside the village—Skuld.

The ever knowledgable Skuld taught
Priscilla and I about a variety of things.
Rean and I always used to chase after
one another, too.

The four of us would go exploring in
the forest...and then get scolded by
Skuld’s sisters.

It may have only been a few years...
but we felt like the closest of sisters.

Skuld left the village and a few years passed.

In that time, both my mother
and grandmother passed away,
and I was left with Rean and Priscilla.

The war continued.
When the flames of war make their way here...
how am I supposed to protect these two?

I was reminded of that big
warm hand on my head.
...Father...

I went and knocked on the doors
to the Officers Academy.
This was the only way I could think of
to protect them.

Having finished training,
I was assigned to the troop that was
under the direct command of an aristocrat.

It seemed the life of a soldier suited me.

That day, my commander—the aristocrat
that stood at the top of our troop—
called me to headquarters.

“Are there any legends passed down
in your hometown?”

I thought it a strange question,
but answered nonetheless.

“My hometown is said to
have been founded by a witch.”

My village was attacked by the troop
a few days later.

That’s right...! I told the commander—!

When I realized it, it was too late.
When I rushed to the village, my eyes were
greeted by smoky pillars of flames,
dead bodies piled on top of one another,
and soldiers, crudely laughing at it all.

Their eyes met mine,
their weapons at the ready.
It seems I’m the last survivor.

Ahh... In the end, I can’t protect anything...!

My blood boiled with anger and remorse.

So with sword in hand, I hacked and slashed...
refusing to stop until I had slaughtered
every last one of them.

The last one standing was the commander.
Before finishing off that aristocrat, I asked him,

“Why did you attack my village?”

He answered that everything was for
his “beloved witch,” and that he planned
to make me disappear along with
everyone else.

That aristocrat...was a member of
a secret society that worships a witch.
To this day, they loathe the ones that
escaped with their beloved witch long ago,
and have been searching for the village
of their decendants.

That village...was my village.

I didn’t see my friends in
the mountain of dead bodies.

Even when I interrogated that aristocrat,
he said he hadn’t seen them either.

So...I decided to look for the two—
no, the three of them.

I want to apologize for not
being able to protect the village.
But...more than anything,
I just want to see them once more.

Skuld, Rean, Priscilla...
They’re all I have left.

You guys don’t have to forgive me...
So...

The Church of Longinus possesses something
that’s said to have been given to them
by angels—the Staff of Tikkun.
It’s believed to be what would save the world
when it’s brought to the brink of ruin.

I was raised to be a priestess who could
manifest the Staff’s full power.

The training was rigorous,
but I have no complaints.
There’s nothing more important than
my duty to save the world, after all.

Then, the day came when I met
the one who’d inherit the Staff.
The Duke of Fran—
the country of flowers and windmills.

I was curious about him.
Although a duke, he was full of kindness
that made smiles flourish all around—
just like a flower.

There should’ve been nothing more important
to me than the fate of the world.
But as days went by,
I found it harder and harder to
think of anything else but him.

Humanity faced a crisis that
was lying in wait deep underground.

This world is protected by the Tree of Life
and the angels who inhabit it.
And from its roots grows the Tree of Death,
where demons who wish for
humanity’s destruction live.

Those very demons were seeking a way
to return to our world.

The Staff of Tikkun turns despair into hope,
and bonds into power.
Its purpose—to vanquish
those demons and seal them away.

It’s said that only those who trust and love
humanity from the bottoms of their hearts
can handle its power.
Master loved peace, so it was only natural
that he was the one chosen to wield it.

The day the demons break
the seal was finally here.
A giant crater rips the land wide open,
and a lone demon emerges onto the surface.

Standing in its way were warriors gathered
from all around the world.

Knights who inherited the power of dragons.
Witches who had mastered the forbidden arts.
Monarchs who were called
humanity’s strongest.

Nations once at war joined hands
in the face of this crisis.
This was only possible because Master
can turn our bonds into power.

There’s no enemy that we can’t overcome,
because we know full well the strength
that humans possess when they trust
each other.

But, we had forgotten.
Demons are as powerful as angels,
with strength that can oppose
even God Himself.

It didn’t take long for the combined forces of
humanity’s strongest to be completely
annihilated—by that lone demon.

Protected by the Staff, the only ones left
standing were Master and me.

The seal is broken.
What started as one unbeatable demon
turned into an infinite horde
that poured out of the crater.

Even though the world was
now coming to an end,
Master refused to surrender.

If a witch’s power comes from her heart,
then his comes from the bonds he has
with others.

The man loved by people all over the world
took the staff of hope and released
every last ounce of its power.

The light that poured out from the Staff
bathes the land like the morning sun.
This power from God purges the demons
and sends them straight back to Hell.
But, it was too much power for
a single human to endure.

Master started to collapse.
But, he didn’t even notice his own
predicament—only mine.
Because my body had also began
losing its strength.

How can you worry about anyone else
at a time like this...?
That’s how you are,
and that’s why I chose to
devote my entire life to you.

My kind master.
Please allow me to stay by your side
till the very end.

The world was saved, but at great cost.
The thought of dying terrified me,
but if Master’s with me...

As I gazed at him next to me,
he raised the Staff into the air.
He gave me a smile and said,
“I won’t let you die.”

My body is beginning to heal?
Why...? It can’t be—he’s giving his life to...
No! If you do that...!

Master’s lifeless body falls to the ground.
I immediately raise the Staff into the air.
If I give this life back, I can save him!
But...

Why? Why isn’t anything happening?!
Isn’t the Staff supposed to save people—
to protect the ones important to us?!
There’s no one more important to me
than him!

If now’s not the time to
use this power, when is?!
I still have time!
So, I beg you...answer my prayer...
Save Master...!
Take my life and give it back to him!!

I cry...and I scream...
but the Staff doesn’t respond.
The Staff gives its power to the ones
who love the world and the people in it.

There’s only one person I loved—
only one person I wished to save.
So the Staff no longer listened to me.

200 years have passed since then.
Ever since Master sacrificed his life
to save mine, I continue to live
without aging a day.

To bring him back, I’ve even sullied
my hands in forbidden arts.
But the only thing I’ve learned is that
one cannot overturn God’s laws on life.
The dead...do not come back.

I know full well, but the reason
I wish otherwise is...

It appears that the demons are once again
attempting to return.
This life was entrusted to me,
and now is the time to use it.

...Oh dear, a frightening thought
just crossed my mind.
Demons can rise up against God Himself.
Perhaps...even overturn His laws...

I’m kidding. My life is a gift from Master.
It’s only natural that I protect the world
that he loved so much.

For that is the final role
I am meant to play.

I’ve been a witch from the day I was born.

Raised in a village made up of witches
and their families, I grew up thinking
that being a witch was normal.

I mean my mom’s a witch,
and all my neighbors were witches...

My whole life revolved around witches.

As per village law, I tried not to
involve myself with “normal” people...

But I was always so jealous of
the people in the books I read—
free to live their lives however they want
in the outside world.

“Witches aren’t the only ones that can’t do
what they want, you know. Suck it up.”

That’s what Mom always used to say.

We had to live in secrecy,
deep within the mountains,
giving up on having any form of a life.

I thought I had come to accept it,
but somewhere deep in my heart
I was screaming.

“Am I seriously okay with this?!
God, I’m such a coward!”

“Have you heard about the lord
from the country next door?”

One day, I learned of a lord that’s
apparently protecting witches.

This is probably my first and last chance
at changing my life.

Determined to start anew,
I set out for the country he was in.

From here on, it’s a new me.
No more of this giving up on my dreams.
I’ll live life my own way!

With my heart overflowing with
courage and hope, I fled the village, but...

It wasn’t long before I was captured
by the Knights of Longinus.

They shackled my hands...
and threw me into a dark jail cell.

“I’m so cold...”

All I did was leave the village...
Why does this have to happen to me?
Why...?

My heart was about to be crushed by despair.
But then, out of nowhere...
that lord—he appeared.

My lord didn’t just save me,
he gave me freedom.

And yet, I still haven’t been able to
do anything for him in return.

I’m a weak, good-for-nothing
country bumpkin...
And on top of all that, I’m a witch.

I know that with the way I am now,
I’ll never get anywhere.

But one day, I will become someone who
has the confidence to stand by his side.

I’d never be able to tell this to his face...
but that’s my dream.

Just you watch, my lord.
This time, I’ll change for sure.

I started living at my lord’s mansion,
but...man, there sure are a ton of
pretty people around him.
I won’t give up though!
The me that used to live
behind excuses is long gone.
This is the new me.

Day one! For starters,
I tried changing my hairstyle.
No reaction... Well, it is the first day, after all!

Day two. I tried changing my clothes.
No reaction... I-I’m just getting started!

Day three. I tried putting on perfume.
Come on... Nothing...
I don’t know how much longer
I can keep this up...

Day four. We met in the hallway.
H-Hold on! I haven’t prepared myself...
Huh...? It’s amazing how I always
give it my all? Me?
Watching me gives you
the courage to try harder...?

Wh-What’s with that...?
Are you trying to kill me here?
I know you don’t mean it like that,
but...now I just wanna try even harder...

One day...I’ll become a girl so pretty,
you’ll never be able to look away.
So don’t let me go, okay?

I love the color red.

A long time ago...I saw a beautiful,
bright red that drove me crazy.

Wanting to see that red again,
I searched far and wide.

But, no matter where I went,
I couldn’t find it.

“What do we do now, Emma?
Mhm... What was that?
Hmm... That’s a great idea!”

If it’s the red dripping from my favorite dolls,
it must be a pretty red—the same one
that drove me crazy.

Emma was the one that told me that.

So, I went after my favorite dolls
so they could show me that pretty red.

But, it’s weird.
Everyone will be playing with me one day,
and then the next...

...they’ll be gone.
Isn’t that weird, Emma?
Where did everyone go?

It’s okay. I’m sure we’ll meet
again somewhere.
So, for now...

“Let’s go find a new doll.”

One day, I found a beautiful red in town.
It was different from the one I was looking for,
but I liked this one, too.

This beautiful red that shined on
the apples at a nearby fruit stall.

“Hello. May I have that red apple, please?”

“Ahh, I’m sorry, my dear,
but you don’t have enough money.”

The stall owner didn’t give me my red.

It’s my red,
so why doesn’t he give it to me...?

“He’s a bad man, isn’t he, Emma?”

The bad man who took my red
away from me—I hate him!

But, if I soak him in a bright, pretty red...
maybe I’ll like him.

It was then that a man with a staff
appeared in front of me.
He wasn’t in red...
but he still had a beautiful color.

He got my red apple back for me.

“Yeah, you’re right, Emma.
He was a really nice man.
But...he’s not red.”

Today I explored the nice man’s town.

I’ve been around red so much that seeing
all the different colors felt kind of...
new to me...

This town didn’t have the red
I’m looking for either, but...
I still like it here, because he’s here!

Though, it seems like bad things
happen even in his town.
While I was walking around,
I met a bad doll.

They hit Emma...and pulled my hair!
I couldn’t believe it!

What a bad doll...
Bullying someone smaller
than them like that...
I hate them!

So Emma scolded them.
Poor Emma... It hurt, didn’t it?

I thought I might start to like them
if I soaked them in red, but...
looks like it didn’t work.
I still hate them.

Maybe it’s best to just color
my favorite things in red.
My favorite thing... Hmm...

It’s him...!
I love the dolls in his mansion, too,
but he’s definitely my favorite.

If I soak him in a deep red...
I’m sure I’ll love him even more!
Don’t you think so, too, Emma?

Now then, Emma,
let’s head back to his place!

Let’s give him some red clothes
as a present for always playing with us!

Huh...? He’s not accepting my gift...?
I wonder why...?

Hehe, he’s probably just shy.
He’ll accept it one day though, right?

Ever since then, Emma and I have been
together with him!♪
With him, we get to play with lots of dolls!

Hey, Mister.
One day, I really hope you’ll wear
these red clothes for me.
But for now...let’s play, okay?♪

I wonder when people started calling me
“The Witch of the Deep Forest.”

Witches have been the only ones
to ever find me, so it was probably
one of them that started it.

Growing up in this deep forest,
avoiding human contact...
It’s really the perfect nickname for me.

Hey, Mister Apprentice,
would you listen to my story?

The story of my master...
and the mistake I made
that can never be undone...

“Good job, Merlyn.”

My master was someone that
always complimented me.

She took me in after I had been abandoned,
and gave me a new name.

Everything I know about magic,
I learned from her—a beautiful, kind witch,
who baked the best pumpkin pies.

When I gifted her flowers I had bloomed
with my magic for the first time,
she complimented me with
the brightest smile on her face.
I was so flattered, it made me
want to practice even harder.

My master’s birthday was fast approaching.

I wanted to get a present for her,
but things from the forest won’t do—
they’re all too familiar to her.
After all, she’s the one
who knows this place best.

So I racked my brain for hours
trying to find a good idea.

That’s it! The flowers that
I bloomed with my magic!
She loved those!

It’ll be perfect! I’ll bloom lots of flowers
and give her a bouquet for her birthday!

With that in mind, I closed my eyes
and concentrated on my magic.

When I opened my eyes, I...I had made
a mistake that can never be undone.

“Help, Master!”

My scream for help quickly disappeared in
the sea of rampaging plants.

“Merlyn!”

A warm hand grabbed my arm,
and in that moment,
my consciousness fell into darkness.

When I awoke, all that was left
was my master’s hat...in a pool of blood.

Since then, my magic has tried to devour me
everytime I blame myself for what happened.

But I’ve done my best to hold it back.

Because if I let this power consume me,
it’ll be the greatest insult to my master.

This magic that she taught me,
and all her great accomplishments—
I want to share them with someone.

But if I get close to them,
they’re going to end up like my master...

What should I do?
What do I even want to do?

If only there was someone who would
venture through this forest to see me...

But...
If someone actually comes to see me,
how should I greet them?
How should I talk to them?

The only relationship I know is the one
between a master and their apprentice.

...And besides, there’s no way someone
like me could ever teach anyone...
let alone guide an apprentice like
my master once had.

With how incompetent I am,
I might not even be able to protect them
in the face of danger.

I struggled to find the confidence
I needed within myself,
but then, the one that appeared before me...
was you, Mister Apprentice.

I’m sorry. I’m sure there were probably
plenty of better ways to call you back then.

But...those words just sort of
rolled off my tongue.
“Won’t you become my apprentice?”

Um... Hey, Mister Apprentice.
I’ve still got a lot to learn...but someday,
I swear I’ll become a magnificent witch
just like my master was.

And then, hopefully...I’ll be able to protect
you and your loved ones from anything.

...You give me the confidence to
believe that I can achieve this.

So...if you’re okay with someone like me,
I hope you’ll let me always stay by your side,
my dear Mister Apprentice.

What led me to learn I had become a witch...?
I have no clue.

Before I knew it, I had been abandoned...
and before I knew it, I had been taken in.

A traveling circus just happened to be in town.
Lively voices poured out from inside
the flashy tent.

It was so strange...seeing people go in and out
with bright smiles on their faces.

After having stood outside for the entire performance, the circus troupe took me in
as one of their own.

That is pretty much the first thing I remember.
Yes. My entire life began with the circus.

The troupe found out pretty quickly that
I was a witch, but they didn’t mind.

Because while they may not have been
witches themselves, they, too, were
the black sheep of the lot.

I started out as an assistant,
and before long, they gave me a test
to see what my act would be.

I was a clown, a trapeze artist,
a beast master...but, I kinda sucked at
everything.

The only thing I was good at...
were these girls—my pistols.

I lived a pretty happy life after that.
All while concealing the fact that I was
a witch from the audience, of course.

Slowly but surely, I started getting fans!

I remember the time I performed
in a small village...

There was this young girl who,
while hugging a gunslinger doll,
called out to me.
“The world’s greatest gunslinger!” she said.
I was so happy...

But when the witches’ Curse started
spreading throughout the continent,
people would turn us down, saying they
“weren’t in the mood for the circus.”
They drove us out... They cursed at us...
Honestly, it was pretty painful.

But you know...what hurt more than
all of that put together...was the fact that
I couldn’t put smiles on their gloomy faces.

After the Curse had covered
the entire continent,
we returned to that small village.
To the place where my cute little fan was.

But...the Curse had sent everything to ruin.
There wasn’t a single moving body in sight.

Among the rubble...is where I found it.
That small gunslinger doll.

Its neck ripped off...
Its body...stained in blood.

No... No way...!
I... I...!

Is...is there really nothing I can do
for them in the circus?

What...what should we do...?
What should I do...?

...Monsters!

On our way to our next destination,
we came across some refugees
being chased by cursed creatures.

A young girl—about the same age
as my little fan—was being chased
by a creature.

...I’m sure if I use my magical power,
I can save her.

Ignoring my troupemates’ warnings,
I unleashed my full potential
for the very first time.

A large target.
No need to aim.
All I need...is this one shot!

As I watch the creature fall to the ground,
I let my fate play out in my head.

I’m sure someone’ll call
the Knights of Longinus,
and I’ll be captured in an instant...
The least I can do is make sure
I don’t cause trouble for anyone.

Maybe I’ll say I hid my existence
as a witch from the troupe...

Or maybe I’ll say I was just passing by...

I tried to think of ways for only me
to be captured by the Knights...
But, I didn’t need to use any of them.

Because no one called the Knights.

Instead, people erupted
with cheers of gratitude.
They were happy.
They were smiling.

...Ahh, I see.
I love the thundering applause
and happy faces of the audience
more than anything in the whole world.

With this power of mine...
maybe I’ll be able to bring
that happinessback to them.

...That’s when I decided—
to go on an adventure.

...Sunrise.

I try to leave the tent quietly,
but the dazzling light from the spotlight
stops me in my tracks.

Oh, come on...
Here I thought I’d leave
without you all knowing.
I really can’t hide things from you guys, huh...?
Hehehe.

“The world’s greatest gunslinger, Cordie!
In celebration of your departure,
let the circus...begin!”

The tent erupts with festivities that are
in no way befitting of a farewell.

I hate to do this, but...there’s no way
I can stay till the end of the show.
If I do, I’m sure I won’t want to leave anymore.

Leaving my tears as they are,
I make my way out of the tent
one stride at a time.

The lively voices of everyone
illuminating my way.
In hopes of one day returning to shine
under the dazzling spotlight once more.

“Please...believe me...”

Grown ups are liars.
They tell me Mommy and Daddy left me.
No... I’m just...lost.
Yeah...that’s all...

Bad kids have to stay outside.
I must’ve been bad...that’s why
they won’t let me inside, right?

If I can be a good kid...
then Mommy and Daddy will
let me back home...

“I’m so cold...
I gotta hurry and go home.”

Hmm... That’s weird...
My home’s not here either...

Lemme go look over there next.
I’m sure it’s there...

...Wait, what’s “home” again?

Mmm... It’s warm...and cozy...and shiny...
That’s what home is.

I’m hungry...and cold.
But, it’s okay.
If I can just find my home,
I’ll be so happy.

Parents don’t let bad kids come home.
Not liars or thieves, either.

I’m okay, I can still walk.
I’ll try that town next...

It’s gotta be here...
Hm? Who...are you?

You’re...my first friend.
I was lonely, but you spoke to me.
You’re so nice...
Can you stay with me forever?
Thank you! I’m so happy!

I’m so hungry...
but stealing is what bad kids do,
so I won’t do that.

What’s this...?
An apple? For me? Thank you!

...It’s so yummy!
Wait, who are you guys...?

I’m...an apple thief?
No way! I got this apple from my friend!

I’m not lying! It’s the truth!
Hey, you tell them, too!
You gave me this apple, right? Right!?

Wait... Wh-Why...are you laughing at me?
Did you...trick me?

You lied to me...from the start...?
About being friends...?
About staying with me forever...?
Everything?

It’s not me!
Stealing is what bad kids do.
I’m not...bad...
so why does everyone hate me?

Nobody...believes me...
Everyone hurts me...
They’re so mean...

Is it because I’m a witch?
Because...I’m bad?
Is that why...nobody believes me?

Then, what about everyone?
They lie, throw rocks, hit, and kick...
I think they’re the bad ones.

Parents don’t let bad kids come home...
So then...why does everyone else have a home,
even though they’re bad...?

It’s only me...with no home...
Nobody believes me...
Nobody listens to me...

Is it because...I’m a witch?
If I wasn’t...would people believe me...?

I came to this new town...
but it’s the same here, too.
Nobody believes me...
because...I’m a witch.

I met a strange guy.
He protected me from
the grown ups in this town.
But, I know better...
This guy is just like...

“...Huh? You...believe...me?”
Liar! You’re trying to trick me!

I hate you! Go away!
If you’re that nice to me, I...
might start believing you.

Maybe...I’ll give “believing” another try.
This guy’s...different...

Uuu... You’re petting me too much.

Hey Master, gimme a hug.

Master makes me all warm and fuzzy...
I’ve always wanted this.

Hey Master, can I sleep with you tonight...?

Master, please stay with me...
forever and ever, ’kay?
Hehehe. Promise?
I love you, Master!

...30682.
That’s the number of homunculi
I’ve made so far.
I haven’t kept count, but that’s
the latest specimen’s serial number,
so I’ve figured as much.

The average lifespan of
a homunculus is three days.
However, out of all the specimens thus far,
this new one has the most potent magic power.
Three days have passed, but its heart
has yet to cease functioning.

If I can develop this specimen into a witch,
then it will mean tremendous progress
for my research.

Understanding how to turn a person
into a witch should also shed light on
how to do the reverse.
Hence, I should be able to restore
this cursed body of mine.

A puppet devoid of emotions
can’t use magic powers.
My plan to turn this homunculus into
a witch was experiencing setbacks.

One day, the Pope visited my laboratory.
I had no idea what would bring the supreme
authority of the Church of Longinus here,
but she was shockingly well-versed
in my field of work.

Existence. The Tree of Life.
Witches and angels. The heart and the soul...
What sounded like myths the Church would
preach about recounted our world in
incredible detail.

God created this world.
Within each of us exists a soul,
and angels reside in the heavens above.
They all seemed like works of fiction
written by a child, but what if they were true...?

I formulated a completely new theory
based on these myths, and I saw magic powers
finally manifest in my new specimen.

I named the specimen “A.A.”
Thanks to her, all of my experiments
progressed immensely.

What is a witch? What is a soul?
To know those answers is to know
the secret of life.

Before I knew it, I had lost sight of my mission,
completely immersing myself in research
and inhumane experiments.
The truth of the world is within my grasp,
filling me with ecstacy that drowned out
any feeling of guilt.

But one day, as I was leading A.A. to
the laboratory by the hand,
I felt her squeeze back.

Her hand was far smaller than mine.
It’s laughably thin and looked as if
it could snap at any moment.
Yet, she grasped my fingers
as tightly as she could.

It was at that moment that I understood.
I wasn’t creating puppets...
I was creating “lives.”

“Professor, what is the ‘sky?’”

Little A asked me that question
after I let her read a book.

She has no clue what the sky is
because she’s never set foot
outside the laboratory.
I showed her some photographs,
but that just added to her bewilderment.

No amount of words or photographs
can convey how blue and beautiful the sky is.
After staring at the collections of blue ink
for a while, she looked up at the laboratory
ceiling and muttered in curiousity,
“The sky here is so white...”

“I sure hope you can see the real sky one day.”

“That would be nice,” she replied,
her emotionless eyes trembling
ever so slightly.

Is there any way to show Little A the sky?

If I learned of a witch who could control light,
I went to ask them if they’d make
a sky for Little A.
If I got word of a book with beautiful
photographs of the sky, I procured it at once.

My research falls behind,
and I spend more time exclusively
on these “experiments.”

By the time I realized it,
she was the only thing I could think about.

“I would destroy the world for my child.”
Whenever I’d read books with that
line of thinking, I’d find them to be illogical.

Weighing the life of one against
the rest of humanity?
It would be ludicrous to compare.
But...

The average lifespan of
a homunculus is three days.
Little A has marvelously lived for one year,
but that miracle won’t last much longer.

I’ll make sure she lives longer,
even if it’s just a day.
For that reason alone,
I joined the Pope’s “Qlipha Project...”
all the while knowing it would result in
the end of the world.

The project succeeds as expected,
conjuring forth an angel.
The archangel of the seventh Sephirah—
Haniel, the Angel of Love.

Although created as a heartless puppet,
Little A was made to host the Angel of Love
within her body. How ironic.

Or perhaps, it’s because she’s a puppet,
that she wished for a love that
wasn’t meant to exist.

The power of a witch is
influenced by her emotions.
Powers can manifest from happiness and joy,
but something more powerful is evoked
from pain and sadness.

We have many “treasures” in our lives—
the time we spend enjoying meals with family,
conversations with friends, being near
the people important to us...

They’re normal everyday things to us...
but if we were to lose even one of them,
we’d surely cry out in distress.

But what if there was someone who
only had one of those “treasures?”
Once it’s gone, how much agony
would that person suffer?

The Kingdom of Byrune was destroyed
by a Curse—one that turns everything to rust.
A curse of a love gone completely berserk.

How much power can the Tree of Life give?
How long does a homunculus-turned-witch
have to live?
Everything is new to me,
so I don’t have a clue.

But I’m sure my time with Little A will be short.

We might have 10 more years...
or we might have until tomorrow...

I’m bound to accept punishment
for my sins one day, but I regret nothing.

Even if what lies ahead is
the most painful of goodbyes...
Even if my soul will be shattered to pieces...

I will never forget all the warm memories
Little A gave me...for the rest of my life.

I was born into a noble family
with a long history of knights.
I’m a girl, but I was rigorously raised
as if I were a boy.

If my father wanted an heir,
he could have adopted one.
But he loved my late mother so deeply,
that he decided to raise me—
his only child—with his own hands.

I endured ruthless training
to meet his expectations,
and before long, I became a knight.

“Be proud till the end,
and swear unending loyalty to your lord.
That is the honor of a knight,”
my father preached, his lessons being
engraved into my heart.

My first lord was the master of
a middle-ranking family of nobles.

He was a greedy and arrogant man,
but since I was appointed as his knight,
I felt obligated to fulfill my duties.

However, his people couldn’t bear
his tyrannical ways.
They staged a revolt,
and he perished in the chaos.

It all happened while I was away
from his side...for I was ordered to
evacuate his daughter to safety...
...How pathetic of me.
I failed to protect my lord...

My next lord was the son in
a high-ranking family of nobles.
I devoted everything to him,
vowing to not let the same tragedy
happen twice...
But, I failed yet again...
I let him die.

My second lord had a target on his back...
He was caught in the middle of
a vicious dispute over inheritance.

He was in the company of
other knights, including myself.
But assassins slipped into our ranks...
and our entire convoy was massacred.

I was the only one left.
Knowing what must be done to
protect my lord, I raised my weapon.

I’ll stop the enemy even if it costs me my life.
If I can just fulfill my purpose as a knight,
then I will gladly leap into the arms of death...!
So long as my lord is safe...

But in the end, I once again failed to protect.
Instead, I was the one who was protected.
In exchange for my life, he turned
his own blade against himself...and perished.

Why...? Why protect me...?
A knight’s role is to protect their lord...
but I’ve never once been able to
accomplish that!

The harsh truth is...
everyone who gets close to me...
ends up dead.

I served many lords since then,
for I knew I had to keep pushing forward.
I even deliberately took on as many
dangerous missions as I could.

However, death came knocking at
the doors of every lord I served.
Powerless to prevent their deaths...
I eventually became known as
the “Harbinger of Death.”

I thought the name suited me.
After all...I let each and every one
of my lords die.

My ambition was to be a proud knight,
but continuing on this path would just
lead to more people suffering.
If that is my fate, I will cast
my knighthood away,
and live a life of solitude...

The moment I made that decision,
a young child paid me a visit.
She said to me,
“Would you do me the honor of
serving as my knight?”

I refused her, saying,
“I am one who beckons death...
and I will surely bring disaster your way.”

“You don’t die because you are strong,
and for that, I am alive.”
Hearing her words,
I remembered who she was.

It was her—the daughter of my first lord.
Ah, I see... There actually was someone
I was able to protect.

I only ever counted the number of
lives lost under my watch,
never considering anything else...
even though there certainly were
a number of lives I did save...

If my sins are forgiven...
I will take my oath as a knight once more.
I will protect this child’s future with my life.

After spending the next several years
together...a riot erupted in town.
I escorted her to her carriage
in an effort to help her escape...

She climbed inside, and in that instant...
the carriage burst into flames.
I felt shards of wood and sparks
graze my cheeks.

Immediately, I thrusted my arms
into the flames.
“I have to save her...!
I have to save the kind-hearted girl
who believed in me...!”

But the undying flames consumed everything...
their heat preventing me from getting
any closer to the wreckage.

“Don’t you dare take her...!
If I am to be cursed with this fate of death,
then take me instead.
I’ll die as many times as it takes!
So please, spare her...!”

The flames were hot enough to burn
my arms off...but that was nothing
compared to the ice freezing my heart...

When the flames completely subsided,
I held what was left of her in my arms.

My eyes saw complete darkness...
It felt as if a part of me...disappeared...

I later learned that the explosion
was meant...for me.
Villains with a grudge against me
tampered with the carriage...
She was just dragged into this disaster!
She died...all because of me...

I kept on this path with nothing but
my knight’s pride in my heart...
But instead of protecting lives,
I just destroy them...

Suddenly...a bright light pierced
through the darkness...
Someone reached their hand out to me...
But, I have no right to take it.
Should the owner of this hand take mine,
then they, too, will...

As those dark thoughts clouded my mind...
I felt a push forward...from two small hands...

Someone whispered softly...
“Live. The futures of many are
waiting for you...
Don’t forget that...”

Yes, that’s right...
This is her final command to me...
so I must answer to it.
For I am...a knight!

I can’t die—not yet.
I must live on...for I now know
there is something I must do.

“With this life that’s bound to everyone...
for the protection of their futures...”
I offer my sword! I swear this
on my knight’s—on my pride...!

Witches are hated for being impure.
If you want to survive, you have no choice
but to get strong.

That’s why I joined
the Young Knights of Longinus.

At first they mocked me,
saying witches would be terrible knights.
But, all the crazy training
brought us closer together.

If I’m here, I’ll be able to survive.

But, the relief didn’t last long.
We fought an enemy nation’s squadron
and were wiped out...
I was captured.

At this rate, I’m definitely gonna get executed.

As I slumped in my cell,
there was a sudden burst of noise outside.

I looked through the peephole,
and saw bandits attacking the military.

I’d heard rumors about these bandits.
They were ruffians from the mountains
who attacked knights and military alike.

Their fighting was so barbaric,
the knight in me couldn’t comprehend it.
At the same time though,
it looked...so beautiful.
I couldn’t stop staring.

But looking at my situation, I knew execution
was the only thing waiting for me.
So...I called to them.

“My family’s rich! I’ll pay you anything
you want if you set me free!”

I was worried if they’d buy it or not,
but they rescued me.

Thanks to them, I was able to
go home in one piece...

...But, my home...was gone.

The Young Knights were completely destroyed.

They had retreated after the fight,
so the commander killed everyone to
cover up the truth.

I was declared a traitor, and became
wanted for mass murder and treason.

But you’re the real traitor...
I’ll never forgive you. I’ll hunt you down.

My heart was overtaken by hatred and despair.
But then, the chief of the bandits said to me,

“Stay strong. Live strong.”

“If you’ve got nowhere to go, then come along.
We’ll raise you to be a strong bandit.”
Hearing those words, I took his hand.

When I first joined the bandits,
my endless thoughts of revenge
would drive me mad.

But, the chief never once abandoned me.

I haven’t even rewarded them for saving me,
though... Not to mention, I’m a witch...!
So then, why...?

Seeing my anxiety grow, the chief said to me,

“I promised to save you...
We keep our word, even if it kills us.
So from now on, this is your home...
Welcome home, Garmr.”

What the heck...
You’re outta your mind.
But...I was so happy.

And so, I became a bandit—
a bandit of the cool and powerful
Mountain Tribe.

Since then, I worked hard, and was even
named as the chief’s successor.
I still loathed that horrible man,
but now, I had something more important.

I had the Mountain Tribe,
and had parted ways with
my resentful past self.
At least, that’s what I thought...

He came back.
The one who murdered all my comrades
was now raiding our hideout.

He was full of it, claiming he was here to
subjugate the corrupted witch.
But in reality, he came to kill me...
because I knew the truth.

Everyone was massacred—even the chief.
He tried to protect those who couldn’t escape,
but was gunned down.

Dark thoughts reemerged inside me.
You’re gonna take my friends away
from me again...?!
Then, as if encouraging me,
the chief’s words flashed in my mind.

“Stay strong... Kill him... Kill ’em all.”

Obeying those words,
I released my magic power...
To kill all my enemies.
To prove the strength of the Tribe.

Darkness overtook me, and I lost control.

I couldn’t tell friend or foe,
attacking all who approached me
one after another.

The one to bring me back was him,
and it wasn’t just because of
the power from that strange staff of his.
For some reason, just being around him
calms me down.

It’s as if I’m next to the chief...
Though, they don’t resemble
each other in any way.

But thanks to him, I could remember
what the chief really said.

“Stay strong. Live strong.”

I’m not as strong as the chief yet.
But, as one of the Mountain Tribe,
and the final one to inherit the chief’s wisdom,
I will live strong.

So please, watch over me, everyone.

I used to have two older sisters—
Urd and Belldandy.

Urd was clever, and Belldandy
was fashionable...
I looked up to them.

One day, my family brought me
along to a remote village.
There, I met three wonderful girls.

My heart skipped a beat when I heard that
I’d be staying for a few years to study medicine.
It was the same excitement I felt
whenever I discovered new herbs.

I had found new friends...no, new sisters.
I’m younger than Urd and Belldandy,
but I’m older than these girls.
In other words, I’m their big sister.

Time passed, and the day I had to
leave the village finally came.
The girls smiled through
their tears as they saw me off.

I had to attend school, but I promised to
come back when there was a holiday.

But one day, everything changed...
and I could no longer keep that promise...

My sisters died. I lost them in an accident...
Instantly, my bright world was
enveloped in dark clouds.

The first one to crack was Mother.
It happened one day,
when she started calling me...Urd.

Mother become delusional...
She had illusions that Urd was younger,
and Belldandy was still in her womb...

Time had returned to before I...
before Skuld was born...
Mother continued to call me Urd,
and Father, unable to take any more,
got up and left.

I was the only one left to
take care of my mother.
But instead, I escaped to school
and buried myself in research.

Being away from home,
I could finally be me again...
My heart felt so free.

I even made a friend.
She wasn’t the nicest person...
but she made school fun.

But I knew...
If I went back home,
I would once again stop being me...

I came home to hear laughter
coming from inside.
Mother’s...laughing?

While I was away,
Mother’s health had improved.
Some man I didn’t know had been
taking care of her.

She still thought I was Urd,
and was convinced that
Belldandy was lost in a miscarriage...

But without warning, she said to me,
“Let’s go our separate ways.
Live your life as you like.”

Up until now, I believed I had been
supporting Mother in my own way.

Everything I ever did for her...
It all meant...nothing...

In the end, she never again saw me as Skuld.
This “Skuld” person...
I wonder if she really exists...

Urd, Belldandy, Skuld.
The three of us were sisters.

But then they died, Mother lost her mind,
and my life faded away from me.

“Live your life as you like...”
It was all just a ruse to get rid of me.
I not only lost my name, but my home, too.

No... I never had either of them to begin with.
I only existed in the shadow of my sisters,
and never once had a place I could be me.

Who the heck...am I...?
I might as well not even be alive.

I have no evidence that shows who,
or what I am.
So I’m sure that can only mean
one thing—“Skuld” doesn’t exist.

Skuld waits at death’s door.
Only her consciousness remains intact...
barely keeping her alive.

So then, why...?
Why am I still not dead?
Disappear already... I’m begging you...
Just...disappear...

“Skuld...”

I heard someone’s voice.
It called me...“Skuld.”
I remembered my past...
I remembered my three younger sisters.

This memory of them, lovingly calling me
their big sister Skuld...
It belongs to me, and only me.

A person can be free
because they have a home.
Without a home, they’ll just end up
in loneliness.

I found it—a place where I can be me.
At long last...I can truly be free.

Ahh... It’s getting moldy again.
I only drew this 10 days ago,
but I guess the antiseptics didn’t work.
I’ll have to dry the house with
more fire next time...

This nearly eternal rain that
people call the “Curse” is truly
my worst nightmare.
The humidity keeps ruining
all my paint pigments and canvases.

Looks like even this portrait of
my apprentice is gonna have to be repainted.

Hah... Sorry—I don’t have any more tools.
Looks like I won’t be able to
see you for a while.

For some fresh air, I left
the moldy portrait and went outside.
But, all I saw were thick clouds
and sunken ruins...
Jeez, what a boring scenery.

If this stupid Curse had never existed,
would these streets still be filled with
the same energy they once had before?

My apprentice...and my friends...
Would they all still be laughing by my side?

My painting buddies were the first to go,
and then everyone else frantically followed,
as if cursed creatures were chasing after them.

There are so many better places out there.
Of course they’d leave.

Hmm...
Now then, I wonder if there’s anything
I can use to paint with.

I’m what people call a “witch,”
and I know that this world
sees me as a nuisance.

Which is why I chose to stay in the ruins.
There’s probably nowhere else that would
accept me anyway.

Just as those thoughts ran through my mind,
I noticed the silhoutte of a corpse in
an abandoned building.

That...looks like my childhood friend.
...Ahh, one of the creatures must’ve
killed you when you were leaving town, huh?

My apprentice...and now you...
You’re all so unlucky.

Now then, the list of things
I need to paint keeps getting bigger,
but I’ve got nothing to paint them with.

Hmm... I’ll just crush his bones
and use them as paint pigment then.
The picture’s only gonna be one color,
but bear with it, okay?

This place has no ethics or morals.
At best, there’s my self-satisfaction
and sentimentality.　

Red, crimson, vermillion, scarlet, and white—
those are all of his colors.
I fill the canvas with different shades
and shadows, chasing after the image
of him I have in my memory.

With what little materials I have,
I’ve only got one shot to get this portrait right.
To engrave the life he once lived
with his own colors.

This portrait was never intended for
his funeral.
It’s really just for myself.

And so, as the all too familiar sound of rain
filled my ears, I let my brush run free.

Days passed and I was able to finish
his portrait just as my materials were
about to run out.

...But, this painting’ll probably rot away
after I die, huh?

That’s fine, I guess. It happens.

But, the fact that there was once a city here...
the fact that people once happily lived
their lives here...
It’s kinda sad that those
memories’ll get washed away.

When the rain stops, guess I’ll paint
an even bigger picture.

Creating a masterpiece takes time.

It’s been a while since I basked in
the sun’s rays, but I still haven’t
finished the picture.

So, on a whim, I decided to paint one of you—
yes you—the lord around here as the subject.
Hm? Oh, no, it’s fine.
Thanks to you, I’ve no shortage
of painting materials now.

Plus, no matter what materials
I use to paint you with,
your color’ll always stand out anyway.

...Jeez, you sure are
a hard one to paint, though.

But, that’s all the more reason why
I wanted to paint you—someone who’s
still alive for a change.

What? Do you doubt the skills of
the great Cherna—genius painter
extraordinaire?
Don’t worry, I won’t disappoint you.

When I got here, I think
the first thing I thought was,
“...Nice place.”

The air here is so fresh and clean,
and there’s actual nature, rich with life!

I’ve traveled to tons of different places before,
but there aren’t many places like this.

That’s why it surprised the heck out of me
when the Curse started messing things up.

How do I put it...
I guess it kinda takes me back.

You wanna hear more, don’t ’cha?
Okay, okay. No need to rush.

Just for today, I’ll let you in on
the true story of Soteira.

A bit before I got here,
I was wandering around a place
that had absolutely nothing.

I wanted to talk to someone—anyone—
but there was literally nothing there.

I was the one who chose to start traveling,
but I kinda regret not choosing something
different to do.

So I put Dezzy on my head,
and just kept on walking.

Oh, I know! Do you wanna hear about before
Dezzy here got comfortable with my head?

I was in a different place—
one that was kinda like my hometown...

It was the total opposite of here—
completely lifeless and silent,
like the world ended a long time ago.

I heard there were people in the past
who tried to save that world,
but I guess it didn’t go too well.

When I think about it, it’s all my fault that
everything got so messy.

If I could paint it in a prettier picture,
it’s like baking a cake,
accidentally knocking it over,
then having to clean up the mess.

I tried so hard to make the yummiest cake
I could, but the way it all ended up...
It was all so sad...

After that, I decided to go see what kinds of
cakes other people were baking.

But it turns out everyone was like me—
knocking their cakes over and
burning everything to the ground.

Hey, didn’t I tell you?
There aren’t many places like this.

This place is a wonderful cake,
baked with love and care.

That’s why I love it here.
Life is short, but this world
lives it to the fullest.

But then there’s the Witch Hunt,
and many other stupid and depressing
things here.

And yet...that’s exactly why there’s life here
that exists so strong and beautifully.

I wanna keep watching that kind of life.
Ideally, from up close and personal,
not somewhere far off in the distance.

...That’s why I’m wandering around
from place to place like this.

I can’t get involved with all these stories
I encounter during my travels.
That’s the path that wanderers must walk.

When the time comes for my true power
to return, I have to throw away
everything that I am.

But...I now know the beauty of this place.
So while I’m here, I’m sure that won’t happen.

It’s thanks to you and everyone here, my lord.

I mean, out of everything I’ve seen,
you made this the place I feel
I can love the most.

May good fortune keep on coming to
you and your friends, my lord.

From here on out, the good people of
this world will always have Soteira’s blessing.

The 15th day of spring.
Mimi stumbled into the boss’s territory.

Harbor town is a heaven for fish lovers,
but the boss cat always fought with Mimi.
It’s so annoying!

Today Mimi ended up with only a fish tail...
Haah, Mimi is so hungry.

The 2nd day of summer.
Mimi went to the harbor tonight.
Other cats shouldn’t be around at night...

Mimi’s fur-end Nero warned that
drunk hoomans could kick Mimi to the sky...
but Mimi’s sooo hungry.

Well, I guess I’ll try that shiny store first.

It would be nice if Mimi can pick up
something delicious there.

The 24th day of fall.
Mimi had an encounter that would
change her life fur-ever.

Inside that store filled with music,
purr-dy dancers moved their bodies
in ways that Mimi had never seen before.

Everyone’s attention was on them.
Mimi wants to dance just like them,
so Mimi can become paw-pular, too!

The 12th day of winter.
Mimi started going to that store
every day to learn the dance.

As usual, Mimi peeked through the window,
but today, one of the dancers spoke to Mimi!
Mimi’s heart was pounding!

Mimi wanted to be just like her,
so Mimi asked the purr-dy dancer to teach her.

“I’d prefer to live a free life like yours,
but you want to be like me?” she smiled.

Uhh...what does she mean?
Mmm, but now she’s Mimi’s teacher,
so it doesn’t matter!

One year passed since that encounter.
Mimi got better at dancing and became
good fur-ends with her teacher.

But...Mimi can’t go back to the store anymore.
It burned down to ashes...

I think Abby said it was the Curse,
but Mimi still believes in the paw-sibility of
meeting her teacher again somewhere.

Next time we meet,
Mimi will surprise her for sure!
That’s why Mimi will practice every day
and become a paw-some dancer!

Get this!
Mimi was reunited with her purr-ecious
dancer fur-end at Master’s mansion!

Now she can teach me lots of new dances!
Mimi’s so happy that she’s safe and sound.

She started teaching Mimi
some dance moves right away.
Meow... She’s soooo purr-dy and cool.

But, she can’t dance in front of
large crowds like she did before...
She seems kind of bored...

That’s it! Mimi has a paw-some idea!

Mimi asked Master for help,
and he made a big stage
so everyone could watch her.
And guess what?
Mimi gets to dance, too!

Yay!! Mimi’s so excited to dance with her!

She actually said Mimi isn’t ready
for an audience yet...
that’s why she was really strict in rehearsal.
But, I think that really helped me improve!
I’m really grateful to her!

Mimi is thankful to Master, too!
You’ll be head over paws with our dancing,
so I hope you enjoy it!

Meow, meow, me-ow~♪

I’ve been a witch since the day I was born.

Thanks to that, I got pretty good at dealing
with the Church, and lying for a living.

Growing up to become quite the swindler,
I now pretend to be a nun, pilfering things
from the Church of Longinus’s followers.

Perhaps I’ve actually been
pretty lucky though—luckier than
other witches who get caught without
even knowing their true identities.

This genius swindling witch’s target—
the most powerful witch in the Holy See.

Can you believe it?
This country’s controlled entirely
by that witch’s power.

So I had a thought—
if I had that witch’s power,
maybe I could escape from
this miserable life of mine.

People always say there’s
no time like the present,
so I went undercover as a pilgrim
and headed for the Holy See,
where that witch was apparently being held.

On the way, a group of
poor pilgrims befriended me.
I thought myself lucky at first,
but they turned out to be
much more of a nuisance than anything.

They share their food even if they’re hungry,
and will help others even if they’re hurt...

Even if they don’t know who I really am,
aren’t they a bit too perfect?

There’s not an ounce of bad in them.
I can’t stand it...!

Ahh...my chest hurts... Is this...guilt...?
I thought I had gotten rid of
this feeling for good...

Aaahh...! Can this thing go any slower...?

At this rate, these guys are
going to cleanse me...

And so, surrounded by a bunch of
good people and slowly losing my mind,
I made my way to the Holy See.

The first person a swindler fools is
always themself.

All the guilt that comes with lying would
just get in the way of the job.

“I need to do this to survive!”
“It’s their fault for being gullible!”

We make ourselves believe
whatever excuse we need to get by.

But...watching this “good person circus”
unfold in front of me is so suffocating.

And just when I thought getting closer
to the Holy See would finally free me
from this hell...

...we were attacked by a creepy monster.

These must be the monsters everyone’s
taking about—the creatures of the Curse.

All my pilgrim friends are so scared.
Poor things...

But if I use my magical power here,
I’ll have my hands tied in seconds.

“Sorry, but I’m outta here...”
is what I wanted to say.

But there I was...
tarnishing my reputation as
the genius swindling witch into the dirt
by saving those virtuous pilgrims.

Even after showing them my power,
the pilgrims defended me like they were
ready to accompany me to jail.

You’ve got to be kidding me.
Just when I thought I’d finally
be able to get away from them...

But those guys...
As I was tied up and pulled away,
they said “thank you” to me.

You idiots... I fooled all of you, you know.

I was thrown in jail, which I thought to be
quite the fitting end for a liar like me.

But for some reason, here I am now,
safely smelling the fresh air from
outside the prison walls.

I was saved by a lord who came from
some place called Fran on a journey
to save people.
The problem is he’s so soft, it’s concerning...

I bet this guy thinks that all the people
vying for his help are good people.

He’s just like that group of pilgrims—
a self-sacrificing idiot...
The type of person I can’t stand.

But, what I hate even more than that is...
Mmm...nah... Some things are
better left unsaid.

Master, I love you, so please use
this genius swindling witch well, okay?

My father came to this continent from
a distant desert country across the ocean.

He said he was going to show me
his hometown one day, but got sick
from this continent’s new climate.
And then, while I was still a child,
he passed away.

Now alone and without money,
my mother left me in the ghetto...
before she, too, disappeared from my life.

I may have still been a child,
but I had to survive somehow.
So, I sold myself to a bar as a dancer.

And used the only thing my father left me—
an exotic foreign dance.

The dance was perfect for heating up the bar,
and I soon became its poster girl.

I continued to dance there for years.

Even though I couldn’t leave town,
I had no trouble with living arrangements
and everyone took good care of me.

But, my longing to go to my father’s
hometown never disappeared.

One night, an orphan begged me to
teach her my dance.

She was an odd girl with cat ears,
who apparently fell in love with
my dance instantly.

With her eyes sparkling in admiration,
she kept telling me how cool I was...
But, I couldn’t stand to hear that.

...No, I’m not cool at all.

I’m a coward who keeps looking away
from what I truly want to do.

Please, don’t look at me with
those sparkling eyes.

All I’ve done is cling on to this bar
and dance for people.

I promised to teach the cat-girl how to dance...
but immedietly regretted my decision.

Her expressions are awkward,
and her legs—an entangled mess...

Is this girl really a cat?
She’s all over the place...

But, no matter how strict I was with her,
she never gave up.

I liked her attitude and taught her
everything she needed to be the bar’s
next poster girl.

I’m going to quit anyways,
so no one’ll care, right?

Yes...that’s what I had decided.

I wasn’t going to give up
on my dreams anymore.

Right now, I am dancing
by his side to save the world.

Because I learned that there are
many people on this continent that
need my dance.

Of course, that doesn’t mean
I’ve given up on my dream.

Once things quiet down,
I’m going to go see my father’s
hometown in the far west.

Before I leave though,
I need to find that cat-girl.

There’s still so much that I haven’t taught her.

My lord arranged for me to
perform in a small plaza.

The audience is a bit lacking compared to
when I was dancing in the bar...

...but it’s still nice to dance in front of others.
It sure has been a while...

Though for some reason,
I’m supposed to dance with that cat-girl...

Perfect. There’s still so much
I haven’t taught her.
I’ll use this opportunity to
give her another crash course.

I’m only doing this so you don’t
embarrass me...
If you make such a happy face...
it’s only going to make things harder...

It was hard to dance with the cat-girl.
Really hard.
Though, I did kind of expect that.

That girl really doesn’t change though, huh?
She’s still watches me dance
with the same beautiful eyes.

Those shimmering, sparkly eyes that
stare at me with pure admiration.
I can’t afford to lose to her.

Simply visiting my homeland isn’t
good enough anymore.
While I’m at it, I think I’ll go and
take everyone by storm, too.

I won’t stop until I have people from
all over experience this new dance of mine.

With this new outlook on life that
meeting those two gave me...
and this one of a kind dance—my dance—
I’m going to mesmerize the entire world!

Ever since I was a child, I have been told
that performing good deeds shall earn us
a place in Heaven.

Day after day, my village is attacked
by cursed creatures.

Everyone is killed one by one,
regardless of gender or class.
I live in fear knowing that
any day could be my last.
But despite our peril, the Knights
do not answer our calls for help.

Is this God’s plan?
If so, it just seemed too cruel.

So, I prayed to God...
for the power to save my village.
“O Heavenly Father, bless me with the gift
to perform the greatest act of kindness,
so that I may enter Heaven at my final hour.”

It was as if my prayer had
made its way to Heaven,
and God Himself answered.

I was awakened to a magical power that
surpasses those of the cursed creatures—
the power of a witch.

I picked up a lance lying on the ground
and desperately fought off the creatures
as they came for me.
Their dreadful fangs and sharp claws
terrified me to death,
but I did not lose hope.

I remained steadfast.
Though I nearly succumbed to
the wounds they inflicted on me,
I somehow managed to drive them away.
But...

“A witch! There’s a witch over here!”
“M-Monster! Don’t come any closer!”

I saved the villagers from the creatures,
only for them to reward me with
a rain of stones.

In the villagers’ eyes, a witch like myself is
no different than a cursed creature.

They glare at me with eyes filled with
fear and scorn, hurling abuses as loudly
as they can.
But, I did not mind.
I was just happy they were still alive.

I am sure they are just frightened.
Having lost so much, they merely do not know
what to do with their sadness and anger.

If casting your pain onto me offers you
even the smallest amount of deliverance,
I shall glady welcome it all.
...But, before I could tell them that,
the rumble of hooves resounds
throughout the village.

It was a band of Knights
from the Church of Longinus.
They had come to capture the “witch.”

How in the world did they learn
about what happened here?
We sought their protection
countless times before, but never once
did they appear in our village.
So why now...?

I was bound on top of the scaffold.
As the Knights raised their torches,
I spoke to them.

“...Honorable Knights,
where have you been until now?”

The one who gave me their answer
was their commander.

“...We were nearby, waiting for
the village to be decimated,
or for a witch to rise and protect it.
If the village fell, what remained would
be offered to the Church as alms.
But if a witch appeared,
we were to capture it after
all the creatures were killed off.

Oblivious to this scheme, the villagers were
all calling for justice to be executed on
the witch bound before them.

I recognize many faces amongst those who
congregate near the banner of the Church.

Why do their eyes fill with hatred
when they look at me...?
What in the world did I fight for...?

The flames start to rise from my feet.
I gasp for air, my voice trembling as
I call out God’s name.

“...O Heavenly Father. Was I wrong?
Will my lapse in judgement
deprive me of my place in Heaven...?”

My vision is stolen by black smoke,
and my feet slowly start to burn from the heat.

As the shouting of the villagers melded
with the crackling of the fire,
a voice whispered into my ear.

“...You risked your life to save them,
and this is how they reward you?
Look at these pathetic heathens.
Hell is where they belong.
Give in to your anger.
Carry out God’s punishment,
and smite them all.
You have that authority...that power...”

The voice boasted as if it were God Himself,
but I resisted it with every ounce of
strength left in me.

...That is not God’s will!
I know He blessed me with
this power to use it for good!
I will never...ever use it
to harm anyone...
Not a single soul...!

I repeat those words like a prayer to sway
myself from giving into the voice’s temptation...
even hoping that the fire consumes me
before that happens...

In that exact moment, I saw a person’s
silhouette flickering from beyond the flames.

“O Heavenly Father...”

As I murmured deliriously, that person
responded with his powerful voice.
“I’m here to save you!”

“Where am I...?”

Is this Heaven...? No.
It was the inside of a mansion
I had never seen before.
Come to think of it,
I should have been burned to death...

My mind was in disarray,
but a servant explained to me
what happened.

Right as the flames were
about to consume me,
I was rescued by the master
of this mansion—the Duke of Fran.

My memory returns...
Ah! He rescued me...!

O Heavenly Father...
Does this mean you still have
plans in store for me...?

...He does not give me an answer.
But, I have never been more
full of conviction than now.
Yes. I have been blessed with
more time so that I may continue to
help those who are in need.

One day, His Grace asked me a question.
“Have you ever despised your village
or the Church for what they did to you?”

...Not at all. I carry no hate
for my village or the Church.
The only concerns I have are
the tragedies plaguing our world,
and the lives of those I must save.

If I am alone, I know there will be a limit to
what I can do with the little power I possess.

But, if you—if Your Grace and I
were to join together...!

I believe that this is all part of God’s plan...
Being able to meet you, and being able to
walk alongside you.

From this day forward,
I may stumble, but I will not fall.
I shall not become weary in doing good
for the people of the world...or for you...

So that one day, when I reunite
with Grandma in Heaven,
I can boast about everything I have done
to make the world a better place.

Primavera... That is the name given
solely to The Luminary of Song.
She is admired by all songstresses,
and is the leading lady of the theater.

My mother was Primavera.

“We live in troubling times, so I want
my songs to lift everyone’s spirits...
and embrace the world with
my songs of hope...”
Those were the words she often spoke.

Before long, her wishes had become my own.
One day, I shall become a songstress
like my mother, and sing songs of hope
to the people of the world.

I still do not hold a candle to her,
but as a songstress, I shall prove
I have the beauty and splendor
to capture the hearts of everyone.

Time has passed...
and I have grown ever so beautifully.
Mother says I am still a child,
but I know how elegent a lady I have become.

Why, I have even been featured in shows
as the star performer.

Yet, Mother refuses to
acknowledge that I am ready...
Certainly, her elegance is
beyond compare...
But one day, I shall inherit that name,
and fully bloom into a flower
that will grace the stage with
all its beauty and splendor.

I-I am very much different from
the other songstresses—nowhere near
as obsessed with the name as they are!

Besides, to me, singing is my reason for living...
I do not perform on stage because
I want to be known as The Luminary of Song.
I perform...because I love singing.

I loved looking out to the audience
from atop the stage.
Seeing them rejoice over
my songs was pure bliss.

My eyes saw a world filled
with nothing but beauty.
No... I did not even try
to look at anything else.

I did not see the envy of
the other songstresses...
the resentment of the poor...
the impending wave that
would twist my destiny...
Nothing...

One day...my mother suddenly lost
her voice while in the middle of
a performance...
Why would Mother’s voice...?

When the audience began to notice
this unusual occurence,
my mother clutched her throat,
writhing in pain.

As panic took hold of everyone,
out of nowhere my mother started
to sing as if she were possessed.
But...what is this?

My head throbbed in pain...
I should not have been able to
hear her voice, yet her song pierced
straight into my brain.

Is this the song of a songstress?
No... Mother’s songs were more beautiful...
More compassionate!

Then some girls started to sing,
as if inspired by Mother’s song.
They were all witches,
and this song was their curse...

As the witches’ song resounded
throughout the theater,
the ground responded by
ripping itself wide open.

I fought my way through the waves of
people who were trying to escape,
shouting in desparation,
“Mother, stop this madness!”

I know not if losing her voice
caused Mother to become a witch,
or if becoming a witch resulted in
her losing her voice.

Nevertheless, my mother continued to sing...
all while everyone’s screams of terror
intensified throughout the crumbling theater.

I could only watch in horror
as this disaster unfolded before me...
too dumbfounded to even move.

My beautiful world was destroyed instantly—
shattered to pieces by the witches’ song.
No... That thing is not Mother...
No more... Enough...
I don’t want to see anything anymore...

The theater was devastated even further
when the Knights of Longinus surged inside.
They closed in on the witches,
executing them all at once.

As the floor was stained red with blood,
I looked up at the stage in
one last act of desperation.
Then...I took a deep breath.

Songs are melodies from the heart.
If I fill them with prayers,
I can reach through to anyone.
Is that not the truth?
If it is...I beg you, Mother... Hear my voice!

I poured every ounce of my soul into
my song...hoping to restore my mother’s heart.
Then, she looked at me...her eyes
shrouded in darkness, save for
a sliver of light that refused to die.

She then called out to me...
“Primavera...”
It was as if time had stopped...
In that moment, Mother named me
the next songstress of hope—
the successor to the name “Primavera.”

But in that very instant...
a sword pierced right through her body.

Even as she was impaled by the knight,
Mother continued to sing as radiantly as ever.
But I turned my eyes away and wished...
for this madness to vanish
from my eyes once and for all.

Then all of a sudden...
color began to vanish from the world,
distorting everything I could see.

...No, it is not the world that is deforming...
Is it me? I cannot see anything...
neither color nor light...
Everything...has faded away...

When I came to, I was all alone,
wandering through a world of
eternal darkness.
What happened...? Why I am here...?
I have no answers... I have nothing at all.

Did I lose my eyesight because
my mother lost her voice?
Did I become a witch because she is one, too?
I do not know what is happening,
