or where I am going...

Ah, yes... I must...sing...
I am a songstress, after all.

It is my duty to sing...
because I am Primavera.

One day, my show will come to a close.
So, before my very being is
fractured irrevocably,
I shall believe that the one who
hears this song, shall be the one
who pulls the curtain on this tragedy...

Every seven days, my memory resets.
Perhaps to compensate for that,
I’m able to remember every vivid detail
within those seven days.

That is the magical power I’ve been given.

I use that power to record
everything necessary into my book,
so that when I lose my memory,
all I need to do is read back through the pages.

Unfortunately though, nothing is written
about how I became a witch...
or how I obtained this power.

When I read through this book,
I can trace back to my lost memories.

Happy memories, sad memories,
important memories...
All are precious footprints
that I no longer remember.

Some of my writing looks like it’s about to
jump off the page with excitement,
while some is as gloomy as a dark cloudy day.
It’s funny how easily I can tell
what my emotions were at the time.

I’m unable to remember anything,
so this is the only way for me to
regain my memory.
It might seem inconvenient,
but it’s not as bad as it seems.

I find it quite fun to read a story
where I’m the protagonist.

This page seems more
worn out than the others.
It must have been one of my favorites.

It’s just an ordinary diary entry
about going to a party.
But, I must have enjoyed myself
because I’m unusually chatty in it.

I continue reading without much thought,
but a hole slowly begins to eat away
at my heart.

I don’t know the person enjoying themself
in this diary entry.

It feels as though my friends
have been taken away from me.
I beat myself up every time for
how jealous I get of my past self.

I didn’t want to create anymore new memories.

At this rate, there will definitely come
a day when I’ll have a memory that
I’ll never want to let go of.
A memory so beautiful that no words
could even begin to describe it.

Or...maybe I’ve already had such a memory,
but I just didn’t write it down.
Because if I forget the fact that
I’ve forgotten about it,
then there’ll be no pain.

I write...and re-write...but I still can’t find
the right words to express it.

This heart-pounding joyful sensation,
and the other feeling that’s
sprouting within me...
With a few more days,
this emotion is sure to start budding.

Just two days left... I need to write about it
before it’s taken away from me.

But, when I flipped to the next page,
there it was—The same sentence I had
just written—word for word—with the same
scribbles in the exact same spots.

Ah, what the heck...
I’ve just been repeating
the same thing over and over again.

Day six—another day of regret.

Today, I ended up tagging along
with everyone again.
Even though I kept telling them
to leave me alone...
Even though I tried to be mean to them...
None of that fazes them.
They still come pester me...

No, that’s not right...
If I really was against it,
I could easily just go
disappear somewhere.
But here I am, writing my memories
with them down...and then repeating
the same cycle.

I get it now...
I’m the one that wants to see them.

These precious people that keep
befriending me time and time again...

Mm, I’m okay now.
I...I really have been lucky, huh?

Senpai keeps spending time
with someone like me.
He really doesn’t know when to quit.

The first thing I wrote when I met him
was that I was only helping him solve
the Curses in this world.

But before I knew it, the entries in my book
had started to become all about Senpai...
Oh look, hehehe, I just wrote another one.

At this rate, I’m pretty sure my book’s
going to be filled to the brim with him.

...Not that I really mind that, though.

Today is day seven.
Tomorrow’s “me” will be the new “me.”
So listen up, new “me”—don’t forget to
be nice to Senpai, okay?

Being a witch, I never had friends.
Just Mom, Dad, and a bunch of pretty flowers.
It may not have been much,
but that’s all I needed to be happy.

One day, Mom looked at me,
and in a serious tone, told me to go
pick some flowers from a garden far away.
“A guest is coming,” she said.

I had never seen Mom with such a scary face.
It...made me worried.
But, I did as I was told
and made my way to the garden.

If I bring lots of flowers back,
she’s sure to be happy.

Or...so I thought.

Big flowers, pretty flowers,
and lots and lots of other colorful flowers.
With my arms full, I made my way home.
Waiting for me there, though,
were the still bodies of Mom and Dad.

...Hey, what’s wrong?
It’s impolite to sleep on the floor, you know.
You guys need to go sleep in your room.

Today’s the day you promised
we’d bake pie together.
I practiced lots and got
pretty good at baking, you know.

I still can’t make it as well as you can, Mom,
but I’ll try my best.
So please...try some, okay?

Please... Laugh and tell me I’m not
very good at cooking again, okay...?

Hey, why won’t you answer me?
Why...? Why...?!

I need to make a grave for Mom and Dad.
Under the sorrowful moonlight,
I dug a hole while tears
streamed down my face.

The moment I saw their bodies
lying in the hole,
something in my heart broke.

Mom, Dad, and a bunch of pretty flowers.
My little slice of happiness.
I thought it would last forever, but...

...now it’s all gone.

I want to cover the world in flowers.
If pretty flowers bloom everywhere,
then everyone will get along, right?
Witch or not, everyone will all
get to be happy, right?
That’s why...I’m going to fill
the world with flowers.

In my dream, someone calls out to me.

“Natasha, it’s time to get up.”
Dad, is that you?

“As always, you’re such a sleepy head.”
Are you there too, Mom?

“We need to go, Natasha.”
“You need to wake up on your own now, okay?”

Don’t go.
I can’t do anything without you two.

“It’ll be okay.”
“You’re not alone anymore, Natasha.”
The two of them begin to slowly disappear.

Wait! Don’t leave me all alone here!

I opened my eyes abruptly to see
someone extending his hand out to me.

“My...lord...?”

My lord’s country is such a wonderful place.
There were so many other witches
there besides myself.
Everyone was so nice to me,
it felt like my family had gotten bigger.

But, when I returned to my room,
I would cry by myself.
I may have been given a new “family,”
but my real family is gone.
There’s no one that’ll
welcome me home anymore.

I try to hold back my tears
with everything I’ve got.
I need to stay strong.
I need to show Mom and Dad
that I’m fine by myself.

Because...they’re not here anymore...

Coming back to my lord’s mansion
makes me feel kind of lonely.
I like everyone here,
but this place isn’t my home.

Even if it were just two simple words,
I wish I could hear their voices again.
Just like the old days, where I would open
the door and Mom and Dad would...

As I got in the door, my lord was there
and he called out to me.
His words were ones I had heard
everyday in the past—words I had
so longed to hear once more...

“Welcome home, Natasha.”

In that moment, a wave of memories
flooded my mind, and an endless
stream of tears fell down my cheeks.
With my lord panicking in front of me,
I finally said the words I hadn’t
been able to say since that day.

“I’m home, my lord.”

Mom, Dad, guess what?
I’ve made some friends.
They’re all really nice people.
Today, they’re taking me to the flower shop.

And guess what?
I’ve actually...found someone I like.

Wh-Who that person is...is still a secret...
But, he’s so nice to me,
and as kind as you two were...

He’s really popular among everyone,
so I can’t keep him for myself...
But one day, I wonder if we’ll get to be
like you two were... I’d love that...

Oh, looks like everyone’s here.
Let’s continue when I get back, okay?
I’ll be heading out then!
See you guys later!

Why...is this happening?

Almost one month has passed since
the plague has spread throughout the village.
Many have perished.

It is the same as when this very same
disease first attacked many years ago.
There was only one person I was
able to save back then—Florence.

She overcame her trial through
her strength alone...and the whole ordeal
made us the closest of friends.

Yes, God has a plan with
every trial he puts us through...
Surely, even the one we are facing now...

That is why I continued to pray...
“O Lord, please save everyone...”

But as time went on,
the number of deaths only grew...
Then, after countless days of praying,
something strange happened to my body.

My body transformed into that of a witch.

Witches are evil monsters that devastate
the world—the source of plagues, disasters...
Every kind of misfortune.

Their very existence causes people to suffer...

Why is this happening to me...?

No, this is surely another one of God’s trials.
He would never put anyone through
a trial they cannot overcome.

O Lord, I shall overcome this trial
you have presented before me.
So I beg you...show me the way.

Not long after that, a Letter of Summons
came from Her Holiness.
It was like a sign from God Himself.

Information about my condition was
written in the letter, as well the existence
of a method to heal it.

Thank goodness.
My prayers have been answered...
O Lord, I am eternally grateful.

In order to face this next trial,
I set forth towards the heart of the Holy See,
where Her Holiness awaited.

In the letter, Her Holiness gave permission
for my friend to accompany me.
She must have been referring to Florence.

Thank goodness... I was actually
quite worried about going alone.
If Florence is with me though,
I have nothing to fear...
Nothing escapes Her Holiness’s eyes.

Florence is my dearest friend—
the single most important person to me.

When my body transformed,
she was far from scared,
holding me tight and assuring me
that everything would be okay.

No matter what cruel trial awaits,
if the two of us are together,
I am sure we can overcome it.
I am sure...

Hoping to ease any fears that still troubled us,
we grasped each other’s hands tightly as
we presented ourselves to Her Holiness.

But, she took one look at me and said...
“Damn you, Witch of Calamity.”

No...
As I felt myself collapse from shock,
Florence held onto me.

She gave me a gentle smile...
then approached Her Holiness.

“Fortina is the one who saved my life...
There’s no way she’s a witch
who would bring about disasters!”
Florence did her best to gain
Her Holiness’s favor on my behalf.

Thank you, Florence...
It means so much just to hear you say that...

Then suddenly...I felt as if a strange light
flickered from Her Holiness’s lance.
Am I...imagining things?

Her Holiness immediately looked at me,
scoffing as soon as our eyes met...
She then handed Florence a sword,
and said to her...

“That witch conjured the disease that
brought you to the brink of death. Kill her.”

“Florence, what’s gotten into you?”
I feebly called her name.

But, I was only met with her frigid glare...
In her eyes, I was nothing more than
a monster.

“You filthy witch!” she said,
raising her sword towards me.

Florence—wh-what...?
“Filthy...?” No...
You would never say something so horrible!

She’s my dearest friend...
No matter what happens, I’ll believe in her.
That’s what we vowed, didn’t we?

I trusted her with all my heart,
so I held my arms wide open
as she approached me.
But...without even hesitating,
she took her sword...and cut me down.

It hurts... My wound burns with pain...
But what hurts the most...
is that she did this to me.

Wait... Don’t go...!
I stretched my hand towards her
as she walked away,
but not once did she look back.

Don’t go... Florence...

I slowly crawled towards her
on the ice-cold floor,
but she still didn’t turn around.

She only had eyes for Her Holiness.

Florence gazed at her with the same
adoration she had always given me...
The moment I saw that,
something inside me broke.

No... This is all a delusion...
It’s not the world I know...
Florence would never do
such a horrible thing...

Ah, I see... This is what the Lord desires...
He has guided all that has come to be...

He speaks to me, demanding that
I purify this twisted world.
If He wills it, I must obey.

I shall tear asunder all that is impure...
and pass His divine judgement.

After passing God’s judgement for
days on end...a glimmer of light
appeared before me.
It was...Florence...

Standing next to her was
a man I did not recognize...
The light that poured from his staff purged
every one of my swords from the land.

He was like a messenger from God...
Bathing in his light finally
freed me from my trial.
Then, everything became clear.

The girl who kept reaching out to me
despite all the pain her body was in...
was the girl I know and love.

My dearest friend...

I’m so sorry...
You came, fighting to save me
till you could barely stand,
yet I doubted you.

I said that you betrayed me...!
Even though I vowed to believe you
no matter what...!

But, we will never be torn apart again...
This bond between us has gotten so strong
that even God Himself cannot sever it.

After all, you are...my dear knight.

When we were younger,
Big Sis and I were abandoned
on top of a mountain.

There, thunder and lightning were
always crashing down.
I got scared and tried to run away
from the noise, but before I knew it,
I had ended up all alone.

The mountain’s too dark to
see anything at night,
and the thunder’s so loud
I can’t hear Big Sis’s voice.

At this rate...she’ll never find me.
I’ll never see Big Sis again...!

I started crying, but before I knew it,
there she was—somehow Big Sis had
found me.

“It’s okay, Cerberus. Big Sis is here,” she said,
wrapping her warm arms around me.

The thunder and lightning were still
crashing down, but my tears had stopped.
And it’s all because I have the best big sis
in the whole world.

I had a dream—a really scary dream
where Big Sis wasn’t here anymore.

When I woke up, the first thing I did
was quickly nuzzle up against her.

Thank goodness... She’s here.
Don’t ever leave me alone, okay Big Sis...?

...Huh? A good luck charm... For me?
With this, you’ll always be here with me,
so you’ll save me if I have a bad dream?

You’re so nice, Big Sis. I love you.
Oh, I know! This pretty rock here is really
precious to me, but you can have it!

Now, I’ll always be with you, too, Big Sis!
If you have a bad dream, I’ll save you, too!
The two of us are gonna be together forever!

But, my nightmare became reality.
Big Sis...wasn’t here anymore.

Red eyes float in the darkness.
The creatures attacked us suddenly one night.

They came at us with their
sharp claws and big fangs,
but Big Sis stood her ground in front of me.
Everything happened in slow motion—
the hungry creatures...they pounced on...

No... Big Sis...! NOOOOO!!

Something inside me exploded,
and an array of lightning bolts crashed down.

Wh-What was that...?
I-I’ve never used that kind of power before...
Huh...? Big Sis? Big Sis, where are you?!

I can’t find her anywhere...
All I see around me is the burnt ground.

I-I’m sure the lightning just
made her fall off the cliff.
Yeah, that’s it.

I quickly climbed down the cliff,
but what I saw there was...

Big Sis? Where are you?!
Please, say something!
Ohh... Th-That thing’s...
been burnt by lightning...

N-No. That’s not Big Sis.
That’s gotta be a creature.

But then, where’s...Big Sis?
There’s only one dead body here,
and it’s been struck by lightning...

...No. No no no!!
There’s no way... That can’t be her!
There’s no way that I...that I...!
S-See, there’s no way that
these pieces of coal are...!

Huh? This rock... It’s round...and pretty...
It looks just like my good luck charm...

...No. I...killed...Big Sis...?
I...killed... NOOOOO!!

I had a dream—a really scary dream
where Big Sis wasn’t here anymore.

When I frantically opened my eyes,
I saw Big Sis smiling at me.

“It’s okay. I’m not going anywhere.”

Thank goodness. It really was all just a dream.
But when I went to nuzzle up to Big Sis,
her body was struck by lightning.

Her scorched black arm grabs mine.
“Why...?” she asks...

N-No, it’s not what it looks like...
I-I wanted to save you...
but this strange power
poured outta me, and...

Before I knew it, I was all alone in my dream.
No. This isn’t a dream. This is reality.

’Cause I... I killed her!!

I hear thunder.
That horrible sound is resonating
in my pitch black heart.
But all of a sudden, a warm light appeared.

“It’s okay, Cerberus. Big Sis is here now.”

Huh...? No... You’re lying...
There’s no way Big Sis is here...
’Cause...I killed her!

Please... Stop...
Don’t make me suffer any more...
H-Huh...? That...light...

It’s...Big Sis’s good luck charm—
the one she promised would mean that
she was always with me...
That...she would save me
from my bad dreams...

...I’m right here, Big Sis.
I...want to see you again...

As I wrapped my arms around the light,
I hear a voice.
It repeated those special magic words—
the ones that have always protected me.

“It’s okay, Cerberus. Big Sis is here.”

I can’t hear the thunder anymore.
A warm light...slowly makes its way
into my heart.

Since then, the two of us have been
living in Master’s town.
Today, Big Sis and I are
going shopping together.

There’s so many cool things to see in town.
But, I guess at some point I must’ve
gotten separated from Big Sis.

I’m not gonna cry though, ’cause, see?
Big Sis is right here.
She held my hand so that
I wouldn’t get lost anymore.
Big Sis’s hand is so warm...

As we walked home into the sunset,
our two shadows walked
side by side behind us.
Even our shadows are best friends,
huh Big Sis?

Oh look, there’s Master!
He came to get us!

Come on, Big Sis, let’s go!
You, me, and Master—
let’s all go home together!

There’s a saying that goes,
“Boredom kills you,”
and I believe it to be very true.

Born a witch with a frail body,
I spent my days holed up in my room.
If I’d stayed alone in there forever,
I’m sure I would’ve gone crazy.

But, the one who changed that fate
of mine was my big brother.

Unlike my parents who wouldn’t dare
go near my room, he visited me everyday.
He’d even bring books so I wouldn’t get bored.
A book a day...for as long as I can remember.

Everything I have in my room
was given to me by him.
All the books, all the memories...

If boredom kills you,
then I wonder what love does...

I can tell who’s come home from just
the sound of the front door opening.
The sound of footsteps on the first floor
soon move up to the second.

Hearing them get closer and closer
makes my heart pound.
I get so nervous that I hide under my blanket.

I can look my brother in the eyes and
have a conversation with him,
and I can say, “Thank you” to him,
but why can’t I say, “I love you?”

All the girls in the stories I read were
able to muster up the courage
they needed to confess their feelings.
If I mustered up my courage,
would I be able to experience
a love like they did?
To tell him those three simple words...

The door to my room opens,
and my brother enters.

Hey... Umm... I...

The words I wanted to tell him
never made it out of my mouth.
From behind my grim-looking brother,
a stampede of footsteps barged into my room.

Apparently, a lot of people have died from
a disease that’s plaguing the village.

“You wretched witch! This disease is all
your fault! You cursed us all!”

The angry villagers brought me
down to the lake—the home of
the water goddess—a place where
people are offered as sacrifices to
suppress the calamity...

Big Brother, I don’t know
anything about a Curse.
Tell them I’ve got nothing to do with this!

As I cling onto him,
cold words echo in my ears.

“Filthy witch. I always thought
you were disgusting.”

Wha—? Big...Brother?
What’s gotten into you...?

“You’re always looking at me with
those creepy eyes of yours.
I only came to see you because
our parents made me.
You know, I hated every second
I spent taking care of you!”

He yelled, before pushing me into the lake.

I sink deeper and deeper under the cold water.
My heart wasn’t filled with anger or sadness,
but simply resignation.

As a witch, I always assumed
my cause of death wasn’t
going to be normal, but... Heh...
For my life to be taken by my own brother...

Ahh... Well, that was a short life!

I wish I could have gotten to
go on a date with Big Brother.
We never even got to hold hands,
let alone kiss...

I guess my life really had nothing to it...

You know, I loved you, Big Brother...
I... I loved you so much...
That’s why...I never thought
you’d ever say those words to me...

All I did was stay in my room...
So why...did you come to hate me...?

I’ve been at the bottom of the lake ever since,
teetering between life and death.
After a while, there was no point
looking up at the surface anymore.

There’s no way anyone would ever
think of saving a cursed witch,
so hoping is pointless.
No one wants to save...someone like me...

Wha—? This sound...
Someone’s coming...?
The sound was slow, just like
the footsteps were in the hallway...

No! Stop! There’s no way someone’s coming!
Because... Big Brother... He...!

I covered my ears,
trying so hard to avert my eyes,
but the sound...stopped right in front of me.

It’s not my brother—that much I’m sure of.
And yet, I...

I lift up my frightened face.
Someone’s there, shrouded in light,
holding their hand out to me...

The person who saved me
was the Duke of Fran.
Apparently, I had become one of
the witches of the Curse,
and had made rain fall for
the past 100 years.

The country flooded,
and my village disappeared.
There’s not a single villager
from back then alive anymore.
My brother...wasn’t alive anymore.

...Hey, why did you save someone like me?
If I’m a witch of the Curse,
you should’ve just killed me.

It’s all my fault that my village,
that my brother, that everything’s all gone...
I would have been much happier dying
without ever knowing I did all this!
So...why?!

...Because you heard my voice? That’s it?
That’s your reason for
coming to look for me?
You didn’t even know if I was here or not.

That’s so...stupid... You’re an idiot...

No, the real idiot...is me.
I’m the idiot for still
thinking about my brother...

I still don’t know how to feel
about what happened.
Should I be angry...? Should I be sad...?

Despite what happened,
everything I have inside me is
all thanks to my brother.
To him, everything might’ve been one big lie...
But to me, everything was real.

I lift my head to look up at the sky.
If I didn’t, the waterworks would have started.

Thank you for all the kindness you gave me.
I loved you, Big Brother. Goodbye.

One by one, the raindrops that hit
my face begin to cease.
Light slowly seeps through the dark clouds.

My 100 year curse...was beginning to clear up.

My little sister Soltina was someone
everyone loved—always so bright and cheerful.

You’d never guess the two of us were sisters.
I can’t cook, I’m no good at talking to others,
and I fail at anything and everything I do.
Even this stuffed bear I made for her
looked horrible.

I must’ve gotten all the bad genes,
while Sol got all the good ones.

But I’ve never once been jealous of her.
In fact, I’m proud to call her my little sister.
As long as I have her,
I don’t need anything else.

I believed that from the bottom of my heart.
Until the “Witch Hunt” started...

Sol’s sixth birthday.
When she showed our parents her magic,
they threw her out of the house.

“Filthy witch. I hope you die out there,”
they spat.

I’m not the smartest person.
If everyone says that witches are evil,
then they must be evil.

But... But...!

When I ran out of the house,
I saw Sol curled up on the ground crying.
This isn’t right...!
You can’t make her cry like this.

Together with the stuffed bear
I had brought with me,
I pulled Sol into a tight hug.

Even if you’re an evil witch,
you’re still my dear little sister.
It’ll all be okay.
Happy birthday.

Slowly, Sol’s eyes welled up with
more tears—tears that were
much warmer than the ones before.
And as they slowly rolled down her face,
she let out loud sobs in my arms.

After that, the two of us started living together.
We hid the fact Sol was a witch,
but the pressure the Inquisition was
putting on witches was growing.

“Witches are responsible for
the calamity that has befallen us.
If we kill them, the world will
return to normal.
Destroy them all.”

Those words spread throughout the land,
and the Witch Hunt began.

The Inquisition showed no mercy
with their cruelty.
To this day, not a witch captured
has ever returned.

And before long, the day finally came
when Sol was chosen as their next target.

The Church’s target is Sol, so I’ll buy her time.
“You go get a head start,” I say...
but Sol stares at me with eyes full of worry.

“You’re going to be okay, right?”

“Of course,” I smile.
“I’m not a witch, so they won’t capture me.
Come on, depend on your big sister
from time to time.”

Hesitantly, Sol nodded and
slipped out through the back.
I watched her go, and shut the door.

I hope she didn’t notice my shaking body.
I think my smile was convincing enough
at least...

Before long, the Inquisition came to our house.
I mustered up all my courage
and stood my ground.

“There is no witch named Soltina here.
I, Lunalynn, am the witch!”

The Inquisition’s torture methods were
far worse than the rumors.
My body began to break under
the devil’s endless games.

But, what was more painful than any of that...
was that I started resenting Sol.

Why am I the one that has to
suffer through all this?!
If only I hadn’t saved her.
If only Sol never existed!

My weak heart screams out.
At this rate, I’ll even come to
hate my dear little sister.
The thought of that was so unbearable,
that my heart started freezing over.

If only I could just turn to ice...
Then I’d be able to forget everything...

It was then...that a girl with a spear
appeared before me.

“I’ll grant your wish.”

With her words, my consciousness
fell into darkness...

I was in a world of nothing.
There were no sounds, no one, nothing.
Just a pure, white world of ice.

Oh, but it’s nice not being able to feel anything.
Here, I’ll be able to forget about all the sad,
painful things.

Not having anyone here is a bit lonely...
but that’s okay.
If I’ll only end up resenting you,
then I don’t mind staying frozen forever...

I fall deeper and deeper...
In the depths of this world of nothing...
I hear a voice.

Someone’s holding out their hand,
as if they’re trying to thaw my frozen heart.

A beautiful memory.
She always came to my rescue.
She always stayed by my side...
shone light into my world.
She’s the one I was proud to call...

“Come back to me, Big Sis!”

Sol is always there to save me.
That’s why this time,
I wanted to be the one to save her.

But, everything I did only made her sad...
I even went so far as to hurt her...

I hate myself.
I can’t even save my precious little sister...
Why am I so useless...?

I beat myself up, but then Sol pulled
something out of her bag.

This... This is the bear I gave you
for your birthday...
Have you...held onto it this entire time...?

Sol gives me a warm smile.

“Thank you for always saving me, Big Sis.”

Sol... I’m so sorry.
I won’t ever leave you alone again.
Because...I love you more than anything, Sol!

I lived in a town where the gap between
the rich and poor was severe.
It was a harsh world, especially in the slums.

Lifeless bodies of orphans were
constantly piling up in the streets.
These poor children didn’t even get
to experience growing up...

I have to do something...
I have the ability to save
the lives of these children.
I can’t just leave them be.

That’s why I decided to build
an orphanage in these slums...
Even with this though,
the children are still in
danger of losing their future.
I can’t let that happen.

As an adult, and as the mother
to these children...
I must protect their futures.

The children and I started our
new life together in the slums,
but the nobles were disgusted
at the sight of our orphanage.

Oftentimes, the adults in town would
beat the children so violently,
that Belle had to fight to protect them.

I hate those adults...
They hurt my children,
causing dark thoughts to
take root in their hearts...
I can’t let this continue.

I pulled my darling children into my arms
and consoled them as best as I could.
“You mustn’t let yourselves be
controlled by dark thoughts.”

“Violence doesn’t solve anything...
The true answer is forgiveness.”

“Let yourself be compassionate,
and you’ll get through to them...
So let’s believe in the love that
people have in their hearts.”

Days went by, and it was time for
Belle to finally leave the orphanage.
It’ll feel a little lonelier here,
but it doesn’t mean we’ll never
see each other again.
I have to send her off with a smile.

“Hey, Belle won’t be able to leave if
everyone keeps crying.”
As I was calming down the children,
Belle hugged me from behind.

“Can I come back and visit?”
Belle looked like she felt embarrassed
saying those words to me.
“But of course!
This will always be your home, Belle.
So visit whenever you please.”

Belle blushed as she smiled back at me.
Then, she spread her wings and left the nest.

I tried to be strong in front of the children,
but Belle’s departure left a big hole
in my heart.

Then one day...something happened that
overwhelmed me with happiness.

The children threw a small party for me.

Unpeeled potatoes, the remnants of apples,
and a bouquet made of wildflowers—
I was floored.
When were they able to pull this off...?

“We’ll work extra hard now that Belle’s gone,
so feel better please!” the children said
as they gifted me a picture.

“You all did this to cheer me up, didn’t you?”

I wrapped my arms around the children,
doing my best to hold back the tears.

“Thank you, my dear children.”

These children are my reasons for living...
I hoped, with every fiber of my being...
that this moment would last forever.

One day in town, I found an orphan being
victimized by the Witch Hunt.
I didn’t hesitate to save her,
but then the townspeople said to me,

“Witches don’t deserve to live.”

How could you all say something like that...?
It doesn’t matter if they’re
nobles, beggars, witches—
everyone has the right to be happy.

There’s not a single child out there
who doesn’t deserve happiness.

If the world rejects this child
solely because she’s a witch,
then I’ll take her in.
She’s more than welcome in our family.

I brought her home, paying no heed to
anyone who tried to stop me.
But that night, tragedy struck.

“Kill the witch!”
the townspeople shouted,
trapping us inside the orphanage...
before setting it ablaze.

“Now we can finally take out those
disgusting pieces of trash!” they laughed.

Trash...?

That’s right...
They’ve always hated the sight of us.
That witch was merely
the opportunity they needed.
This was all bound to happen.
And the one who gave them
that opportunity...was me.

“It’s hot! Save me!” begged the youngest boy.
He was the first to die...
The next was the timid one...
Then the mischievous one...

Just like that, one by one...
the children’s lives left their small bodies
as I held them in my arms.
They kept crying out to me until the very end...
“Save us, Miss Val!”

“No, open your eyes!”
I shook their bodies over and over,
but not one of them ever woke again.

When I came to, I was surrounded by flames,
my arms embracing something...black.
With a touch, it crumbles to dust...
What...is this...?

How can those people
do something so horrible?
What did these children ever
do to deserve this?
Nothing...! They’ve done their best
to live without bothering anyone else...
But those monsters...!

Damn it... Damn it all...

To hell with love.
To hell with kindness.
They did nothing to
protect my children...!

I was a fool...to have believed that there
were any sort of morals in these monsters...
I was wrong about...everything...!

People’s hearts, kindness, love...!
I should have never believed in any of it...

Unforgivable...
Those monsters won’t get away with this...!
I will drag every last one of them
into their fiery graves!
This town, these people, this entire world!
I will incinerate it all...!

Everything will BURN!!!

Experimental homunculus,
serial number 30682.

A puppet that, from birth,
is used in endless experimentations,
and disposed of when broken.
A tool that has no will, nor heart of its own.
That is what I am.

But one day, the professor said she would
raise me as a human—an experiment to
give a puppet a heart.

The days that followed were
nothing like what I was used to.
I read books, and had long talks
with the professor.
Slowly, I gained knowledge,
and my heartbeat grew stronger.

When I asked the professor
what the sky was, she laughed and said,
“It’d be nice if you could go see it one day.”

I am a puppet.
I have no emotions, nor desires.
But...

I started thinking about
how I wanted to go and see it.

“Let’s go see the sky.”
The professor said that suddenly one day.
“Let’s run away from this place
and go see the world.”

As a puppet, I have no right to refuse.
I must obey the professor. But...

“Where should we go?
What should we do?”
The more the professor asks,
the more something within me swells.

“Tomorrow’s the day, Little A.
Aren’t you excited?”

To the professor’s words, I gave a small nod...
even if I couldn’t comprehend what
being “excited” meant.

Then the day came to go see the sky.
The professor...never came.

The professor appeared three days later.
She was with someone people called the Pope.

This is the first time someone
other than the professor has come.
I don’t understand why, but...
something doesn’t feel right...
As I stand there silently,
the professor looks at me and smiles.

“I’m sorry, Little A.”

The professor apologized.
She was smiling, but also...crying?

Why...are you apologizing?
Why are you crying?
Why are you smiling?
I didn’t understand anything.
Not the professor’s feelings,
not my feelings... Nothing.

Frozen in place, I watch as
the Pope readies her spear.

“The last emotion this heartless puppet
needs to be complete...is despair.”

Then, she thrust her spear...
into the professor.

The professor collapsed in a pool of blood.
To me, the professor was my everything.
She made me. She gave me knowledge.
Everything was her doing.

But, that professor...has died.

I’m sure dying is something “sad,” but...
Ahh... It’s no use.
I don’t feel anything.
There aren’t any tears in my eyes.

And yet, I can’t see anything anymore.
I can’t hear anything anymore.
My legs are shaking so much
I can’t stand anymore.
My chest hurts so much...
I can’t...think of anything...

Professor, what...is this?
Why...do I feel...?
Professor... Hey, Professor...

Uuuu... Uuuuuu...
Professor, Professor... Professor...
Professor...? Professor, Professor, Professor...
Professor Professor Professor Professor
Professor Professor Professor...
AAAAHHHH!!!

I have rust inside me.
It latches onto my heart...and stains it—
a warm impurity.

We talked about so many things,
and read all those books,
but the only thing I can remember is her.

Before I knew it, my once empty heart
had been filled by her.
But, she is not here anymore.

This feeling I think to be
“sadness” is an emotion.
I do not have emotions,
that’s why I’m not sad.
If I’m not sad though,
then what is this?

This thing that is overflowing from
within me...is trying to destroy me.
My head has gone blank.
My chest aches as everything
inside me creaks and crumbles.
All that’s left inside me is one thing.

“Professor, I want to see you again...”

That was both my wish, and my Curse.

When I opened my eyes, the laboratory
had been destroyed by rust.
A man with a staff said that I had
gone berserk, and that he stopped me.
And...the girl beside him was...

...I was thinking about
how much I wanted to see you.

That’s why right now,
I think I’m happy to see you.
But... No... This isn’t enough.
There are so many other things
I want to say to you.

I want to talk with you.
I want to read books with you.
I want to hear your voice.
I want to hold hands with you.
I want to see you!
I...want to be with you...

What...is this?
Why does it keep overflowing?
I am just a puppet, so why are there
so many things I want to do with you?

I don’t understand.
I don’t understand anything.
So please, would you teach me again,
Professor...?

Right now, I am on top of my lord’s mansion,
looking up at the sky with the professor.
It’s just as I read about in books—
big, blue, and transparent.
No pictures can describe
what’s before my eyes.

In this world, apparently there’s something
called an “ocean” that is as big and blue
as the sky, and “mountains” that are so big
they can reach the sky.

I’m sure there are still many things
I don’t know, so I want to learn about them.
If possible, together with the professor.

As a puppet, I don’t understand emotions,
but I do understand one thing now.
Being with you is so warm, so peaceful.
Professor...I love you.

On that fateful day,
we stood at the throne,
promising to end each other’s lives
with our own hands.

Executioner and Oathkeeper.
One sword endowed with
the authority to slay kings,
and one that embodies
the loyalty and pride of a knight.

Weapons that would stop us
dead in our tracks,
should one of us go astray.

To me, that promise was an unbreakable
bond between Queen Amleth and I.

An ironclad oath in which
we promised to protect each other.

I never thought there would come a time
when I would wish for this promise to
be fulfilled.

I first met Queen Amleth
not too long after she was born.

The moment her small hand
gripped my finger...I made a vow—
to protect her until I breathed my last.

However, a fight for the crown plunged
her entire family into war.
It was too much for
Queen Amleth’s heart to bear.

Their lust for the thone endangered the lives
of the citizens, so she had no choice but to
take Executioner and put an end to it all.

A light of solitude emanated from her eyes—
sharp enough to pierce through the sadness
that was once in its place.

If such loneliness is the destiny that must be
borne by those who are called rulers...
would I even be able to stand by her side?

“...Kill me.”

The night of her ascension,
the two of us stood at the throne.
With Executioner in hand,
Queen Amleth proclaimed to me.

“I have no doubt that I will one day
descend down the path of tyranny,
as my royal brethren did before me.
When that time comes...Ophelia,
I want you to swear to me...
You will take Executioner...and kill me.”

If you descend into tyranny,
I shall follow you to the bitter end.

...How relieving it would have been
had I the strength to say that.
Promising to end your life is something
I have no desire to do.
However, if it is you who wishes for it...

“Just as you have requested of me, I, too,
wish for you to take my life into your hands.”

Before I knew it, my eyes were
overflowing with tears.

If we could share this bond...
If I could be by your side...
I thought I would be able to
endure any fate that awaited me.
So I received your sword...
and presented you with my own.

Even though our promise to kill one another
would become a curse that bound us
together in chains.

Hordes of cursed creatures appeared
and besieged the castle without warning.

The kingdom’s knights are completely
annihilated—save for me—and the flood of
creatures storm the castle walls.

Far from here,
Queen Amleth flees for her life...!
I must stop these infernal creatures
before they get to her...
Is that not why I am still alive?!

I scream frantically at my wounded body.
However, nothing moves—
not my feet...nor my fingers...
Every part of my body is crippled
from all the blood I’ve lost.

No... Queen Amleth...
To die in a place like this,
unable to protect you...!

In that moment, I heard her voice—
the voice of the Pope.

“I shall give you the power to vanquish
all that stand in your way...”

Those words entice me as
I wait for death to claim me.
But are they figments of my imagination...
or the devil’s temptation?

I do not care which it is.
I mustered every remaining ounce of strength
left in me and gave my answer.

“If it is for Queen Amleth,
I do not give a damn what happens to me!
If I must sacrifice my life for her,
I would without even a second thought!”

Yes... My queen... My light...
I shall not allow anyone...
to take you away from me!

...In that instant,
a sinister red aura envelops me.
An indomitable power begins to
subjugate my body...enslaving my mind.

Please...stay safe...Queen Amleth...

At the cost of obtaining the power I desired,
the entire kingdom was left scarred
beyond remedy.

Inside the castle that no longer existed,
in the room where the throne once stood,
I softly placed the tip of Executioner at
my throat—then I snapped awake.

She will never forgive me
if I were to take my own life.

“If you cannot die,
then give in to your madness.”

The crystals that surround me whisper
in a voice strikingly similar to Queen Amleth’s.

“Will you stay by my side?
Always...and forever...?”

Aah... Stop...
Do not speak in her voice...!

I must...keep ahold of myself...
Until Queen Amleth finds me...
Until Queen Amleth...punishes me
for what I have done...!

I beg you, Queen Amleth...
Please...fulfill your promise...and kill me.

After wandering and searching for
Queen Amleth, I arrived at an altar
that was abloom with crimson crystals.

As my mind drifts in and out of reality,
I wait, longing to see her.

It will be fine.
I have faith that she will come.
Focusing on Her Majesty keeps my mind
from shattering into a thousand pieces.

Queen Amleth.
It was my dream...to be by your side.
Even if this sword would one day
command me to end your life...
I did not stop dreaming.

Ahh... If only I was
more honest about my feelings...
If only I had spoken with you more...
Only now do I realize the many things
I have always wanted to say to you.

How I loved the tea we would drink
more than anything else.
How I was secretly captivated by
the sight of you absorbed in your books.
How I have cherished you
since the very beginning...

As my mind fades into darkness,
my memories of her begin to melt away
until but one thought remains—
“I wish you were here...”

In that moment,
the shatter of a crystal fills the air,
followed by the sound of someone
ascending the altar’s steps...
I knew those footsteps all too well.

Ahh... You came for me after all...
My one... My only...

The Witch Corps—that’s what we were called.

We were also known as the North’s strongest
unit during the Third Galian Civil War.
Oh yes, we were strong—so strong,
no one else even came close.

Outcasts of no value who were
born as witches...myself included.
That’s the kind of lot that was
assembled together.

So, everything was a first for me.
Meeting comrades who I knew had my back,
and being rewarded for being a witch.

Back then, a bond thicker than blood,
deeper than anyone else could
ever understand...undeniably tied us
to one another.

They were everything to me...
so I took this pistol, and planted
a bullet into each of them.
Until every last one...was gone.

In Galia, witches, immigrants,
and criminals were all treated
equally as second-class citizens.

We were all pushed into the cramped,
dirty Internment Zone.
Every day was dog eat dog...
so the war was a godsend.
After all, if I joined the military,
I’d be able to eat food and not feel cold.

Still, all second-rate citizens are
treated as pawns, forced into
the frontlines with little to no training.

The lot of bottom-feeders were massacred—
their bodies dropping left and right.
But, we were different.
We each had secret weapons...

Yes—our magical powers.

I assembled all the witches together.
We protected each other as
we coordinated our powers,
fighting desperately for our lives.

Then...when the battle was over,
we were the only ones left with
our limbs intact.

That was when the Witch Corps was born.

I wonder when it all changed.
We were supposed to be fighting to live,
but now, we were living to fight.

The battles were violent, and yet,
we were still treated as pawns.

But, it didn’t matter how relentless
the missions we were mobilized for were—
we always came back home.
Our unit was small in number,
but we never once lost a single soldier.

Before long, this lot of detestable witches
were called by a new name—
“patriotic heroes.”

I was so happy.
My subordinates—my comrades
were finally able to smile.

We found that thing called a reason to live.

...But, it would’ve been much better
if my story ended right here.

At any given moment, stars that shine
too brightly will one day disturb
the harmony of the night sky.
Apparently, we became those stars.

Near the war’s end, inside a hidden mine
in the South, we were on a simple
ambushing mission...
At least, that’s what we thought.

But, it wasn’t enemies that surrounded us—
it was a touch-activated magic circle...

A trap that reacts to magical power,
meant only for killing witches.
If we were bathed in its light,
nothing would save us.

Do we run? Do we hide?
Neither was an option—
we had nothing to use for cover.

We were set up by those snakes
we thought were our allies—
the Northern government.

“Captain, get down!”

My second-in-command pushes me aside,
and our surroundings are engulfed in light...

That was the end of the Witch Corps.

We were so strong.
A normal witch would’ve instantly died after
getting hit by that attack, but we didn’t.

No—we couldn’t.

“Please, help me...”
“Please, kill me...”
“Please, take the pain away...”

...You understand the meaning
behind these words?
Every nerve in their body was ripped apart,
but that wasn’t enough for
death to claim them.
Even now, I can still hear their screams
calling out to me in the darkness.

So, with my own two hands,
I put their pain at ease.

Yes—each and every one of them...
with this pistol.

And yet, they held no grudges towards me.
They even thanked me.
Not a single tear was shed.
My heart shattered with every shot.

I pulled the trigger for the last time,
and heard the dry sound of the empty
cartridge falling onto the dirt.

Then, she appeared as if she was lying
in wait this whole time—the Pope.

You know what she said to me?

“If it is revenge you seek,
then I will grant you power.”

...Who the hell do you think you are?

Don’t fret—I have no need of your power.
My time on the battlefield has already
taken my sanity away.

I collected my comrades’ dog tags
and hung them around my neck.

I will never forget any of you.
We’re bound forever...
I’ll eventually follow you all to the other side.
So, wait for me just a little longer.
...Because I’m going to see to it that
those snakes pay for what they’ve done.

At last, I turned my head towards the Pope
and told her one last thing.

Be sure not to miss out on what’s coming next.
You’ll get what you wish for—
No. I’ll show you something the likes of
which you’ve never seen...

The place I have in my sights is...the capital.

Marching in the depths of darkness is
my army of specters, revived from death
by my magic power.
Not only are they fellow soldiers—
they’re lost souls.

It was like we made a triumphant return home.
How absurd—not a single person’s here
to celebrate our homecoming.

The capital exudes prosperity,
corruption, extravagance...
This city has grown fat as if
it was oblivious to the war.

That goes without saying.
We protected it, after all.
We risked our lives, crawled through
the battlefields, evaded blades and bullets,
swam in mud and blood, turned our world into
nothing but gunpowder, blood, and iron—
and we protected this damn city!

That’s why I—we must make them learn...
that there’s nothing different about us.
That there’s something that
connects them to us.

That there’s one thing that makes us
all equal—“death.”

Exterminate the knaves who resist.
Leave the cowards who flee.
March until this land is filled with
nothing but silence.

...My comrades in arms!
Together, let us bring this city to its knees!

“Now then, let’s begin class.”

Today, I’m teaching the son of
a distinguished family how to be a ruler.
Tomorrow, it’s bridal lessons for
a daughter of nobles.
Afterwards, it’s military science for
an aspiring knight.

Many households are in need
of my services as a home tutor.

Now that the Curse is running rampant,
more households rely on home tutors than
schools. I’ve lived my days traveling from
house to house, and town to town.

Everywhere in this country is submerged
underwater, so traveling is fraught with
hardships.

But, as long as there are students who need me,
nothing will stop me from going to them.

That’s because I’m a home tutor.

There are students waiting for me...
That’s the only reason I need.

“Isn’t that girl a witch?”

I’ve been hearing more of those rumors
throughout town recently.

The Witch Hunt was gaining momentum.
But cursed creatures, thought to be
the spawn of witches, have been appearing
more―not less.

Then, people began to whisper as if releasing
the frustrations caused by their fears and
anxieties.

She’s a witch.
That witch is evil.
If only that witch wasn’t here...

It’s a small town,
so it was only a matter of time
before rumors became “truths.”

Then, girls who were targeted by these rumors
would eventually be taken away by knights,
and executed as real witches.

All while not even knowing
who gave them away, or why...

I loathe rumors...
They’re void of responsibility.

It’s unthinkable that someone would
know anything about a person
they’ve never spoken to.

Has everyone forgotten
something as simple as that?

The other day, I heard of a girl
who was rumored to be a witch.
Her mother protected her,
only to end up being targeted next.

But even that’s a rumor...

It’s said that there can be no smoke without
fire, but this town had tiny sparks scattered
all throughout.

There didn’t need to be any rhyme or reason.
If the town just had a trigger,
it would gladly let those sparks
burst into flames.

I refused to let this pass.
I am a home tutor, after all.

It’s an educator’s duty to teach and guide.

So, as my students were held at the mercy
of these rumors, I gave them a lesson.

“Please bear this in mind and never let it go.
What’s important is...”

A blade isn’t the only thing
that can kill a person.
A single glance can prove to be
just as deadly.

Sneering whispers and scornful eyes...
That’s all it takes to kill someone.

A heart that has grown familiar with inflicting
and feeling pain eventually forgets what pain
even is.

That’s why you must all look with your own
eyes and listen with your own ears
before judging anyone else.

This is what it means to learn and grow.

You must ask questions,
then think of ways to solve them.

There are no questions that can’t be solved.
The answers you seek are certainly just
hidden away.

As I taught my students that lesson,
I also spoke those words to myself.

That’s right.
The answer to breaking
these chains is also hidden away...

It was then that a certain rumor spread.
A rumor of a woman who lures children away
before turning them into witches.

A rumor spread about me being a witch.
About me invoking a curse that turns
children into witches... I know.

I suspected this would happen.
I just knew it would be my turn one day.

After all, if this town had a trigger,
it would gladly let its sparks
burst into flames.

It’s just that no one knew
what would become a spark.

I was met with scornful eyes, sneering voices,
and words that cut like a blade.

One after another,
they all pierced deep into my heart...

Soon afterwards,
I was reported to knights,
who then came to arrest me.

Behind them were
the parents of my students...
and among them, parents of children
rumored to be witches.
As they stood on the verge of tears,
they said to me, “Give us back our children,
you damn witch.”

I was at a loss for words...
The pain they suffered from losing
their children nearly broke my heart.

I had no idea what to say...
or what the correct answer was.

I was tied by the knights
and dragged throughout town.

“That woman steals children’s futures away.”
“Because of her, my child is...”
“If only that woman never came to this town...”

I heard voices filled with grudges
and resentment from all around me.

Don’t look at me like that. I...

I wanted to scream,
but I desperately held it in.

I’ll be executed at this rate...
But, that’s okay, right?

Because this will finally set me free.

I don’t need to see anything.
I don’t need to hear anything anymore...

Finally, the time has come...

At that moment,
I heard someone shout.

I raised my head to see a young man
with a staff standing before me...

And as I sat there dumbfounded,
he held his hand out to me.

You need my power?
To protect the future?

Impossible.
I couldn’t even set one thing right in this town.
How could I even...?

In that instant, I suddenly felt
warm gazes beaming at me.

It was my students...
They were looking at me—their eyes
trembling with feelings of guilt...

Ah, I see.
My lessons are safe
and sound inside of them.

Yes... What’s important is
the love we have for each other.

I briefly gazed back at my students,
then I took his hand.

The only way to break the chains of madness
afflicting this town is to set it right
from the ground up.

Who are the attackers,
and who are the attacked...?
I’ll unravel the answer to that question.

Then one day, I need to teach them.
Teach them about the great hero
who saved the world.

There’s a remote island where nothing
outta the ordinary ever happens.
That’s where I grew up.

This island only’s got two things.
A hot spring that does wonders
for the lower back,
and a legend of an ebony sword.

Whoever finds that sword becomes
its “swordbearer,” and they gotta go
search for its true master.

As the story goes, if the master isn’t found,
the sword’ll drain the life of the swordbearer
until they die.

The boys in my village tried
their hardest to find the sword...
But me? Zero interest.

I mean, I’d be interested if
I get to become the master,
but looking for the “true master” or whatever
sounds like such a pain...
And besides, more than anything,
I just wanna have a peaceful, relaxing life.

While no crystals fell onto our island,
cursed creatures crossed over
the narrow strait and attacked us.

As everyone scattered trying to escape,
I was unlucky enough to catch
some of the creatures’ attention.

I escaped into the woods,
but they relentlessly chased me down.

I desperately ran for my life,
but when I stopped to catch my breath,
I heard the sudden rumble of footsteps...

“Aaaah...! It hurts...!”

After the creatures bit my leg
and knocked me over,
they slowly inched their way towards me.
No... I don’t wanna die! Not here...!!

...It was then that I heard that voice.

“Wield me...”

There it was, lying on the ground—
a sword with a blade as black as night.

At that moment,
I’d forgotten all about the legend.
Maybe, when I noticed I could
use this thing as a weapon,
I just picked it up without thinking...

Looking back, though,
my body was definitely moving on its own.

One creature leaps forward,
but I swing the sword in one fell strike.
The creature’s body slams against a tree,
and its head rolls along the ground.
I stand to my feet, sword at the ready.
Two enemies left...

I’d never held a sword in my life,
but I knew exactly what
my next move should be.

Then, when all the creatures were defeated,
I found myself covered head to toe in armor...

I’m usually slow,
but even I realized what’d happened.
Somehow...I’d found the legendary sword...

The next day, I left on a journey
to find the sword’s master.

I’ll recognize ’em if they can
“take the sword into their hands.”
In other words, it can’t be held by anyone
except the master or myself.

If the sword is real,
then surely the legend is too...
That means, if I don’t find the master,
this sword’ll drain my life away...

This whole thing sucks...
I didn’t even do anything to deserve this...!

I’ll do whatever it takes to defy this fate...
Then, I’m gonna turn the rest of my life
into one long vacation...!!

Just you wait, sword master.
I’m gonna find you,
chuck this sword at your face,
then go home...!

...Nrrrgh. I don’t wanna die...

I learned about the Duke
not long after leaving on my journey.

Since he lifts the Curses of witches,
he can probably also lift the sword’s curse.
Or better yet, maybe he’s the true master...

I came to Fran convinced I was
right on the money...but I was wrong.
Just my luck.

Since arriving, though, I decided to
stay with the Duke and search
for the sword’s master here.

After all, I get to go to tons of places,
meet all kinds of people,
enjoy three helpings of snacks a day...
Not too bad, if ya ask me.

But...less than a year after
joining the Duke and his friends,
something happened.

Once again, death came knocking at my door...

Nrrghh... Everything hurts...!
Who knew wearing myself out fighting
would be this painful...

With the enemy surrounding us,
running away felt like too much of a hassle,
so I did my best to protect the rear...
...Hehe. Guess I shouldn’t fight in ways
I’m not used to, huh...?

“...My master.”

There it was. The same voice as back then—
the voice of the sword.

Sorry... Looks like I’m not gonna be around
to find your master after all...
But, it’s okay for me to go, right...?
I can’t keep my eyes open much longer...

“This will mark the second time
I save your life.”
“My...master.”

As everything faded to black...
it felt as if the sword was shining brightly.

There was once a witch.
To prepare for when the world would
fall into chaos, she forged a sword,
giving it the will to choose its own master.

What’s more, she created a legend
born from a lie so the yet unknown master
would travel the land with the sword.

“This sword will drain the life of the one who
discovers it unless its true master is found.”

That was the true story of this sword...
A story I learned while I was dreaming.

When I woke up in the Duke’s mansion,
next to me, unsurprisingly, was the sword.

So this means...this sword’d chosen me
right from the start, and all that stuff
about it draining my life away was a lie.
I was totally duped...

...Hold up! Don’t think for one second
you’re getting away with this!
My lifelong dream vacation’s
still waiting for me!

If it comes down to it,
I’ll spend the rest of my life
finding you a better master,
and make ’em take ya.
That’ll settle my debt to you for saving me!

...I’m ready for whatever lies ahead, partner.

Vee loves the rain.
It has so many stories to tell.

Like about the time it poured
onto a faraway country.
Or, the time it flowed
into a nearby river.

Whether it’s rain or puddles,
or even water sitting inside a cup—
they all tell Vee lotsa stories.

But, it looks like no one
in the village can talk to water.
Everyone’s so mean to Vee,
calling her a weird girl
who talks to water.

There’s only one person
who’s nice to Vee.

That’s Lou!
She’s Vee’s one and only friend!

Lou’s so nice.
If Vee talks about the rain,
Lou would smile and say,
“You always have something
weird to say, don’t you?”

But, there were some days
when she didn’t smile.

On those kinds of days,
she’d always have
a bruise or two somewhere...

Today, she’s quietly sitting next to Vee,
her eyes never leaving the floor.

Talking about the rain just
gets an “I see” from her,
and she keeps looking away.
Asking her what’s wrong
gives Vee no answers.
Why is that...? Vee’s worried...

Vee loves Lou.
Vee wants Lou to smile.
What should Vee do...?

It was then that Vee saw them—
the bright red fishies swimming in the rain.

Wow...! Look, Lou.
There are pretty, bright red fishies
going flappy-flappy in the rain.

Huh? There’s nothing there?
No way—the fishies are right there.
Look carefully.

“Enough already...”
Lou muttered suddenly.

“Why do you tell nothing but lies...?
The rain talks?
Fish swimming in the sky...?
Whose fault do you think it is that
I have to put up with all this crap?!”

Lou...?

“Don’t ever talk to me again.
You’re no friend of mine.”

W-Wait...
No—you got it wrong.
Vee isn’t lying.
The fishies really are there.

Don’t go away.
Vee’ll stop saying weird things.
Vee won’t talk about the rain.
So, please—don’t go away...

...What should Vee do?
Now even Lou hates her...

Vee was feeling down,
when a strange guy
with a staff came up to her.

He said the Witch Hunt people
have set their sights on Vee,
so he’ll take her somewhere safe.

But, what about Lou?
She’s not coming with us?

...Vee wants to make up with Lou.

After all, she’s Vee’s
one and only best friend.
The idea of saying goodbye
as things are is just...

But, Vee suddenly heard
the sounds of footsteps,
and she and the strange guy
were surrounded by the Knights.

Leading them was...

...Huh? Lou? Why...?

Hey, Lou...
Y’know, Vee asked to hear
lotsa stories about faraway places.

Because you said
they were fun to listen to.

Vee asked to hear lotsa stories
about swimming in rivers.
Because they made you smile.

Every day, Vee listened
to lotsa stories from the rain.
Because every day,
Vee wanted to tell them to you, Lou.

But, if you tell Vee to stop, she will.
She won’t talk to the rain,
and she won’t say anything
weird ever again...
So, please...

Please be Vee’s friend again...!

Please be Vee’s friend again...!

Tears begin to drip-drop from Lou’s eyes.

With a sad look on her face,
Lou said, “I’m sorry.”
Then she faced the Knights
and pointed at Vee.

“She isn’t a witch. I made a mistake.”

When the Knights left,
Lou threw her arms around Vee.

She kept saying,
“I’m sorry. I’m sorry,”
so Vee hugged her back.

It’s okay.
After all, your tears
are laughing so happily.

When she heard those words,
Vee finally saw Lou smile.

“...Just as I thought.
I have absolutely no idea
what you’re talking about.”

Vee and Lou finally made up,
but soon it was time to go.

The carriage took off.
Vee kept waving her hand
as she watched Lou grow
smaller and smaller
into the distance.

Goodbye.
...Goodbye!
Thank you for always
being Vee’s friend!!

Since the day Vee said goodbye to Lou,
Vee has been living in Mister’s city.

Vee was saved,
but she heard people
who protect witches
are getting captured...
Vee hopes Lou’s okay...

...Huh? A letter’s stuck under the door.

There’s no address,
and the ink’s so blurry
that Vee can’t even read
the sender’s name.

Come to think of it,
someone said not to write
your name when sending
a letter to a witch.
You’ll be in big trouble
if you get caught.

But...Vee knew right away.

The traces of water that blurred
the sender’s name are laughing
like how they did back then.

...There’s no address written on this letter,
so Vee wonders how it even got here.

Maybe, she...

Vee could hear voices calling
from right behind the door.
Voices of tears saying,
“Let’s have fun again.”

Vee quickly opened the door,
and standing on the other side was...

Master is so kind to me. He is.

He took me in when I was abandoned
as a baby for being a witch.

He gives me lots of work everyday,
and every three days,
I even get to eat. I do.

Master is very kind,
but I’m always doing something
to make him angry...

That’s what happened that day.
I disobeyed, and Master had to
spend a whole day punishing me.

It was all my fault.
Master told me to keep
out of his sight and I...I didn’t.

That’s why Master took
his valuable time to scold me...
I’m really lucky to have him. I am.

Master’s an archeologist,
so he had a lot of helpers
around him all the time.

Some of them said
very cruel things to me,
but that’s alright.

After all, I’m the one
Master trusts to help him
whenever he needs something.

He trusts me to carry really heavy things,
and to draw away bandits when we travel.

He trusts me with all of it...

Once, I got separated from
everyone in the mountains.
It took me five whole days to get home...
and when I did, Master was so...

H-He was so...

A-Anyway, I’m very fortunate.
And happy. I am.

Then, one day...
One day, Master took me out with him
to some ancient ruins. He did.

When we got there, he ordered me...
He told me not to move an inch from this spot.

Master told me to stay put,
until he was finished investigating the ruins.
That’s what he ordered me to do.

I guess...I’m supposed to stand guard?

But...the ruins are old and crumbling,
and it’s dangerous to investigate
places like this...
That’s why Master always
makes me go in first, ahead of him.
So why...

No... No! I...I shouldn’t think!

I don’t need to think,
I just need to obey.

That’s what Master told me.
So I have to stop thinking!

I was trying so hard to
make myself stop thinking,
I didn’t notice when Master disappeared.

I-It’s fine!
I’m going to do my best. I am.
I’ll keep watch and make sure
everyone’s safe!

Maybe if I do a really good job,
Master will even praise me...

But...no one came to get me.
Not that night,
or the next morning,
or even the next night...

I’ve been waiting for him ever since.

I kept waiting, even when
there were wild animals,
or freezing rain,
or when the sun burned me.
I waited, and waited,
and kept waiting
a very extra long time.

Master ordered me to, after all!

A couple times, nice people said
they’d take care of me, but...

...I told them I was fine,
and that I needed to keep
waiting right here.
They’d tell me I’d been tricked,
that he wasn’t coming back,
but I stayed...!
Master ordered me to stay, after all,
so I have to stay and wait like he asked!

The view here is always the same thing.
It starts with pale pink,
then blue, then orange,
and then, finally...
black covers the sky like spilled ink.

I don’t know how many times
I’ve watched it happen.

I wonder if Master will be back soon...

How many days has it been since then?

I don’t know.
No one ever taught me
to count that high...

How long will I have to wait...?
I’m so thirsty.
And I’m so, so tired...

“He’s abandoned you...”

There’s a voice in my head,
an urgent whisper,
telling me I’ve been abandoned...
That I knew it from the start...

That’s right...
When Master told me to stay, he...

N-No!
I haven’t been abandoned...
Master is so kind, he wouldn’t...

He wouldn’t abandon me...would he?
Has he?

I waited, just like you said, Master!
I’d never disobey you, I wouldn’t...

I did everything you wanted!
Even when it was scary, or awful...! I did it!
So why, Master...? Why...?

I wonder what I did wrong?

I always obeyed,
I waited just like he asked,
but...was it not enough?

I don’t know.
No one ever told me.
How was I supposed to know...?

No one ever taught me anything.
Not how to speak, or count,
or...or breathe...

A-And if you were just going to...
If you didn’t want me, Master, then...
I wish you would have just said so.

If you were just going to
leave me here alone, then,
I wish you could’ve...

Couldn’t you at least’ve
thrown me out properly?!
Was I not even worth
that much to you...?!

My thoughts began to spiral, but then...
I felt someone suddenly pull me
into their arms.

So warm...
I’ve never... No one has ever
held me without hurting me before...

Master...?

The one who held me
wasn’t Master. It wasn’t.

Our eyes met for a moment,
and he raised his hand, and...

“Ah...!”
I squeezed my eyes shut,
throwing my hands up to block the blow.

But, the pain I was expecting never came.
Hesitating, I opened my eyes to find
he’d rested his hand on my head.

“It’s alright,” he told me.
“You’ve done so well...”

I didn’t know those words at all...
They made me feel a way
I never ever felt before...

I’d never known that there
were things in the world
that weren’t scary,
weren’t painful...
I’d never...

Master told me never to touch him,
to stay where he didn’t
have to look at me, but...

The eyes locked with mine right now,
the hand resting on my head...
they’re both so...gentle.
Is he...?

“I’ve come to get you,” he said.
Those simple words began to
slowly break apart the chains
that bound me.

My fear began to vanish,
overwritten by a different,
unfamiliar feeling.

In that moment, I realized that I...

I’m home, Master.

I’ve been bullied ever since I was small.

Maybe, because I was a little
shorter than most people?
Or, because I was shy?
Or, because I was nervous
with no self-confidence...?

When I realized what was happening,
everyone had started ignoring me.

With the way I was,
surely even my parents had
no more love left for me.
In order to kick me out of the house,
they sent me to a training school
for the Knights of Longinus.

But, even there...the bullying didn’t stop.

With everything so new to me,
I couldn’t talk to anyone like I wanted to.
Thinking back, that’s probably
why the bullying started.

When I noticed all the talking behind my back,
I was already being treated as an outcast.

Everyone laughed at me, picked on me,
and they kept getting worse and worse...
Then in the end, some of them took
their swords and attacked me!

...So, I drew my sword for the first time,
and tried to protect myself.

I somehow managed to fight my way out,
but I no longer had a place to belong.

So on that same day,
with my body covered in wounds,
I ran away from school.

Making the most of what I learned
about the sword at school,
I joined a militia.

The witches’ Curses kept me
busy with so much work...
Still, I felt I finally found
the place where I belong...
I was happy.

...But, even that only lasted for a moment.
I was suddenly sentenced to be banished
from the militia.

Wh-Why? Why are you banishing me?!

I’m in pieces as the Knights surround me.
Then, I remember the first rule
a knight learns at school.

“The duty of the Knights is to hunt
the witches who defy the Church...”

N-No! I-I’m not a w-w-witch...!
I-I gotta fight...!
B-B-Before they kill me...
I gotta...kill them!!

In the midst of the blood and cries,
a girl lies hurt on the floor
as she struggles to speak.
...It was the girl who invited me
to join the militia.

“How...could you do such a thing?”

Y-You tried to banish me...and not just that.
You even called the Knights to...kill me...

“Banish...? We just told you to
take a break for a while...
Then, you suddenly...”

You’re lying... Lying.
You said I was banished...
You must have. You did, right...?
...Y-You didn’t?
Th-Then, the Knights...
just rushed over here
after hearing the noise...?

“I feel so sorry for you...
That’s how you’ve always lived, isn’t it?”

...No. No. NOOO!!

All I could do was scream
and run as far away as possible.

N-No. That’s impossible.
There’s just no way.
I-I-Is it all in my head?
E-E-Everything until now...? All of it?

How I was bullied when I was small...?
How I was kicked out of home and
forced to go to the training school...?
Everything?

W-Wait—that’s right.
Mom and Dad were worried about me
being too shy to make friends,
and sent me to that school...

B-But, everyone over there
talked behind my back,
saying I was creepy or something...
N-No, that’s not right.
No one said anything.
Not one thing...about me...

W-Wait, then...what about the time
I was attacked at school...?

A-Ahh...I remember now...
I thought...because of how I was...
everyone was talking bad about me.
I felt so sure...
That’s why I drew my sword...

They... They weren’t bad, but I...I...
I hurt them all...
Everything that’s happened until now is...

“I feel so sorry for you...
That’s how you’ve always lived, isn’t it?”

No. No... A-Aaa-Aaaaaaahhh!

With my heart shattered to pieces,
I wandered about day after day...
losing all track of where I was.
The one who took me in was him—the Duke.

When he smiled at me and said
that everything would be okay,
I finally realized...

Ah, everything was just in my head after all.
There wasn’t anything bad about me.
I mean, there’s just no way
anyone would be friends with me
if I really was bad.

Yeah...that’s right...
This is where I belong now.
I’m sure this time
I’ll be able to make some friends...

...M-My lord, s-sometimes...
I-I have, um...weird thoughts.

I-I wonder if people have actually bullied me,
talked behind my back, tried to kill me...
or if all of that was in my head, or something...

...If everything were just delusions of mine,
if there are no bad people out there...
and if I’m the one who’s bad...
and what not...

B-But, if I was...s-surely I wouldn’t
have it in me to l-live anymore, right?
Th-That’s definitely
too m-much for me to bear...

But i-if... If I really am...bad...
Then, please.

...Please be the one to kill me, my lord.

I dreamt of being a witch when I grew up.

My earliest memory is a wild horse making my
five short years of life flash before my eyes.
Then, a swirling dark robe
and a glimmer of starlight.

Before those hooves could stave in my head,
she appeared, gallantly driving away
the horse with a mysterious power.

It would’ve been understandable if
I’d turned away, shielding my eyes against
the inevitable...but I saw everything.
She saved my life...with magic.

...And no sooner had she rescued me,
than she departed.

Even as I watched her go,
she shined ever so brightly.

Witches are reviled, cast as
a sinister presence in the world.
She was no exception.

The Church was after her,
so she fled after saving me.
My parents tried so hard to
keep me quiet though.
Something about how being saved
by a witch was embarrassing.

But, I knew the truth...
Witches are heroes!

They choose to live in the shadows,
striking down evildoers the law can’t punish.
Evil that silences greater evil.
That’s what witches are!

That’s the truth, that’s what no one gets!
I’m the only one in this town
who understands...
and if this isn’t destiny, then what is?!

That encounter meant something.
Meeting her like that...
there’s no question about it!

I’ve been modeling myself after
that witch since the day we met.

She had an eyepatch,
and her hair was...long?
Yeah, long...

I copied her look and tried to
talk the way she did.

I think she was saying
something about the stars too...
Ah, I remember!
The “Sovereign of the Stars.”
That was it!

Perfect! From this day onward,
I’ll be Sovereign of the Stars!

Everyone else thinks I’m
some kind of stupid eccentric,
because none of them know the truth.

BUT...that’s fine with me.
Friends are but frivolous when
one serves a higher cause!

That’s right!
For I am Sovereign of the Stars—
Witness of the World!
Solitude suits me perfectly.
I’m not lonely in the slightest.

Heroes don’t need anyone
but themselves, after all.

One day, I discovered a suspicious man
with a staff wandering through town.
He seemed to be looking for someone...

Now that I think about it,
everyone was abuzz with gossip about
a witch hunt the next town over.
A lot of girls had been executed, they said.

A lot of the parents too.
For hiding their daughters.
For protecting witches...

Wait...could that man with the staff be...?!

I’m the only one in this town
who knows the truth.
The only one who’s figured out
who he really is.

It’s up to me...
The clutches of evil threaten this town—
threaten everyone. I gotta protect them!

I started tailing him,
but soon lost sight of him.
For him to shake me off...
He’s even more suspicious than I thought!

Just then, I heard a piercing scream
from the town square.

In the town square, a creature unlike
anything I’d ever seen before was rampaging.
Wh-What is that...?

That’s no normal animal.

The familiar sights of my town were
being destroyed right before my eyes.
But, it all felt like something out
of another world.

People were lashing out in anger,
crying in fear, and none of it seemed real...
It was like the pages of a dark fairy tale
come to life...

Then, the creature’s howl split
the air of the square,
snapping me back to reality.

In that moment, all those people paralyzed
with fear broke and ran for their lives.

They trampled on small children,
shoving anyone in their way to the ground.

It was exactly the kind of scene
I’d always imagined.
An enemy appears,
and the dashing hero shows up to...

No. There’s no way I can do that.
I-I mean, I’m nothing special...
I’m just a nobody...!

As my mind spun into panic,
a familiar shadow crossed
right in front of me.

That’s...the man with the staff!

He stood in the middle of the town square,
protecting as many people as he could...

Watch out!

Sure enough, the creature
turned on the man.
He dodged its attack,
but only by a few inches...

He’s barely holding on!
All he’s been able to do is dodge,
and yet...he refuses to run.

Why’s he doing all this?
...So everyone has a chance to escape?

But, the beast finally cornered him,
and drew closer for the final strike.

I’m not special. I know that.

But...heroes don’t pick
and choose who they save!

They don’t save only those
who can be saved.
Heroes save people...
because that’s who they are!

Before my mind had time to catch up,
my feet had already started running.

Suddenly, light poured
from my outstretched hand,
sending the creature flying!

What was that just now? ...Magic?

I didn’t have time to relax though.
The creature next turned its ire on me,
and lunged forward.

Ah...!

I shut my eyes in horror,
when a mysterious ray of light
passed beside me!

“Thank you for protecting him.
He means the world to us...”

Not long after saying those words,
several witches, each one draped
in mystical light, raced towards the creature!

What followed was everything
I’d ever imagined.
The witches—the heroes—
vanquishing the evildoer.
A tale as old as time.

...Except for the part where no one thanked us.
They drove me and the other witches
out of town, blaming us for spreading calamity.

But, it’s alright—I’m not lonely anymore.
I have friends now.
Friends who aren’t imaginary, but real...!

These witches aren’t quite how
I’d always imagined they would be though.

No one fawns over them,
or even bothers to thank them.
As a matter of fact, it’s quite the opposite.

But, none of that changes how I feel.

Witches are heroes.
If the people of the world don’t see that yet,
I’ll make them!

...By becoming a true hero.
One who’ll save the world.

Mysterious powers dwell
in the weapons I create.

They’re magical weapons that never break,
never rust...and guide their owners to victory.

Years ago, some people
were afraid of my weapons,
and they often chased me
out of their shops.

Master was the only one
nice enough to take care of me.
He died from a disease
a long time ago, though.

Now that I’ve taken over Master’s shop,
at the very least, I’ve got to protect it.

Not only that, but if people
have strong weapons,
there’ll be no more deaths...
and no more crying.

That’s why I kept creating weapons.
Ones that were strong.
Ones that would keep
their owners alive...like magic.

One day, there was talk in town about
how our country’s military had been
decimated by an enemy witch squadron.

The witches formed shields
that deflected everything away,
preventing any of our attacks
from getting through.

My weapons are augmented with magic power,
but apparently they were useless
against those shields.

That witch squadron’s quickly
invading the land,
and before long,
they’ll be at our doorstep...

I’ve got to do something.
I’m a witch and a blacksmith,
so there must be something only I can do.

That’s it—I’ll try increasing the magic power
I augment my weapons with.
Their usual amplified strength
just won’t cut it anymore.

I’ve got to use an even greater
amount of magic power.
It’ll take time, but I will get it done.

Since then, I tenaciously focused
magic power into my weapons.
To fight against the witch squadron.
To protect as many of
the townsfolk as possible.

...And, to create a power
that’ll decimate the enemy.

After a great deal of trial and error,
it was finally complete.

By pouring every ounce
of my magic power into it,
I created a weapon that could
break through those witches’ shields—
a magic sword.

It had the might capable of annihilating
100 soldiers in a single swing.

It was a true symbol of power.
Its might will crush the spirits
of anyone who lays eyes on it,
and wars will end in an instant.

Back then, I felt so proud of these hands.
These hands that created a weapon
that would protect everyone.
