When the witch squadron finally came
and attacked us, the army used my sword.
Then...tragedy struck.

A single swing decimated the witch squadron.
The battlefield was littered with
what remained of the witches...
and among them, a little girl...

What... What in the world did I...?
That isn’t the weapon I created.
It’s just a tool for murder.

At that moment, I finally realized...
what it truly means to end a war,
and what I did to achieve that.

...I took one look at my hands,
and all I saw was filth.

I quit being a blacksmith.
My weapon did protect lives,
but it also stole many more of them away.
And, the sight of all those bodies just...

I was holding onto false beliefs.
In the end, weapons are nothing more
than tools for murder.

Days passed by, then I met her.
Richesse, the Merchant of Death.

She held her hand out to me and said
she needed my power to protect
the lives of many.

But, I brushed her hand aside
and told her to stay away from me.

“I refuse... Many have died
from a weapon I created...
and in such a horrifying way...
There’s nothing someone like me
can protect...”

But, Richesse grabbed my hands and said,
“Would you still say that if I told you
there are lives these hands have saved?”

My weapons saved lives?

No way... After all, I’m...

Richesse then took out an old sword.
I recognized it. This sword was something
I forged years ago.

It’s a magic sword that will never break,
and guide its owner to victory.
When I forged this sword,
the only thing I thought about
was protecting lives.

“Thanks to this sword, everyone survived.
Here’s your proof.”

Richesse then handed me a bundle of letters.
They contained the words
of gratitude of many people.
Richesse says she’s been searching
all over for me to make sure I get them.

Ahh...that’s right. I was making weapons
to protect lives—not destroy them.
But, the threat of the witch squadron
scared me into creating a weapon
that steals lives away.

No more mistakes.
This time, I’ll swing my hammer
like how I did before,
and create weapons that protect lives.
Magic weapons made only for
keeping their owners alive.

“I’ll be the one who decides who’s
worthy of wielding your weapons,
so keep on making them—
weapons that protect lives.”

With those words, Richesse became
my own personal merchant.

There are many people who
need my weapons for protection.
Richesse delivers my weapons to them.

Among them are people who
need weapons for killing.
But, Richesse hides me away from them,
and always stays by my side protecting me.

She’s even started calling me “partner.”

It’s just, I’m still uneasy about
calling myself Richesse’s partner.
Not while my hands look as filthy
as they are now, at least...

I’ve got to save a lot more people.
When I do, though,
can I finally call myself Richesse’s partner?

But, just as I thought,
my hands only bring about tragedies.

I heard a rumor.
That sword which destroyed
the witch squadron had turned
into an evil sword,
raging out of control and attacking
anyone who approaches it.

I augmented that evil sword with
my magic power over a long period of time.
I’m sure that same magic power is
what’s raging out of control.

The only way to stop it is to destroy it.
But, challenging that evil sword needs
even more magic power than what dwells in it.

That’s far beyond what I can conjure up...
but I’ve got to do it.
That’s my responsibility as the sword’s creator.

If doing so burns away all the life I have left,
so be it.

Then, as my hand trembled,
Richesse firmly placed hers on top of it.

“If that’s what needs to be done,
my power is yours to use, partner.”

Richesse, why...?
As I stood there dumbfounded,
she spoke to me with
the same bright smile she had
on the day we first met.

“We’re partners.
We share sins, pain—everything.
So, don’t you even think of
carrying this burden alone.”

In actuality,
I knew I shouldn’t involve Richesse.
This sin is mine to bear.
But, I didn’t have it in me
to brush her hand away.

Yes, that’s right.
I create, and Richesse delivers.
That’s who we are.

From this point on,
I’ll keep creating weapons that protect lives,
using these hands that Richesse—
that my partner believes in.

“If you’re going to die anyway,
why not give your life over to me?”

Some strange girl asked me that
out of the blue one day.
Her question made her seem very rude.
Then again, it’s not like my life was
precious to me at this point.

So, as I pulled the sword out of my heart,
I answered. “Sure.”

The sword left a hole in my chest
that slowly began to heal.
The girl grinned as she watched it all
unfold before her very eyes.

Just who is this person? What a creep...
That was my first impression of her.

Even now, I still don’t know her name,
but what I do know is what she was called.

“The Witch of Murder.”

This dreadful witch, who could destroy
the world with the touch of her fingertip,
smiled at me as gleefully as a child.

“A witch’s power comes from the heart.
The power to defy death should’ve been
born from a heart that doesn’t wish to die,
yet you want to. Why?”

The moment I thought of asking her
why she wanted to know,
she answered me.
“I want to save you.”

I’m not foolish enough to
believe such empty words.

But, if she’s that curious,
I’ll tell her my story.

Bandits came to my village
and attacked my family.
The fear I felt from seeing it
all happen turned me into a witch.

When one’s family is attacked
before their very eyes,
it’s normal to wanna save them, right?

Well, I couldn’t even think about
saving my family...

I was so scared...
so frightened...so hopeless.
I wished only...to save myself...

I wanted to save my family.
The family I was supposed to have loved.

But, I was so scared...
All I thought was that I didn’t want to die...
and ran away, leaving everyone behind...!
Then, I was given my power...
My...punishment...

Look at me. You can stab me!
Crush me! Even break me!!

...But, I can’t even die...
For the rest of eternity,
I’ll live on...alone...

“Don’t worry. That power can
become someone else’s solace.”

...Enough with the half-minded words!
I know who you are, “Witch of Murder.”
You destroyed a single city, was it?
If only I had that kind of power too...

As my words trailed off,
the witch looked at me,
shook her head, and spoke.
“This power isn’t as good as you think it is.”

She started telling me her story.
“There’s nothing significant about
what I have to say.”

“My lover died in an accident.
I fell into despair, screaming that
the world should be destroyed.
Of course, I wasn’t serious.
It’s just what I thought at the time.”

“But, I did feel anger for this asinine world.
That anger was real.”

“My wish was granted.
When I came to,
the entire city was gone.
My family, friends,
every single person who lived there...
They had all turned to dust.”

“My murderous power changes
anything I touch into dust.
This is how my wish took shape.
Doesn’t fate have a sick sense of humor?
I’m just an ugly monster
wearing the skin of a human.”

She laughed happily
after telling me her story.
Her heart was also broken,
but in a way that was different than mine.

The two of us then set out on a journey.

The “Witch of Murder” has
a bounty on her head.
As we ran away from city to city,
she turned my body to dust,
claiming she was conducting experiments.

I had no clue what
she was doing while I was dead.
Whenever I was resurrected,
her grin would always be there to greet me.

“Good morning.
Now, that’s a face that creeps me out
no matter how many times I see it.”
“Thank you. Now then,
let me try killing you one more time.”

I’ve gotten used to these exchanges of ours.
As my life feels more and more detached
from my body, even my sense of reality
begins slipping away.

That reminds me.
It should be about time we leave this city.

Are we going to a southern city
famous for its cuisine next?
I wanna go to a hot spring in the north too.
Hey, what do you think?

As I asked about our next destination,
she no longer had her usual grin.
Instead, she had a gentle smile on her face.

“Our journey’s over.
It’s time for our wishes to finally come true.”

Then, her body started turning to dust.

“I was bound to die by my own power,
so I’m glad I made it in time.
As we part ways, I’ll crystalize my power
and leave it with you.
Using it should allow even you to die.”

Why...would you do something like that...?

“Even a cursed power can save others.
Power may take the shape of a monster,
but at its heart is a human.
That is what I wanted to prove to you.”

...I...see.

“You are my solace.
Thanks to you, I can die as a human.
I wish that you may also be blessed
with a happy death.”

With those last words, she turned to dust,
leaving behind a single white flower
that lay at her feet.

“...Our wishes,” huh.
She really was a selfish person
until the very end.

I felt her warmth in the flower
as I held it in my hands,
and tears that were once dry
ran down my cheeks.

In the end, the Witch of Murder
used her power for me.

Even if a power is cursed,
there’s no doubt that at its core is
a human who loves others.
That’s what she meant when
she said she could “die as a human.”

I gently stroked the flower she left behind.
With this, I’ll be able to die too...

But, now’s not the time to do so.

I’ll fulfill her dying wish.
That’ll be the “proof of my humanity.”

I sewed the flower near my heart,
and started walking.

I’ll die as a human.
Until then, I’ll live on.
That was her dying wish...

To provide me the only way I can die.
Not as a monster, but as a normal girl.

I was a war orphan in
a country full of civil wars.
Nothing really out of the ordinary.

Even so, I refuse to live just whining
about how terrible my life is.
All I know is the battlefield,
and that’s why I know
there are things I can do.

Like, be a battlefield merchant.

Having a merchant on the battlefield
would save many lives.
I’ve witnessed many that would’ve been
saved if they just had resources.

...If someone seeks help,
deliver what they need.
No matter where they are.
That’s my golden rule.

Some time ago,
I ventured into a remote region.

It was terrible to see.
War left the land with nothing but scars.
My hometown was the same,
when a lack of supplies left us defenseless...

But, something was different here.
Just when I thought this place had
been completely wiped out,
I found survivors...
each of them with unique weapons.

Those weapons were enhanced with magic—
specially crafted to protect their wielders
rather than kill an enemy.
They are what saved the village.

It was my first time seeing
weapons like those.

I eventually found myself wanting to
meet the one who made them,
and began my search.

I also had requests from the village children
to take care of, after all.

Waiting for me at the end of
my search was a blacksmith.
But, her eyes were full of darkness,
and her heart tightly locked away.

“...Many are dead because of
a weapon I made.”

After saying that,
Artie knocked my hand away.

Ah, I see what’s happened.
This girl’s broken.

The way I see it though,
as someone who’s known
war their entire life,
death was inevitable.

That’s why I might not be able to truly
understand the despair she’s feeling.
But...

Her weapons undoubtedly saved lives.
I’ve seen firsthand just how many lives
weapons that protect have saved.

I grasped Artie’s hands.
Those heroic hands that
saved the lives of many.

Then, I held out the sword and letters that
those children entrusted to me to deliver.

“Thanks to this sword, everyone survived.
Here’s your proof.”

“Thank you for saving my life...”

That was one of many messages
in this bundle of letters.
What started off as only one letter
quickly grew as I went from
battlefield to battlefield.

“There’s one letter for
each life you’ve saved.”
Hearing those words,
Artie broke down in tears.

I saw how tiny her back was.
It was so fragile and gentle.
No one would believe she’d tried to bear
the weight of other people’s lives on it.

She needs someone to support her.
Just like a sword has a sheath,
a sharp blade needs something to protect it.
Yes—a partner.

From this point on,
I’ll help bear the weight you carry.
Your sins, your pain—everything.

I held my hand out to Artie,
and this time, she firmly took hold of it.

Since then, I became
Artie’s personal merchant,
and the two of us set up shop together.

Come to think of it, that was the beginning.
The beginning of the unstoppable duo—
the genius blacksmith and
the invincible merchant!

One day, I happened to hear a rumor.
One about an evil sword.

It’s said to be a murderous sword,
created by Artie with the purpose of
destroying lives.

Apparently it’s raging out of control,
striking down anything in its path.

No regular weapon’s powerful enough
to destroy that evil sword.
It’s gotta be one augmented with
even more magic power.

Still filled with regret,
Artie was trying to pour
all of her magic power into a weapon
like some kind of punishment.
But, there was no way I was gonna
let her do that.

“If that’s what needs to be done,
my power is yours to use, partner.”

I took Artie by the hand.
“We’re partners.
My power is yours,
and your sins are mine.”

“Besides, the two of us now have
much more power than
you had when you were alone then.”

“We’ll quell that evil sword,
and restore peace...”

“Together, we’ll turn our hopes into a power
that’ll bring that destructive sword and
our sins to an end.”

Our creation was draped
in two colors of light.
It was a magic sword,
and the spirits of Artie and me
made it shine brilliantly...

Now, we have a chance...!

We quickly made our way to the ruins of
the battlefield where the evil sword
was rumored to be.

When we saw the crater,
and smelled the stench of death,
we knew it was there.

Its ominous glow looked as though
it was swarming with the regrets of
every victim it had claimed...

This...is a weapon?
It’s more like a monster...
No—now’s not the time to be scared!

Suddenly, Artie took my hand into her own.
The sound of her warm heartbeat begins to
drown out my fear and anxiety.

That’s right. The two of us are one.

We will never be broken!

We took one look at each other before
charging towards the evil sword.
The holy radiance of our blade
tears the ominous power asunder.

As the evil sword crumbled away,
its ominous glow vanished as if
being pulled into the heavens.

We did it. We destroyed the sword.

As I sighed in relief,
Artie threw her arms
around me from behind.
With tears welling in her eyes,
she said to me...

“Thank you, Richesse.
And, I’m sorry for dragging you into this.”

It looks like she doesn’t quite get it yet.

“There’s no way I wasn’t gonna help you.
We’re partners after all.
We share sins, pain—everything.”

“I’ll help you carry the burdens that are
too heavy for you to carry alone.”

“That’s why, if there’s ever
a time I’m in trouble,
you better be sure to help me too,
okay partner? Hehe.”

...What should I do?

In an effort to rejuvenate our strength,
everyone came to the lake to play, but...

“I can do the doggy paddle, y’know!
I don’t need your help, you dummy!
You big, blue DUMMY!”

After saying that,
Moddey cried and fled from my sight.

The doggy paddle?
All she did was cling to me, though...

...At times like this,
Sophia and Valeriede would
undoubtedly know the best course of action.

...I truly have no idea what to do.

I was also nervous when
I first experienced the water,
but I learned there was no need
to feel frightened.

Even Cerberus is over there enjoying herself,
jumping and splashing about...

But, everyone here is smaller
and younger than I am.

As the one entrusted by the Duke
to take charge of everyone,​
I must do something for them.

That’s it. I’ll start by helping them
get accustomed to the water.

The best remedy for
alleviating fear is play.
Bearing that in mind,
I took Moddey towards
the area of water where
everyone was playing...

“N-No, get the heck away from me!
Anything but water... Anything!”

Moddey then ran away as fast
as her legs could carry her.
Why in the world would she...?

Moddey hates me.

I thought she was having fun
in the water with everyone.
Nina was going “Yah!”
and Sonya was yelling “Here I go!”
Maybe Cerberus overdid it
with “Kaboom!” though...

...What should I do?

Before I knew it,
everyone returned to the lake,
and resumed playing in the water.

Moddey stayed some distance away,
keeping her eyes on everyone...
I knew it—she wants to join them.

As the one in charge of these children, I...!

Suddenly, I heard screams
coming from the lake.

My eyes dashed to
the direction of the voices.
There, I saw the children
cowering in the water,
and a cursed creature standing
atop the water’s surface.

That must be what’s scaring the children...!

The Duke entrusted them to me.
I must carry out my mission...!

Before I could do anything,
the creature roared,
and the entire area was covered in fog.

I have a bad feeling about this...
The same as I felt back then.
When the Knights’ bloodlust
consumed my entire village.
When...the Witch Hunt began.

By the time I felt something was amiss,
I was already too late...
and because of me, Ma was...

“...Sabrina.”

That voice...
No, it can’t be possible.
After all, she...

My mother emerged from within the fog.
Her smile was warm and gentle,
just as how I remembered it...

But in the next instant,
her body was engulfed in flames.

“...Save me, Sabrina.”

As those words leave my mother’s mouth,
she reaches her hand out to me...
No... This is an illusion,
not my mother. But...

“...I see. Once again, all you’re doing is
watching while I burn, aren’t you?”

...That’s right. That day, all I did was watch
as the flames swallowed my mother alive...

That day, I could do nothing as my mother
was tossed into the raging fire.
Nothing... Even as she called out
my name again and again...

My past still has me in its chains.

Everything I witnessed that day
flashed into my mind,
paralyzing my body.
I can’t run to my mother,
let alone reach out towards her...

I still am, and always will be,
that powerless little girl...

“Sabrina!”

Suddenly, Moddey called out my name.

I look and see her in the lake,
despite her hating it so much...

“Your mother’s resting peacefully.
If the same thing happened to you,
you’ll make her so worried she’ll jump
straight out of her grave.”

“Go on, show her.
Show her who you are now...!”

Moddey’s right. I’m no longer
that powerless little girl.
I am Sabrina.
Comrade to the Duke—to everyone!

Reach out. Step forward!
Your comrades are counting on you...
Move!

In that moment,
I found a strange light
shining in my hand.
Is this...a new power?

Ever since that fateful day,
my past refused to unbind me
from its chains.

But...even with the way I am now...

I have comrades who depend on me—
who believe in me.
That’s why...!

The light in my hand dispelled the flames
that blocked my path.

This time, I will save everyone!

With one leap forward,
I took hold of my mother’s
outstretched hand.

I will never forget that day
for the rest of my life.
It will live on inside me,
becoming my curse.
Even so...

“Just remembering that day
had always frightened me.
But, not anymore.
I will live on bearing this scar.
So, please...rest in peace, Ma.”

With one last warm smile,
the illusion of my mother vanished.

...Goodbye, Ma. I’ll keep moving forward
with my comrades at my side.

After bidding my mother farewell
deep within my heart,
I raised my head and focused
on the remaining enemy.

I quickly draw my sword and tear apart
the blockade of illusions before me,
clearing my path.

I dash full speed ahead...
towards the creature...
piercing through it!

...Haaaah!!

As if bursting like a bubble,
the cursed creature vanished into the air,
lifting the fog from the area.
Ahh, I won. I won against...myself...

The light that now dwells in
my hand is proof of that.

Around me, the children regained
their senses and began to move.
Thank goodness.
Everyone appears to be unharmed.

“You did great, Moddey.”

Hearing those words,
Moddey looked proud of herself.
“Didja expect anything
less from me?” she said.

“By the way, Moddey.
You don’t seem bothered being
this deep in the water.
It looks like you’ve overcome your fear.”

“...Ah... Ahhhhh...!
Just as I thought—I can’t do water...!
Lailaaa! Saaave meee!!”

To think she can run around in
the lake with that much energy...
With how quickly she’s grown,
it looks like she has much to teach me too.

We took some time off
our journey to visit a lake...
but to tell the truth, I hate water...

I’ll take it slow and start by
dipping my feet in... Aaah!

I get only one toe in,
but that’s all it takes to make
goosebumps run all over my body,
and my tail stand straight up.

Sabrina softly giggled as she watched me.

“To think that you’re scared of
the water, of all things.
I guess you are a child, after all.”

The nerve...!
I’m already a fully fledged,
grown-up gravekeeper!
Not some kid!
I-If I get serious enough...
I can...at least... Nnrrrggh...!

“There, there. Everyone has something
they’re not good at dealing with.”

The water was barely up to my knees,
but I was already clinging onto Sabrina
for dear life...

Nnnrrggh... You dummy!
You big, blue DUMMY!!

Nnnrgh... Why did I run away
crying like some kid...?
I wanna hide under a rock...

I thought for sure Sabrina had enough of me,
but she came to see how I was doing.
“We’ll start by helping you get accustomed
to the water,” she said.

Y’know, Sabrina might not be so bad after all...

...Yeah! I know I’m better than this!
If water’s the problem, all I gotta do is fix it!

“That’s the spirit.
As it so happens,
I know something that’ll help us out.”

After saying that, I saw her holding
a bucket filled to the brim with water.

...What’s thaaat...?
I hope you’re not gonna do
what I think you’re gonna do...

“If you have fun playing with water,
it’ll stop frightening you. Here!”

AAAHHH!!
I can’t believe you just splashed me!
No matter what you say, I...AAAH!!
Why’s there water attacking me from behind?!

Hey...uh...guys?
What’s with all the smiles?
This isn’t some
water splashing game, y’know...
No, wai... Sto... AAAAAAH!!

Humans are helpless in
the face of the stormy sea.
There’s nothing we can do but
accept our fate and get soaked...

I was gazing out at the lake,
letting the truth of life sink in,
when I heard voices.
Voices so faint, only a gravekeeper
like me could make them out.

I could hear their pain and suffering...
Something happened here a long time ago...

At that moment, I heard
screams coming from the lake.
I turned to see everyone cowering in the water,
and in front of them, a cursed creature!

Right as I was about to go and save them,
a strange fog fell over me.

“You’re useless.”

...!
Inside the fog, my late dad appeared
right before my very eyes.

“When the disease came to our village,
all you did was watch.”

Then, all of a sudden,
I fell right into the lake.

The fog trapped me in an illusion.
I knew none of this was real,
but I was so scared...
I couldn’t breathe...or move...

“Nothing’s changed.
You’re still useless.”

Then, everything went black.

A gravekeeper’s job is to
watch over the departed.
Ensuring they have a peaceful rest
is all we can do.

I don’t think there’s anything wrong with that.
I mean, can you imagine someone dying,
only to be left all alone?
It’d be so sad if no one watched over them.

But, that doesn’t mean a gravekeeper
should wait around for someone to die.

After seeing the Duke save
one person after another,
I did some soul searching.

What is the job of a gravekeeper?
And, as a gravekeeper,
what can I do for everyone?

“My foolish daughter.
Just give up, and rest in peace.”

My father’s voice echoes
throughout the inside of the lake.

...It’s true. I’m just a tiny, useless kid.
But, I realized something after I left the village.

To let someone rest
peacefully in their grave,
I gotta make sure they’re
smiling before they go in.
Make them smile,
just like what the Duke does.

Gravekeepers aren’t bystanders
who just watch over the departed.
We have another important job—
taking care of everyone so they can smile!

At that moment,
something dove into the lake.
No way... It’s Laila!

...That’s right. You always knew
how to make me smile, huh Laila?

I rise to my feet with Laila at my side.
The illusion no longer had me in its clutches.

When I opened my eyes, the fog had waned.
The area was still blanketed in white,
but I could see a figure hanging their head.

“Sabrina!”

There’s no answer.
The fog’s trapped her in its prison.
But, now I know the words
I should say to her!

“Your mother’s resting peacefully.
If the same thing happened to you,
you’ll make her so worried
she’ll jump straight out of her grave!
Go on, show her.
Show her who you are now...!”

The fog starts to thicken once more,
hiding Sabrina away.
But, I’m not worried.

Sabrina’s someone who fights
so that everyone can smile.
...See, look.

The fog is torn apart
by a blinding cascade of light.

It looks like everyone’s saved now that
Sabrina defeated that cursed creature.

Laila nuzzles against me,
then runs off into the sky.
Next to her was Dad,
smiling like he does once in a blue moon.

“Keep it up,” he tells me.
That goes without saying, y’know.

I’ll make everyone smile,
whether they’re alive or not.
That’s a job only a gravekeeper
like me can do! Hehehe.

So...don’t worry about me.

Dad had already said his piece.
Laila barked happily...then they both
disappeared into the big blue sky.

Thank you, Dad...Laila... Goodbye.
As I saw them off,
Sabrina smiled happily at me.

“You don’t seem bothered
being this deep in the water.
It looks like you’ve overcome your fear.”

“...Ah... Ahhhhh...!
Just as I thought—I can’t do water...!
Lailaaa! Saaave meee!!”

I just love festivals.

I can’t get enough of the noise, laughter,
and of course, everyone’s sights locked
onto my circus troupemates and me!

There’s a festival in a city famous for art.
It was apparently started by musicians as
a ritual ceremony to mourn the dead.

But nowadays, it’s become more like
an annual music festival,
with hundreds of visitors coming from
all over to see it.

The streets are alive with
traveling entertainers and dancers.
It’s a festival that can only be
experienced in this city of art.

How can I not join in on the fun!

Right now, my circus troupemates
aren’t here with me,
but I’m more than enough to put on
a show that’ll set the place on fire!

I quickly head to the city square and see
traveling acrobats putting on a show.
Watching them were children with
bright smiles on their faces.

Then, as I was about to ask
the acrobats if I could join them,
something happened.

“Enough with the noise.
This is a ritual ceremony, damn sinners.”

When that elderly man came out
of the crowd and said that,
the music came to a complete stop,
and the smiles disappeared from
the children’s faces.

Wait, didn’t Vera say something about this?

I think she said, while this event’s
more like a music festival nowadays,
one of the elderly thinks otherwise,
and causes an uproar every year.

And, the ritual ceremony should be
held quietly to mourn the dead,
so making noise will incur
the wrath of the dead, or something...

“It’s absolutely ridiculous
how vulgar acrobatics are.
Get that filth out of my city!”

After saying that,
the elderly man swung his cane around,
causing everyone around him to
clear out and leave.

As the atmosphere grew awkward,
I heard the sound of a child crying.

“Hey there. What’s wrong?”

I called out to a young boy crouching down
in a corner, and he had a look of surprise
when we exchanged glances.
As he sobbed, he spoke to me.

“I just came to watch all the shows...
but...the wrath of the dead...”

That’s all I could make out.
Hmmm... Maybe the uproar
just now scared him?

But, he wasn’t the only one
who was shaken up.
Everyone was...
Even that elderly man...

Alright. Guess I’m up!

If the ringmaster found out that I let
an audience go home with gloomy faces,
he’d definitely give me an earful.

Gather ’round!
The world’s greatest gunslinger’s
special show is about to begin!

I captured the audience’s gaze the moment
they heard the boom of my voice.

Standing among them was that young boy...
Keep your eyes on me.
I’m about to turn that frown upside down!

Here I go!
Check out these ultra-fast quick shots,
and magnificent gun spinning!
Followed by...my trusty trick shots!

After I closed out my performance
with a cool pose,
the children responded with
smiles and applause.

But, the only one that wasn’t laughing
was that elderly man.

...Guess I’m not there yet.
I wasn’t able to put
a smile on everyone’s face.

The moment that thought
ran through my head,
cheerful music started to play.

It was those traveling acrobats!

“Let’s do this together.
We’ll brighten up this festival,
and put smiles on everyone’s faces!”

They then started putting on
all different kinds of performances.

Now, that’s what I’m talking about!♪

Keep your eyes on us.
There’s no way you can stop us
from putting a smile on your face!

The streets were alive
with cheers and laughter,
when suddenly...
fog started blanketing the area.

There’s something weird about this fog...
I’ve got a very bad feeling about this...

“The wrath of the dead... It’s real.”

Someone said the words that fanned
the flames of everyone’s anxiety,
and the fog started to thicken in response.

The smiles started to fade away...
one by one.

I wonder what my circus troupemates
would do at a time like this...

They’d probably say,
“Let’s put on a show that’ll
make everyone smile so hard,
they’ll forget whatever they were
worrying about.”

Fun memories are precious,
and I won’t let any scary ones
take them away.
That’s why...!

“Alright, everyone!
All eyes and ears on me!”

“Step right up for an exciting show that’ll
send your worries flying into the sky!”

As the creepy fog hung over us,
I carried on with the show.

...Don’t you worry about a thing, everyone...
Keep your eyes on me...!

Suddenly, I heard the faint sound of applause.

It was the elderly man!
As he clapped his hands,
I saw a huge smile on his face!

Afterwards, more and more
people started to clap,
their faces left with
no more traces of worry!

Huh? The fog’s been lifted...?
Just what the heck was that?

Oh well. More importantly...
Hey, bring the music back!
Make some more noise, everyone!
We’ve got a festival to enjoy!♪

Thank you very much!

I took a slight bow,
when I heard a voice whispering to me.

“...Thank you. This is what
I’ve always wanted to see.”

I look back and see
that young boy starting to fade,
till he finally vanished.
His smile never leaving his face.

No way... Was that...?

Then, the elderly man came to me
with an awkward look on his face,
and spoke to me.

“I apologize for my actions earlier.
I hate outsiders,
and I wasn’t in the best mood,
but your show really made my day.”

I finally put a smile on his face.

Soon after, fireworks shoot into the sky,
soothing the spirits of the dead,
and bringing the festival to a close.

...I’ll do my best so the smiles
we see here don’t ever fade away.
So, make sure you come back
for some more fun, okay...?

Alright, time to get
my head back in the game...
Hey, all you kids, grandparents,
and everyone in between!
Come join me for some fun!

Behold the world’s greatest gunslinger,
and leave with memories
that you’ll treasure forever!

The Duchy of Fran—the peaceful country surrounded by flowers and windmills.

Located on the southernmost point of the continent, it is also known as a poor, remote nation. Its poverty is owed to its lack of industries, but the dukes throughout history have prioritized the happiness of the citizens over national growth. This has made the poorest country in the land into what many say is the happiest.

However, it could do nothing to stop the Witch Hunt. People’s fears created ensuing violence, which turned a normal, innocent girl into “The Witch of Mourning Flowers.”

The Principality of Brook—the country famous for its vast, beautiful forest, and the ancient castle dwelling within.

Since antiquity, it has been seen as the most suitable place for witches to live because of the rich magic power flourishing throughout the land. In recent times, witches who have escaped the Witch Hunt have come to live here in hiding, with some of them said to have lived for hundreds of years.

This country was once said to have the most beautiful greenery on the continent. But now, it is shut away from the world by the “Curse of Ice.” Freezing the land are the hopeless tears of “The Witch of Snowy Illusions,” whose powers were unleashed after being tortured by the Inquisition.

The Republic of Nedel—the country of water transportation, surrounded by canals big and small.

It is a country that developed through trade, having connections to western nations beyond the sea. Instead of a monarchy, this country is governed by a parliament of merchants. The upper elite swims in luxury, with their conspicuous buildings exuding extravagance.

However, the gap between the rich and poor is severe. The weak are tyrannized by the merchants, and their greed gave rise to “The Witch of Conflagration.” Her “Curse of Flames” burns with rage, reducing the merchants’ dazzling kingdom to ashes.

The Kingdom of Byrune—the scientific nation built within a deep forest.

It is a country researching ways to accelerate the growth of vegetation and improve crops.
However, this is all a facade. Unbeknownst to the world, they have been conducting forbidden research on life, leading to the creation of many synthesized creatures and artificial lifeforms.

Then, they reach a milestone when a man-made witch is finally born. She was created as the ultimate weapon that can destroy an entire nation by herself, but loses control and succumbs to madness. “The Witch of Rust” unleashed her “Curse of Rust,” causing this country to fall into ruin.

The Holy See of Hainz—the country ruled by the Pope of the Church of Longinus.

Long lines of pilgrims fill the roads leading to the sacred capital city—the center of the Pope’s power—where the blue banners of the Church are hung as far as the eye can see. It is not only believers who visit, but also droves of tourists who wish to see the Church’s beautiful architecture. However, very few know what lies beyond the capital.

When a single nun was taken into a conversion facility meant for the “reeducation” of heretics, “The Witch of Sacred Swords” unleashed her “Curse of Swords,” condemning this country to its doom.

The Kingdom of Vyde—the country confined in snow for more than half a year.

Since ancient times, the royal family has been at war with pirates from the open seas, fighting without any end in sight.

One young queen unifies the country, briefly bringing about peace before countless hordes of cursed creatures overrun the kingdom. Immediately afterwards, massive objects rained unceasingly down from the sky, causing the snowy land to vanish along with the creatures.

All that remains in this scarred land is endless snow, and “The Witch of Fallen Crystals” who awaits the queen’s return.

The Lupus Confederacy—the country where half of the land is covered in mountains, with beautiful plateaus stretching out beneath them.

The people of Lupus love nature in all its majesty, with many tribes living in harmony with it near the mountaintops. Because the people regard their great mountains as sacred, Lupus is the only country with little to no influence from the Church of Longinus.

This country and all its abundant nature have been consumed by the “Curse of Lightning” brought forth by “The Witch of Wailing Lightning.” Some fear it to be the wrath of the mountain god, while others weep as if it were the saddening cries of a young child.

The Kingdom of Chekkos—that was what this academic and artistic country was once called.

100 years ago, heavy rain began to fall without end, gradually submerging the country underwater. Many cities vanished, becoming one with the ocean floor. Then, at the very moment the Curses appeared throughout the world, the rain became more turbulent, creating violent floods that engulfed every city that remained.

Rusalka—“The Witch of Torrential Sorrow”—sleeps inside a temple at the bottom of the waves, where even her name has been forgotten with time. Her 100 years of despair have drowned this country in endless sadness.

The Kingdom of Galia—the country of military might and railroads.

Possessing the most magic crystal ore in the content, railroads were developed to transport them. This accordingly led to the development of their military technology. Civil wars for control over the country lasted for many years, but Galia was finally unified after its last war came to an end.

However, in the shadows of this country’s glorious history, there were soldiers who were buried in darkness. To rescue their souls, “The Witch of Lost Souls” raises her flag in rebellion. Her “Curse of Specters” has made apparitions appear throughout the country, and they all bear striking resemblances to soldiers who have perished in this land’s wars.

The Adrian Empire—the country located on the northernmost point of the continent.

Its 2000 years of culture remain pristine, leaving behind beautiful temples that people now call home.

This country, which once bustled with many tourists, pilgrims, and historical researchers, was purified by a beautiful tree of light brought forth by Elfriede—“The Witch of Longinus.” The light cleanses every kind of impurity, and not even humans can survive once bathed in it.

On the northern part of the continent lies a massive crater—a remnant of the time when the world was on the verge of destruction. What lies beyond this crater that pierces into the very depths of the world? There is not a soul who knows...

■By purchasing this subscription, you will receive all of the benefits labeled in [Privilege Details].
■Please be warned that this purchase will not increase your VIP EXP. It also does not count towards any charge-related event missions.
■The subscription period is either 1 week or 1 month.
■About Payment
Payment will be conducted in the same way as other products from Premier Gifts.
■Subscription Renewals
When there are less than 24 hours before the subscription expires, you will be automatically charged for renewal. Once payment is complete, the subscription period will be extended for
1 more week or month respectively.
■Subscription Cancellations
Should you want to cancel your subscription, you can do so by checking the status of
the subscription through your platform’s Store and canceling from there.

■当定期購入商品を購入すると「特権内容」に記載された恩恵を受けることができます。
■この支払いはVIP経験値が増加しません。また、ゲーム内のチャージに関するイベントの達成度も上昇しません。ご注意ください。
■購入周期は1か月間です
■支払いについて
他のショップ商品と同様に支払いを行います。
■定期購入
有効期間が残り24時間以内になった時に自動的に支払いが行われます。支払いが完了すると、購入周期が1周期分延長されます。
■定期購入キャンセル
定期購入をキャンセルしたい場合、ストアで現在の購入状態を確認し、定期購入をキャンセルすることができます。
■定期購入の名称表示について
お客様がご利用のプラットフォームによっては定期購入は以下のような名称で表示される場合があります。
「サブスクリプション」
For a limited time, receive a variety of benefits (valid for the same account across all servers).
Team Quests at the Fountain of Prayers +1
Clear limited-time missions and accumulate Platinum Points to get rewards!

Unlocking this will allow you to obtain the corresponding Premium Rewards when reaching the required Premium Point totals. Aside from these additional rewards, you will also receive “unlocked rewards.”

At the start of the battle, inflicts [Sleep] on all enemies for 4 turns. [Sleep] is dispelled when a target’s remaining HP percentage becomes 85% or lower.
If an ally attacks, and their target’s remaining HP percentage is 10% or lower, that target is immediately defeated. This attack ignores [Shield] if the target is enhanced with it.
At the start of the battle, increases the damage 1 random enemy receives by 100% for 10 turns. If the target is defeated, inflicts the same effect on 1 random enemy that is alive.
At the start of the battle, deals 1 direct attack equal to 10% of a target’s current HP to all enemies.

​■Player Name​
Your Player Name can be changed.​
It can contain up to 10 characters.​

■Player Icon​
Your icon can be changed.​
You receive an icon for each character you obtain.​

■Rank​
Collect Player EXP to raise your Rank.​
Raising your Rank will boost your characters' stats,
with certain Ranks unlocking Level Link slots.​
When you reach the max Rank,
the Player EXP you obtain will instead be given to you as Gold.

■BP​
This is the total Battle Power of the characters in your Auto-Battle party.​

■Guild​
You can check the guild you belong to here.​

■Player Birthday​
You can set your birthday, but it cannot be changed afterwards.​

■VIP​
You can check your current VIP Lv here.​
VIP EXP can be obtained by buying Diamonds, etc.​

■Comment​
This will be shown in Rankings, etc.​
It can contain up to 60 characters.​
*Please do not enter personal/offensive info.​

■Player ID​
You can check your Player ID here.​
Player IDs are used when doing friend searches.

■Expiration
Some presents have expiration dates.​
Presents that expire will be deleted automatically.​

■Claiming Presents​
Tap a message, then tap [Claim] to obtain the presents found inside.​
Tapping [Claim All] will allow you to obtain presents in your Presents Box in bulk.​
Up to 400 presents can be claimed at once whenever you tap [Claim All].​

■Message Deletion​
7 days after you claim a present, it will be deleted automatically.​
Tap [Delete Old] to manually delete all claimed presents.

■BP​
Rankings are determined by the highest total BP values​
among the party formations each player has ever used.​

■Player Rank​
Rankings are determined by Player Rank,
and how fast each player achieved that Player Rank.​

■Main Quest​
Rankings are determined by the number of cleared quests,
and how fast each player cleared those quests.​

■Tower of Infinity​
Rankings are determined by the number of cleared Floors in the Tower of Infinity,​
and how fast each player cleared those Floors.

■Guild Lv​
Rankings are determined by Guild Lv, and how fast each guild attained that Guild Lv.​

■Total Guild BP​
Rankings are determined by the total value of each guild member's past highest BP.​

■Guild Stock​
Rankings are determined by the amount of Guild Stock obtained within the day.​

■VIP Benefits​
You can check the benefits of each VIP Lv here.​

■Daily Rewards​
You can obtain rewards every day based on your current VIP Lv.​

■Benefit Products​
Each VIP Lv will provide products that you can buy.​
Purchases are limited to 1 per VIP Lv.

■Daily Missions​
Clear to obtain rewards and Contribution Medals.​​
Obtaining certain amounts of these will unlock treasure chests, which you can tap to obtain items.​​
Daily Missions reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​​
​
■Weekly Missions​​
Clear to obtain rewards and Contribution Medals.​​
Obtaining certain amounts of these will unlock treasure chests, which you can tap to obtain items.​​
Weekly Missions reset every Monday at 4:00 (Server Time).​​
​
■Main Missions​​
You can challenge a variety of missions according to your progress.​​
Main Missions do not reset.

■Login Bonus​
You can obtain rewards on the dates you log in.​
There will be new monthly bonuses on the 1st of each month at 4:00 (Server Time).​

■Total Login Bonus​
Based on your total logins, the treasure chests on the lower-left will unlock.​
Tap them to obtain rewards.​
They will reset on the 1st of each month at 4:00 (Server Time).​

■Claiming Past Rewards​
You can claim login bonuses that you missed out on each month.​
The number you can claim increases based on your VIP Lv.

■Favorites​
Up to 5 characters you have obtained can be set as favorites.​​
They will show up on your Home Screen,​​
with the displayed character's Lament being played as background music.​

■Platinum Bonus​
Platinum Bonus is available for a limited time.​​
You can obtain rewards based on the Platinum Points earned during the time period.​​
Obtain Platinum Points from Daily and Weekly Mission rewards.
​
■Rewards​​
Tap [Claim] to obtain rewards.
Buying [Unlock Premium] will make Premium Rewards available.​​
You can also instantly unlock [Unlocked Rewards] at the time of purchase.​
*Unlock Premium expires after its time period has ended.

■Monthly Boost​
Buying the Monthly Boost will unlock a variety of benefits.​
It lasts for 30 days, including the day of purchase.

■Rewards​
Upon purchasing, you can instantly obtain rewards.
Exclusive rewards will be available once a day at 0:00 (Server Time).
The previous day's unclaimed rewards will be sent to your Presents Box.​

■Witch's Gift​
The Witch's Gift is active for a limited time.​
While it is active, obtaining and awakening the specified character will unlock new rewards.​
The rewards you can obtain are based on the highest rarity you have ever attained for that character.

■Rewards​
You can receive buffs that only last while the Witch's Gift is active.​
With each set of rewards you unlock, special products will become available to buy.​
Each special product has a purchase limit.​

■Right of Covenant​
Buying the Right of Covenant will unlock a variety of benefits during the subscription term.​
These benefits will be valid on every World used by the same account.​
Payments will neither provide VIP EXP, nor complete in-game charge-related events,
so please be careful.

■Subscription Period​
The Right of Covenant comes in 2 types—[1 Week] and [1 Month].​
They last for 7 and 30 days respectively, including the day of purchase.
You cannot buy both at the same time.

The date will change every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​
When there are less than 24 hours left on your subscription term,
the Right of Covenant will be automatically bought and extended for the same period.​

For only the first purchase, benefits will be unlocked free of charge for 3 days in either period.​
If you decide to end the Right of Covenant after the free period,​
you must cancel at least 24 hours before the free period expires.​

Even after canceling, you can still receive the Right of Covenant's benefits​
until your subscription period expires.​

■How to Cancel​
The Right of Covenant can be canceled from the subscription menu on your store's account settings.​
Uninstalling the app does not automatically cancel your subscription.​

■Android​
Open [Google Play], tap your account icon,​
then tap [Payments & subscriptions] before tapping [Subscriptions].​
Tap [MementoMori], then on the [Manage Subscription] screen, tap [Cancel subscription].​

■iOS​
Open [App Store], tap your account icon, then tap [Subscriptions].​
Tap [MementoMori], then tap [Cancel Subscription].​

*If the information above does not display because of your OS version, ​
please inquire with your platform's store.​

■Other Warnings​
Only one Game Data ID can buy the Right of Covenant with the same Platform ID.​
If you buy the Right of Covenant with a different Platform ID,​
please cancel your previous subscription, then purchase again.​
The subscription will not be canceled automatically.

Usage fees will be billed towards your Platform ID.​
If you have any questions related to fees or the numbers of days of use, ​
please inquire with your respective platform.​

Even if you have purchased the Right of Covenant with
a single Game Data ID using multiple Platform IDs,​
we do not allow cancellations or refunds for duplicate purchases.​
Additionally, we do not allow cancellations, refunds, or extensions of the subscription period​
unless it is stipulated by the law.​

■盟約特権
盟約特権を購入することで、有効期間中に様々な特権が解放されます。
この特権は同一アカウントの全ワールドで有効となります。
この支払いではVIP経験値は増加せず、
ゲーム内のチャージに関するイベントも達成できませんので、ご注意ください。

■有効期間
盟約特権の有効期間は購入日を含めて30日間となります。

日付変更タイミングは毎日4:00（サーバー時間）となります。
有効期間が24時間未満になると自動的に同じ期間の盟約特権を購入し、期間が延長されます。

解約した場合であっても、盟約特権の有効期間中は特権の効果を受けることができます。

■解約方法
購入した盟約特権は、各ストアのアカウント設定のサブスクリプション項目から解約可能です。
アプリのアンインストールをしても自動で解約はされません。

■DMM
「https://games.dmm.com」へアクセス
⇒月額サービスを利用中のアカウントでログイン
⇒ヘッダー右端のアイコン「DMMアカウント情報」をクリック
⇒左ナビ「サービス利用情報」をクリック
⇒「DMM GAMES」- 解約手続き欄の「解約する」をクリック

※上記が表示されない場合はプラットフォームにお問い合わせ願います

■その他注意事項
同じプラットフォームIDで契約できる盟約特権は、ひとつのゲームデータIDだけです。
異なるプラットフォームIDで盟約特権を購入する場合、以前の契約を解約してから新たに購入してください。
自動で解約はされません。

利用料金については、ご利用のプラットフォームIDに対して請求されます。
料金や利用日数に関してご不明点がある場合は、各プラットフォームへお問い合わせください。

複数のプラットフォームIDで、それぞれ同一のゲームデータIDに盟約特権を購入していた場合でも、
重複購入に対するキャンセルや返金などには一切応じておりません。
その他、法令で定めがある場合を除き、キャンセルや返金、有効期間の延長については一切応じておりません。

■Regular Shop​
