All products displayed are chosen at random.​​
The higher your VIP Lv, the more products will become available.​​
Products refresh automatically every day at the times below.​​
​
・9:00 (Server Time)​​
・12:00 (Server Time)​​
・15:00 (Server Time)​​
・18:00 (Server Time)​​
​
You can also spend Diamonds to manually refresh the products.​

■Fragments Shop
You can exchange Fragments for gear here.
All products displayed are chosen at random.
Products refresh automatically every day at the time below.

・4:00 (Server Time)

You can also spend Diamonds or buy all the products to manually refresh them.

■Friends​
You can add up to 40 friends.​
If you tap another player's icon, you will see the options to add or block them.​

You can send friend points to a max of 40 friends every day,​
and doing so will not decrease the friend points you have.​
Additionally, you can claim friend points from a max of 20 friends every day.​

If you block another player, their messages in Chat will not be displayed.​
You can block up to 100 players, but you cannot block friends.

■Awakening Characters​
You can awaken a character and raise their rarity by using the same character,​​
or a character with the same Soul who has a specified rarity, as materials.​​
​
The characters used for awakening will be lost,​​
but the items used to level them up and the gear they were equipping will all be returned.​

■Level Link​
Setting characters in the Level Link will level them up without using items.​
The 5 highest Lv characters in your roster will automatically be selected as base characters.​
You cannot select the base characters yourself.​

■Character Slots​​
Characters set in character slots will level up to the same Lv as the lowest Lv base character.​
However, a character will not level up more than the max Lv linked to their rarity.​​
Additionally, characters set in character slots cannot level up.​​
If you wish to level a character up, you must remove them from their character slot.​​
​
When you remove a character, their character slot will enter a 24 hour cooldown.​​
No character can be set in that character slot until the cooldown ends.​​
When the cooldown ends, a character can be set in the character slot once again.​​
If awakening or dismissal removes a character from their character slot, there will be no cooldown.​​
Character slots can be unlocked by spending Diamonds or raising your Player Rank.​

■Level Link​
Setting characters in the Level Link will level them up without using items.​
The 5 highest Lv characters in your roster will automatically be selected as base characters.​
You cannot select the base characters yourself.​

■Character Slots​​
Characters set in character slots will level up to the same Lv as the lowest Lv base character.​
However, a character will not level up more than the max Lv linked to their rarity.​​
Additionally, characters set in character slots cannot level up.​​
If you wish to level a character up, you must remove them from their character slot.​​
​
When you remove a character, their character slot will enter a 24 hour cooldown.​​
No character can be set in that character slot until the cooldown ends.​​
When the cooldown ends, a character can be set in the character slot once again.​​
If awakening or dismissal removes a character from their character slot, there will be no cooldown.​​
Character slots can be unlocked by spending Diamonds or raising your Player Rank.​

■Party Lv Mode​
When the 5 base characters reach Lv 240, Party Lv Mode will be unlocked.​​
Each character will no longer be able to level up,​
and raising the Party Lv will level up the characters in character slots to the same as the Party Lv.​
However, a character will not level up more than the max Lv linked to their rarity.​

■Max Level​
The max Party Lv will increase depending on the number of LR characters in your roster.​
The starting max Party Lv is 240, but will raise by 5 for each LR character in your roster.​
Having duplicates of the same LR character will not increase the max Party Lv.

■Lock Gear
In the Battle League and Legend League, the state of a character's gear can be locked.
Only the gear a character has equipped will be locked, 
while that character's Lv, rarity, etc., will remain in its current state.

Only 1 copy of the same character can have their gear locked.
If you try to lock the gear of more than 1 copy of the same character,
the gear of the one with the highest BP will be locked.

The state of locked gear can be updated at any time.
As long as a piece of gear is locked, even if you try to reforge or dismantle it,
it's stats will remain the same as when you locked it. 
If you want to unlock gear that is currently locked, thus returning it into its current state,
you can do so from the Lock Gear screen.

■What Will Be Locked?
The following aspects of a character's gear will be locked.
・What gear that character has equipped
・The gear's Lv
・The gear's rarity
・The gear's Upgrade Lv
・The gear's Dark Lv
・The gear's Holy Lv
・The gear's Bonus Effects
・The runes that are mounted on the gear

■Arcana​
Obtaining every character linked to an arcana will unlock it.​​
Unlocking arcana will raise stats and grant a variety of effects.​​
​
By awakening characters in an arcana group to the specified rarities,
that arcana will be able to level up.​​
Leveling up an arcana will boost its effects and grant you rewards.

Characters you obtain by means that exclude chance,
for example, from Witch's Invitations, Premier Gifts, in presents, etc.,
will also count towards unlocking arcana.

■Return Shards​
If you have a character with a rarity of LR+5 or higher,
and an SR or SR+ version of the same character,​
you can return the lower rarity version to shards.​
You can obtain 60 shards of the same character if they are SR, and 120 if they are SR+.​
Items used to level that character up and the gear they were equipping will all be returned.​

Characters awakened to SSR or higher can return to SR+ via rarity reset.

■Release​
N characters can be exchanged for Character Coins and Kindling Orbs.​
Items used to level those characters up and the gear they were equipping will all be returned.​

■Auto-Release​
By checking the box to [Automatically release N characters],​
N characters will be automatically released when you obtain them via Invoke.

■Rarity​
The character rarities available are N, R, R+, SR, SR+, SSR, SSR+, UR, UR+, and LR.​
Raising a character's rarity by awakening them will also raise their max Lv and boost their stats.​

■Character Lv​
Leveling up a character will raise their Character Lv and boost their stats.​
Reaching certain Character Lvs will either result in learning new skills
or boosting effects of existing ones.​
Additionally, raising Character Lv will allow a character to equip gear with higher Gear Lv.​
The max Gear Lv of equippable gear will be the same as the current Character Lv.​

Rarity determines the max Character Lv, and limits how much a character can level up.​

■Types​
Characters are classified into 3 types—Warriors, Snipers, and Sorcerers.​

Warriors can equip swords, with their basic attacks and skills comprising of physical attacks.​
The unique type stat that infuences their ATK is STR.​

Snipers can equip pistols, with their basic attacks and skills comprising of physical attacks.​
The unique type stat that infuences their ATK is DEX.​

Sorcerers can equip tomes, with their basic attacks and skills comprising of magical attacks.​
The unique type stat that infuences their ATK is MAG.​

■Souls​
Characters will have 1 of 6 Souls—Azure, Crimson, Emerald, Amber, Radiance, and Chaos.​
Souls are strong or weak against each other, as shown in the pattern below.​

Azure > Crimson > Emerald > Amber > Azure​

Radiance and Chaos are both strong and weak against each other.​

■Active Skills​
An Active Skill is a skill that activates during a character's action phase.​
Active Skills automatically activate starting from the one that is first available to use.​
After an Active Skill is used, it will enter its skill cooldown time.​
The skill cooldown time will decrease by 1 after each turn,​
and when it reaches 0, the skill will be able to reactivate.​
If all of a character's Active Skills have entered their skill cooldown times,​
that character will perform basic attacks instead.​

■Passive Skills​
A Passive Skill is a skill that automatically activates at a specific time.​
Each Passive Skill has a different activation time, such as the start of a turn,​
when a character is attacked, when a character is defeated, etc.​
If the timing of a Passive Skill's activation is not written in its description,​
that means it activates at the start of the battle.
A Passive Skill will not activate via an effect of a different Passive Skill.​
If a character's Passive Skill meets its activation requirement at the same time​
as that of another character, the activation order of those Passive Skills​
will be determined by the order of the characters' action phases.​
Passive Skills that activate when a character deals an attack, or is dealt an attack,​
do not activate when the attack is evaded.

■Target Selection​
Each skill selects its target(s) in 1 of 4 ways:​
"Random," "Condition," "Directly in Front," and "Adjacent."​

Random: Targets are selected at random.​
Placement in the party formation also affects the selection,​
as there is a higher probability a character will target the enemy directly in front of them,​
and a lower probability to target an enemy that is further away from that position.​

Condition: Targets are selected based on the hierarchy of a specific stat,​
such as the descending/ascending order of characters' ATK.​
If there are multiple characters that meet the same condition,​
the target will be selected based on their position in the party formation,​
prioritizing the character placed in the higher slot.​

Directly in Front: The target selected is the enemy located in the same party formation​
slot as the character using the skill.​
If the enemy located directly in front of a character has already been defeated,​
the target will be selected from the remaining enemies at random.​

Adjacent: The target will be selected from 1 specific character​
and the characters located on either side of them in a party formation.​
If there are no characters located on either side of the specific character,​
1 character in the party will be forcibly selected at random as a target.​

■Selection Priority​
If buffs, debuffs, etc., cause target selection conditions to overlap with each other,​
a target will be selected based on the following conditions (in order of priority).​

If a character is afflicted with Confusion​
▼​
If a character is enhanced with Stealth​
▼​
If a character uses a skill that is not dealt to random targets​
▼​
If a character is enhanced with Taunt​
▼​
If a character uses a skill that is dealt to random targets​

Characters who are enhanced with Invisibility, or are defeated, cannot be selected as targets.​

■Physical Attacks​
The damage from these attacks is calculated based on a target's P. DEF stat.​
If a critical hit is dealt, damage is calculated based on a target's P. CRIT DMG Cut stat.​

■Magical Attacks​
The damage from these attacks is calculated based on a target's M. DEF stat.​
If a critical hit is dealt, damage is calculated based on a target's M. CRIT DMG Cut stat.​

■Direct Attacks​
These attacks deal damage directly to a target, ignoring their DEF, P. DEF, and M. DEF stats.

■Buffs/Debuffs​
Buffs put characters at an advantage during battle.​
Debuffs put characters at a disadvantage during battle.​
The decision to inflict a debuff is made based on a character's chance to inflict a debuff​
and the target's chance to resist a debuff.
There are specific skills that dispel buffs/debuffs, or copy them onto targets.​

■A Buff/Debuff's Effect Turn Count​
If a buff or debuff specifies the number of turns its effect will last,​
the effect will last only within that specified number of turns.​
Once a character's action phase is over, an effect's turn count will decrease by 1.​
Once the effect's turn count reaches 0, that buff/debuff will be dispelled.​
Additionally, certain skills can be used to increase/decrease the turn count of a buff/debuff.​

■Effect Overlapping​
With the exception of buffs/debuffs, there are effects that can overlap with each other.​

The following is an example of when effects can overlap.​
If a target is already enhanced with an effect that increases their ATK,​
and an ally grants that target a different effect that increases their ATK,​
both ATK-increasing effects can overlap. ​

The following is an example of when effects cannot overlap.​
If Fainted, Poison, Bleed, Burn, and Erosion are each inflicted more than once,​
the effect of each debuff will be overwritten.​
When an effect is overwritten, only one of that effect will remain on the target.​
It will carry over the largest values for the effect turn count and effect size.​

Excluding effects that can be stacked, if the same buff/debuff becomes overlapped​
on the same character, the new buff/debuff will overwrite the old one.​

■Effect Stacking​
Some buffs/debuffs can be stacked if they have an effect that increases in size​
each time that buff/debuff is given to a target.​
The number of times the buff/debuff is given to a target is added to the stack count,​
and there is a limit to how many times the effect can be stacked.​
If a stacked buff/debuff is dispelled, its stack count will become 0.​

■Dispelling​
A target's buff or debuff can be dispelled.​
The decision to dispel a target's buff will be made based on​
a character's chance to inflict a debuff and the target's chance to resist a debuff.

■Buff Copying​
This allows a character to grant themselves a buff that an enemy is enhanced with.​
The copied buff's effect value will not be changed or updated from the time it was copied.​
If a buff's description says "cannot be dispelled," it cannot be copied.​

■Debuff Copying​
This allows a character to inflict a debuff they are afflicted with on an enemy.​
The decision to afflict a copied debuff will be decided based on​
a character's chance to inflict a debuff and the target's chance to resist a debuff.​
Resonance, as well as debuffs that say "cannot be dispelled" in their descriptions,​
cannot be copied.​

■Buffs/Debuffs that Cannot be Dispelled​
Buffs/debuffs that "cannot be dispelled," as written in their descriptions,​
have the following traits.​
They do not count as buffs/debuffs that are "enhancing" or "afflicting" a target.​
Their effects cannot be subject to dispelling, effect turn increasing/decreasing, or copying.​
They are not affected by a character's chance to inflict a debuff,
a target's chance to resist a debuff, Buff Immunity, or Debuff Immunity.​
With the exception of some effects, these buffs/debuffs will not be displayed​
as icons during battle.​

■Increased Stat​
This buff increases a specified stat.​
The increase is calculated in reference to the stat's value at the start of the battle.​

■Increased Damage Dealing​
This buff increases the damage a character deals when they attack.​

■Decreased Damage Taken​
This buff decreases the damage a character takes when they are attacked.​

■Invulnerable​
This buff nullifies damage a character takes.​

■Multi-Barrier​
This buff provides a multi-layered barrier. When a character takes damage,​
1 barrier layer is depleted to nullify that damage.​
If Multi-Barrier is overlapped with Invulnerable, the barrier layer will not be depleted.​
If Multi-Barrier is overlapped with Shield, Multi-Barrier will be used first.​

■Shield​
This buff provides a shield that nullifies a designated amount of damage.​
When a character takes damage that exceeds the amount that can be nullified,​
the shield will be depleted, and the remaining damage will be dealt to the character's HP.​
If Shield is overlapped with Invulnerable, Shield will not be depleted.​
If Shield is overlapped with Multi-Barrier, Multi-Barrier will be used first.​

■Debuff Immunity​
This buff prevents debuffs from being inflicted on a character.​
This does not nullify any debuffs a character is already afflicted with.​

■Unhindered​
This buff prevents action hindering debuffs from being inflicted on a character.​
There are 4 action hindering debuffs—Fainted, Sleep, Confusion, and Silence.​
This does not nullify any action hindering debuffs a character is already afflicted with.​

■Taunt​
This buff guarantees a character is the target of enemy attacks dealt to 1 or more random targets.​
This does not make that character the target if the enemy attack is not dealt to random targets.​

■Stealth​
This buff prevents a character from being a target of enemy attacks dealt to 1 target.​
However, that character can be the target of attacks​
that are dealt to the target directly in front of the attacker.​

■Invisibility​
This buff prevents a character from being a target of skills of enemies and allies.​
This dispels when the number of allies who are alive becomes 1 or less.​

■Counter-XX​
This buff gives a character a chance to counter an enemy attack​
by inflicting a specified debuff on their attacker.​

■Regeneration​
This buff restores a specified amount of HP to a character each turn​
at the start of that character's action phase.​

■Immortality​
This buff guarantees a character survives with 1 HP remaining​
if they take damage that would reduce their HP to 0.​
This includes damage taken from attacks, Poison and other debuffs​
that deal continuous damage, Resonance, and Counter.​

■Decreased Stat​
This debuff decreases a specified stat.​
The decrease is calculated in reference to the stat's value at the start of the battle.​

■Decreased Damage Dealing​
This debuff decreases the damage a character deals when they attack.​

■Increased Damage Taken​
This debuff increases the damage a character takes when they are attacked.​

■Fainted​
This debuff makes a character unable to deal basic attacks or use skills​
for a specified number of turns.​

■Sleep​
This debuff makes a character unable to deal basic attacks or use skills​
for a specified number of turns.​
This is dispelled after the specified number of turns, or by other specific conditions.​

■Confusion​
This debuff makes a character select either allies or enemies at random as attack targets.​
Even skills that specify its targets to be the enemy with the highest ATK, etc.,​
will be dealt to enemies or allies at random.​
Skills that make allies targets, as well as skills that affect allies and enemies at the same time,​
are not affected by Confusion.​

■Silence​
This debuff makes a character unable to use skills.​
The afflicted character can only deal basic attacks.​

■Poison/Burn/Bleed/Erosion​
These debuffs make a character take a specified amount of continuous damage​
each turn at the start of the action phase.​

Poison and Burn make the afflicted character take continuous damage​
based on percentage of their current HP.​
The damage will not exceed the afflicted character's ATK stat value.​

Bleed makes the afflicted character take continuous damage​
based on a percentage of the inflictor's ATK.​

Erosion makes the afflicted character take continuous damage​
based on a percentage of the total damage dealt by the skill that inflicted Erosion.​

■Blight​
This debuff prevents a character from having their HP restored.​
This affects skills that restore HP, Regeneration, and HP Drain.​

■Buff Immunity​
This debuff prevents buffs from being granted to a character.​
This does not nullify any buffs a character is already enhanced with.​
While a character is afflicted with Buff Immunity, if a buff updates the value of a stat, etc.,​
when specific conditions are met, those increases will not be applied.​
Buff Immunity does not affect buffs that cannot be dispelled.​

■Bind​
This debuff makes a character unable to evade enemy attacks.​

■Resonance​
This debuff is inflicted on two characters that meet specific conditions.​
When one afflicted character takes damage from an attack,​
a designated amount of that damage is dealt to the other afflicted character.​

■If/When a Character is Attacked​
This condition causes certain skills to activate upon being fulfilled.
It will only be fulfilled if the character is successfully hit by an attack.
It will not fulfilled if the attack is evaded, or if damage is dealt to the character via Counter.
If the character is hit by an attack, but buffs such as [Shield] or [Multi-Barrier]
reduce the damage to 0, this condition will still be fulfilled.

■HP Restoration​
This effect restores a character's HP by a designated amount.​

■Defeated​
When a character's HP drops to 0, they are defeated.​
Defeated characters cannot perform any actions.​
When a character is defeated, all their buffs/debuffs are dispelled.​
Additionally, the value of a character's skill cooldown time at the moment right before​
they were defeated will remain unchanged. ​

■Increased/Decreased Skill Cooldown Time​
This effect increases or decreases the number of turns of a target's skill cooldown time.​

■Revive​
When a character takes damage that makes them defeated,​
this effect restores that character's HP and makes them able to battle again.​
Characters who have taken damage from attacks, Poison and other debuffs​
that deal continuous damage, Resonance, and Counter can be revived.​

■Guaranteed to Hit​
These attacks are guaranteed to hit their target.​
This effect is not affected by a character's Chance to Hit and Chance to Evade.​

■Guaranteed to Deal a Critical Hit​
These attacks, when they successfully hit their target,​
are guaranteed to deal a critical hit.​
This effect is not affected by a character's Chance to Deal a Critical Hit and
Chance to Resist a Critical Hit.

■Cut​
This effect reduces a specific percentage of damage taken by attacks, Resonance, and Counter.​
Damage from Poison and other debuffs that deal continuous damage cannot be reduced.​
The effects of Increased/Decreased Damage Taken and Increased/Decreased Damage Dealing
are calculated before damage is reduced via cutting.
The effects of Shield and Resonance are calculated after damage is reduced via cutting.

■Survive with 1 HP​
This effect guarantees a character survives with 1 HP remaining​
if they take damage that would reduce their HP to 0.​
This includes damage taken from attacks, Poison and other debuffs​
that deal continuous damage, Resonance, and Counter.​
This effect cannot be dispelled or copied.​

■Absorb​
This effect allows a character to inflict a specific decreased stat debuff on an enemy,​
and grant themselves a buff that increases their corresponding stat by the decreased amount.​
If the character fails to inflict the debuff, they will not be granted the buff.​

■Counter Shift​
When attacked by an enemy, this effect allows a character to deal​
a designated amount of damage to a specific enemy instead of dealing a regular Counter.​
The amount of damage is not affected by the Counter stat.​

■Strengthened Basic Attack​
This effect strengthens a character's basic attack.​
The way a character's basic attack is strengthened varies depending on the skill.​

■Dealing Damage to Self​
This effect decreases a character's HP when they use specific skills.​
This is not affected by Increased/Decreased Damage Taken,​
Cut, Invulnerable, Shield, Multi-Barrier, or Immortality.​

■Counter​
When attacked by an enemy, this effect allows a character to deal damage back to that enemy.​
The damage from Counter is affected by​
Cut, Shield, Multi-Barrier, Invulnerable, and Immortality.​
The damage dealt to the enemy depends on the damage taken from them.​
Damage dealt via Counter cannot be evaded.​
Some skills deal a certain number of attacks, but that number is not factored into Counter's damage.​
Counter does not activate when a character takes damage from Poison​
and other debuffs that deal continuous damage, Resonance, or Passive Skills.​
Counter activates only when an attack hits. It does not activate when an attack is evaded.​

■HP Drain​
When attacking an enemy, this effect restores a character's HP​
depending on the amount of damage they deal.​
The amount of HP restored is calculated based on how much damage is dealt​
after the following effects are factored in:​
Cut, Shield, Multi-Barrier, Invulnerable, and Immortality.​
HP Drain does not activate when a character takes damage from Poison​
and other debuffs that deal continuous damage, Resonance, or Passive Skills.​
HP Drain activates only when an attack hits. It does not activate when an attack is evaded.​

■Gear​
Equipping gear onto characters will boost their stats.​
If a piece of gear's Gear Lv is higher than a character's Character Lv,​
then it cannot be equipped by that character.​

■Base Effect and Bonus Effect​
Each piece of gear has a Base Effect and a Bonus Effect.​
A different stat will be boosted by the Base Effect based on the body part the piece of gear is for.​
The higher a piece of gear's rarity is, the more stats the Bonus Effect will boost.​
The Bonus Effect's total value will be allocated randomly to each stat
when the piece of gear is equipped.​

■Augment Effect​
Augmenting a piece of gear to give it a Holy Lv and a Dark Lv will activate its Aug. Effect.​
Different stats will be boosted by the Holy Lv and Dark Lv based on the body part
the piece of gear is for.​
Augmenting can raise the Holy Lv and Dark Lv, which will in turn raise the stat boost.​

■Gear Set Effect​
Effects will activate on gear from sets based on the number of gear equipped​
that have the same Gear Set Effect.​
Gear from sets come in 5 rarities—R, SR, SSR, UR, and LR.​
To equip gear with a rarity of LR, the character must have a rarity of LR+5 or above.
You can obtain them by obtaining parts from Gear Invoke, etc.,
and synthesizing them in your Item Box.​

■Unique Weapon​
Equipping a unique weapon on its designated character will activate​
its Unique Skill Effect and Unique Passive Effect.​
Unique weapons come in 3 rarities—SSR, UR, and LR.​
To equip gear with a rarity of LR, the character must have a rarity of LR+5 or above.
Unique weapons also have Gear Set Effects,​
so equipping them alongside other gear from the same set will activate the Gear Set Effect.​

■Upgrading Gear​
By upgrading, you can raise a piece of gear's Upgrade Lv.​​
Raising the Upgrade Lv will boost the piece of gear's Base Effect.​​
A piece of gear's max Upgrade Lv is the same value as its Gear Lv.​​
If you lose a piece of gear via smelting or augmenting,
items used for upgrading will all be returned.​

■Reforging Gear​
Reforging a piece of gear can reallocate its Bonus Effect stat values at random.​
This will not change the Bonus Effect's boosted stats or total value.​
The equipping character's unique type stat is displayed in green.​
Making the unique type stat higher will exhibit the piece of gear's strength even more.​

■Lock Feature​
When you reach a certain VIP Lv, the lock feature will be unlocked.​
By locking a Bonus Effect stat, its value will not change,​
and only the remaining Bonus Effect stat values will be reallocated.​
When you use the lock feature, Diamonds will be spent to reforge.​

■Augmenting Gear​
By augmenting, you can raise a piece of gear's Holy Lv and Dark Lv.​

Gear with a Holy Lv or a Dark Lv can be consumed to augment a piece of gear.​
Dark Perfume can also be used.​

Gear with mounted runes cannot be selected as materials to be consumed.​

■Enhancing Gear​
Unique weapons and gear with Gear Set Effects can be enhanced.​​
​
Enhancing a piece of gear will raise its Gear Lv, boost its Base Effect/Bonus Effect values,​​
and make the Gear Set Effect even stronger.​​
​
After Gear Lv 240, no more boosts will be applied.​​
Additionally, a piece of gear cannot be enhanced to a Gear Lv exceeding the equipping character's Lv.​

■Awakening Gear​
When a character's rarity becomes LR+5, and they are equipping a unique weapon​
or gear from sets with a UR-rarity that have reached a certain Gear Lv,​
awakening will become available to use.​

Awakening a piece of gear will raise its rarity.​
Raising rarity will boost its Base Effect/Bonus Effect values, make the Gear Set Effect even stronger.​

■Mounting Runes
Mounting runes allows you to select runes and mount them onto a piece of gear's slots.​
By constructing slots, the number of mountable runes can be increased to a max of 4.​
​
[Offensive-type runes] can be mounted on [Weapons, Accessories, and Hands].​
​
▼Offensive-type runes
STR Rune, DEX Rune, MAG Rune,​
ATK Rune, PM. DEF Break Rune, ACC Rune,​
CRIT Rune, Debuff ACC Rune, SPD Rune​
​
[Defensive-type runes] can be mounted on [Head, Body, and Feet].​
​
▼Defensive-type runes
STA Rune, HP Rune, P. DEF Rune,​
M. DEF Rune, EVD Rune, CRIT RES Rune,​
Debuff RES Rune​

■Gear Transfer​
Doing a gear transfer allows you to transfer a piece of gear's upgraded state to another.​
If the inheritor has already been upgraded, the stronger upgrade values​
between the transferor and the inheritor will be applied to the inheritor,​
and the weaker upgrade values will be applied to the transferor. ​

[Example]
Transferor: Upgrade Lv 3, Holy Lv 2, Dark Lv 5​
Inheritor: Upgrade Lv 1, Holy Lv 3, Dark Lv 5​

In the case above, transferring will result in:​

Transferor: Upgrade Lv 1, Holy Lv 2, Dark Lv 5​
Inheritor: Upgraded Lv 3, Holy Lv 3, Dark Lv 5​

A piece of gear that meets any of the requirements below can be selected as the transferor.​
・Upgrade Lv 1 or higher​
・Holy Lv 1 or higher​
・Dark Lv 1 or higher​
・Have 1 or more open rune slot​s

A piece of gear that meets the requirement below can be selected as the inheritor.​
・Possess at least 1 upgrade value that is a smaller number than the transferor's upgrade value.​

■Synthesizing Runes​
Synthesizing runes allows you to raise the Lv of a rune.​​
You can upgrade by consuming the rune you want to level up and
1 other rune of the same type and Lv.​

■STR​
The stat that affects P. DEF and ACC.​​
This is the unique type stat of Warriors, so high STR will give Warriors high ATK.​​
​
■DEX​​
The stat that affects EVD and CRIT.​​
This is the unique type stat of Snipers, so high DEX will give Snipers high ATK.​​
​
■MAG​​
The stat that affects M. DEF and Debuff ACC.​​
This is the unique type stat of Sorcerers, so high MAG will give Sorcerers high ATK.​​
​
■STA​​
The stat that affects HP and CRIT RES.​

■HP​
A character will be defeated if their HP drops to 0 in battle.​

■ATK​
The higher the number, the more damage is dealt.​

■DEF​
The higher the number, the less damage is taken.​

■DEF Break​
Deals damage by offsetting the damage reduction from the enemy's DEF.​

■SPD​
The higher the number, the easier it becomes to perform actions earlier.​

■P. DEF​
The higher the number, the less damage is taken from physical attacks.​
The basic attacks and skills of Warriors and Snipers are all physical attacks.​

■M. DEF​
The higher the number, the less damage is taken from magical attacks.​
The basic attacks and skills of Sorcerers are all magical attacks.​

■PM. DEF Break​
Deals damage by offsetting the damage reduction from the enemy's P. DEF and M. DEF.​

■ACC​
The higher the number, the higher the chance an attack will hit the enemy.​

■EVD​
The higher the number, the higher the chance an enemy attack will be avoided.​

■CRIT​
The higher the number, the higher the chance a critical attack will occur.​

■CRIT RES​
The higher the number, the lower the chance an enemy's critical attack will occur.​

■CRIT DMG Boost​
The higher the number, the more damage is dealt when a critical attack occurs.​

■P. CRIT DMG Cut​
The higher the number, the less damage is taken from the enemy's physical critical attack.​

■M. CRIT DMG Cut​
The higher the number, the less damage is taken from the enemy's magical critical attack.​

■Debuff ACC​
The higher the number, the higher the chance to inflict an enemy with a skill's debuff.

■Debuff RES​
The higher the number, the lower the chance to be inflicted with an enemy's skill's debuff.​

■Counter​
Deals damage to the enemy depending on the damage taken from them.​

■HP Drain​
Restores HP depending on the damage dealt to the enemy.​

■Lv Reset​
Spending Diamonds allows you to reset a character's Lv.​
The specified character's Lv will reset to 1,​
and all items used to level them up, as well gear they were equipping, will be returned.​

■Rarity Reset​
If you have 2 or more of the same character awakened to SSR or higher,​
a rarity reset can be performed on the one with a lower rarity.​

The designated character's rarity will reset to SR+,​
and all the characters used to awaken them, as well as gear they were equipping, will be returned.​
A character used for awakening will be returned as a Witch's Letter of the same Soul.​

If the designated character's Lv is 2 or higher, a Lv Reset will also be performed.​

■Smelting​
By consuming D~A-rarity gear for smelting,​
you will have a chance to obtain gear with a rarity 1 level higher.​

By consuming S gear for smelting, you will have a chance to obtain dark gear.​
If dark gear could not be obtained, then you will obtain Fragments instead.​

If the smelted gear has already been upgraded, items used for upgrading will be returned.​
Gear with runes or Aug. Effects cannot be smelted.​

■Quick Battle​
Doing a Quick Battle allows you to obtain 2 hours worth of Auto-Battle rewards.​
The amount of rewards you can obtain will be based on your statistics at the time.​
Rewards will be sent to your Item Box.​

The number of Quick Battle attempts you can do in a day is limited.​
Having a higher VIP Lv will increase that number of attempts.​
Attempts will be reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​

Diamonds are required to do a Quick Battle, and the more attempts you do,​
the more Diamonds will be required.​
The required amount of Diamonds will be reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​

■Day Event​
Clearing designated main quests will unlock a Day Event.
While the Day Event is underway, Auto-Battle rewards will be increased.​

■Boss Battle
Emerging victorious in boss battles will give you rewards and unlock the next quest.
It will also allow you to Auto-Battle at the quest you just completed.

3 attempts can be made in a day for free, and attempts will reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).
Using Boss Tickets or Diamonds can restore your attempts.
Any amount of restored attempts that exceeds the max number for the day
will be carried over to the next day.

The number of attempts you can buy with Diamonds is limited,​
and the higher your VIP Lv is, the more attempts you will have.​
When you clear an uncleared quest, an attempt will not be used,
and even when you have 0 attempts left, you can still challenge uncleared quests.

■Battle Info​
You can check your Auto-Battle statistics here.​
The displayed numbers are used to determine the amounts of Auto-Battle rewards,​
Quick Battle rewards, and hourly item rewards you can obtain when the app is not in use.

■Population Info​
You can check the number of people you freed when clearing main quests here.​​
The amount of Gold and Kindling Orbs obtained from Auto-Battle rewards​​
depends on the number of people in your population.​​
As you clear certain main quests to free different countries, you can receive bonuses,​​
and you can check them all here.

■Battle League​
In Battle League, players battle each other to compete for rankings.​​
Select a randomly displayed opponent and battle.​​
​
If you wins, the rankings of you and your opponent will be switched.​​
Defeating a player ranked lower than you will not change your ranking.​​
​
You can battle 5 times a day for free, and challenge attempts will be reset
every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​​
Diamonds can be spent to increase your attempts,
but they cannot be carried over into the next day.​​
​
If you win a battle you initiated, you can obtain victory rewards,​​
and if you lose you can obtain battle rewards.​​
Both victory and battle rewards will be sent to your Item Box.​​
​
Additionally, you can obtain rewards based on your rankings as of 20:30 (Server Time) each day,​​
and the amount of rewards will increase as you rank higher.​​
These rewards will be sent to your Presents Box.​
Worlds in your Legend League Group

■Legend League​
The Legend League is where high-ranking Battle League players from multiple Worlds​​
compete against each other for rankings.​​
​
■Commencement Periods/Seasons​
1 season takes place from Tuesday~Sunday.​
​
Ranking Calculation: 20:30 (Server Time)
Daily Battle Duration: 21:00~20:30 the next day (Server Time)​
​
■Participation Requirements​
Battle League results will be calculated daily while a season is underway,​
and players who fulfill the following requirements will be able to participate.​
​
・Having a Player Rank of 50 or higher​
・Being ranked in the top 50 of the Battle League at the time rankings are calculated​
​
Once a player participates in the Legend League,
even if they fall below the top 50 of the Battle League rankings mid-season,
they will still have their Points for the rest of the season,
and continue participating via defending only.​
​
■Challenge Attempts​
During a season, players who have fulfilled the participation requirements​
as of 20:30 (Server Time) each day will be granted 10 free challenge attempts.​
Diamonds can be spent to add up to 5 more challenge attempts.​​
Both free and purchased challenge attempts will be reset at 20:30 the next day (Server Time).​
​
■Points​
Players who have fulfilled the participation requirements mentioned above​
will be initially given 1000 Points,​
and the results of their battles will increase or decrease those Points as follows.​
​
・Win via attacking: +20 Points​
・Lose via attacking: +10 Points​
・Win via defending: No change in Points​
・Lose via defending: -10 Points​
​
If a player wins against an opponent who has 11 Points or more than them,
that player can obtain extra Points according to how large the difference is.

If a player initiates challenges, and goes on to have a win streak of 3 or more,
they can obtain extra Points according to the number of wins on their win streak.
*If the player is challenged and defeated by an opponent,
the win streak will come to an end.​
​
■Rankings​
Legend League rankings are sorted into two tabs: "Season" and "World."​
Each tab can be viewed by tapping their respective button, which are found under Rankings.​
​
・Season​
The players ranked in the top 50 of the current season based on total Points are displayed here.​
​
・World​
The players ranked in the top 50 in the "Season" tab who are from the same World as you,​
as well as their "Season" ranking, are displayed here.​
​
■Rewards​
Players can tap the "Rewards" button to check the rewards they can obtain.​
Rewards are distributed to the Presents Box.​
​
・Daily Rewards​
These rewards are determined based on a player's ranking as of 20:30 each day (Server Time).​
If a player has not fulfilled the participation requirements, they cannot claim these rewards.​
​
・Season Rewards​
These rewards are determined based on a player's ranking​
as of 20:30 on the last day of the season (Server Time).​
​
■Classes​
A player's class is determined based on their ranking and how many Points they have obtained.​
Additionally, the frame of a player's icon will automatically be changed​
depending on their current class.​
The requirements to reach each class are as follows.​
​
Chevalier: 0~1049 Points​
Paladin: 1050~1399 Points​
Grand Cross: 1400 Points or more​
Royal Rank: 1800 Points or more + Rank 30 and below​
Legend Rank: 2000 Points or more + Rank 10 and below​
World Ruler: 2200 Points or more + Rank 1

■Cave of Space-Time​
Consisting of 3 Levels, you can move to and investigate encounters adjacent to the one you are at.​
Whenever you move to a new encounter, it and the other ones in the same row will be destroyed.​
The Cave of Space-Time refreshes once every 48 hours.​
Once refreshed, all enemies, blessings, the map, and your progress will be reset.​

■Assist​
You can select a character to add to your roster.​
That character can only be used inside that Cave of Space-Time, and will disappear once it refreshes.​

■Blessings​
Defeating an enemy will present to you a variety of blessings, each with a different effect.​
You can obtain 1.​
Blessings are special types of items, and their effects only activate inside the Cave of Space-Time.​
They do not grant any effects in battles outside the Cave of Space-Time.​
The blessings you obtained can be viewed in the List of Blessings screen.​

■Fruit of Healing​
Using this will allow you to revive defeated characters and restore everyone's HP.​
Only a max of 20 Fruits of Healing can be used in one Cave of Space-Time iteration.​
When the Cave of Space-Time refreshes, it will also reset the number of Fruits of Healing you can use.

■Cave of Space-Time Event​
While the event is underway, some of the Cave's encounters will turn into event encounters,
and clearing them will allow you to obtain the special event item.
The special event item can be exchanged for rewards at the Shop.
If you reattempt an event encounter, ​
enemies with reduced HP will have 30% of their max HP restored.

■Cave of Space-Time​
Consisting of 3 Levels, you can move to and investigate encounters adjacent to the one you are at.​
Whenever you move to a new encounter, it and the other ones in the same row will be destroyed.​
The Cave of Space-Time refreshes once every 48 hours.​
Once refreshed, all enemies, blessings, the map, and your progress will be reset.​

■Assist​
You can select a character to add to your roster.​
That character can only be used inside that Cave of Space-Time, and will disappear once it refreshes.​

■Blessings​
Defeating an enemy will present to you a variety of blessings, each with a different effect.​
You can obtain 1.​
Blessings are special types of items, and their effects only activate inside the Cave of Space-Time.​
They do not grant any effects in battles outside the Cave of Space-Time.​
The blessings you obtained can be viewed on the List of Blessings screen.​

■Fruit of Healing​
Using this will allow you to revive defeated characters and restore everyone's HP.​
Only a max of 20 Fruits of Healing can be used in one Cave of Space-Time iteration.​
When the Cave of Space-Time refreshes, it will also reset the number of Fruits of Healing you can use.

■Cave of Space-Time Event​
While the event is underway, some of the Cave's encounters will turn into event encounters,
and clearing them will allow you to obtain the special event item.
The special event item can be exchanged for rewards at the Shop.
If you reattempt an event encounter, ​
enemies with reduced HP will have 30% of their max HP restored.​
Even if you select to challenge Level 3 on Hard Mode,​
the rewards from the event encounters will be the same as Normal Mode,​
and their difficulty will not change.

■Hard Mode​
After clearing Level 2, you can choose to challenge Level 3 on Hard Mode.​
The enemies in Hard Mode are more powerful, but yield more rewards.​

■Catch-Up Bonus​
This is a bonus that activates when you miss out on challenging​
an iteration of the Cave of Space-Time.​
The Catch-Up Bonus will grant you a "catch-up," which boosts the rewards​
you can obtain the next time you challenge the Cave of Space-Time.​
The Catch-Up Bonus's rewards boost will take effect the moment​
you transition to the Cave of Space-Time screen.​

■Amount of Boosted Rewards​
Normally, the Catch-Up Bonus boosts your rewards by 80% for each time you use a catch-up.​
Purchasing the Right of Covenant will raise the boost to 100%.​

■Number of Catch-Ups​
The number of catch-ups you can obtain from continuously missing Cave of Space-Time iterations​
will increase by fulfilling the requirements below (3 catch-ups max).​
・Clearing Main Quest 14-28​
・Reaching VIP 5​
・Reaching VIP 12​

■Where to Obtain Boosted Rewards​
Rewards obtained from winning battle encounters and clearing Levels are boosted.​
Blessings are not affected by the Catch-Up Bonus.​
Items that you can buy from the Mystery Shop are also not affected by the Catch-Up Bonus.​

■Fountain of Prayers​
At the Fountain of Prayers, you dispatch characters on quests,​
and can obtain rewards after set amounts of time.

Each quest specifies the requirements for the characters you can dispatch.
The higher rarity of a quest, the higher difficulty its requirements will be,
and the rewards you can obtain will be greater.

■Normal Quests
Only 1 of each of your characters can be dispatched to these quests.
Characters already dispatched to different normal quests cannot be selected.

Quests refresh every day at 4:00 (Server Time),
Any unaccepted quests at that time will be deleted, and new quests will be added.
You can spend Diamonds to refresh the available quests.

■Team Quests​
Your characters and those set as support characters by friends or guild members​
can be dispatched to these quests.​
Only 1 of each character can be dispatched to a quest.​
Characters already dispatched to different team quests cannot be selected.​
Characters already dispatched to normal quests or guerilla quests can be selected.​

New quests will be added every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​
Unaccepted quests will not be deleted.​

■Guerilla Quests​
Only your characters are dispatched to these quests.​
The times these quests appear change sporadically every day,
and a max of 1 quest will appear each day.​
Unlike other quests, there are no dispatch requirements,
and rewards will be greater based on the dispatched characters' rarities
and how unified their Souls are.

■Quick Finish
Spending Diamonds will allow you to instantly finish a quest.
The number of required Diamonds will depend on the time left before the quest is cleared.​

■Temple of Illusions
The Temple of Illusions allows you to team up with a max of 3 players and challenge bosses.
The Temple can be challenged at any time, 24 hours a day,
and you can obtain different rewards depending on the type of quest you clear.
If you create a team and do not start a battle after a certain period of time,
your team will be automatically disbanded.

The higher the difficulty, the more rewards you can obtain,
and you can challenge the Temple up to 6 times in 1 day.
Each quest has extra 1st try rewards exclusive to clearing the quest for the first time.
Additionally, you will earn boosted rewards by challenging the Temple between​
12:30~13:30 and 19:30~20:30 (Server Time).
The higher your Illusion Lv,
which rises in conjunction with the period of time that has passed since the opening of the World,
the stronger the quest bosses will be.

■Temple of Illusions Event​
While an event is underway, all the quests will turn into event quests,
and clearing them will allow you to obtain the special event item.
The special event item can be exchanged for rewards at the Shop.

■Tower of Infinity​
Defeating the enemies on each Floor will give you rewards and unlock the next Floor.​
3 attempts can be made in a day for free, and attempts will reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).​

Using Tickets of Infinity or Diamonds can restore your attempts.
Any amount of restored attempts that exceeds the max number for the day
will be carried over to the next day.

The number of attempts you can buy with Diamonds is limited,​
and the higher your VIP Lv is, the more attempts you will have.​
When you clear an uncleared Floor, an attempt will not be used,​
and even when you have 0 attempts left, you can still challenge uncleared Floors.

■Tower of Souls​
The Towers of Azure, Crimson, Emerald, and Amber can be challenged
depending on the day of the week.
Characters can only enter if they have the Soul that matches the name of the tower.
Defeating the enemies on each Floor will give you rewards and unlock the next Floor.
Up to 10 Floors can be cleared in a day.

■Wish List
In your Wish List, you can set a max of 5 characters from each Soul, for a total of 20 characters.
The pull rates of the SR characters set in your Wish List will become higher.
The actual pull rates of all SR characters will not be changed.

If a total of 20 characters are set in all the slots, when an SR character is pulled,
one of those 20 characters or a character with a Soul of Radiance/Chaos will appear.
SR characters not set in the Wish List will no longer appear.
*In the Prayer of The Fleeting,
the featured character will appear regardless of how the Wish List is set.

Creating openings will not raise the pull rates of the other characters in your Wish List.

■Unlocking a Prayer of Souls​
As an option, you can spend Diamonds to unlock an additional Prayer of Souls.
The unlock period for the additional Prayer of Souls is 24 hours.
Only 1 additional Soul can be selected to unlock.​

■Guild Info
When guild members visit the Guild Info screen,
it allows them to obtain Guild EXP, Guild Stock, and Gold as a login bonus.
Collecting Guild EXP will raise the Guild Lv, and the max Lv a guild can reach is Lv 20.
Raising the Guild Lv will allow more guild members to join.
Additionally, the Guild Lv determines the limit on the amount of Guild EXP
a guild can obtain in a day.

■Guild Stock
Guild Stock is used to unlock Guild Raids, as well as participation qualifications for Guild Battles.
40 can be obtained from Quick Battles, 20 from winning boss battles,
10 from winning in the Battle League, and 40 from logging in to the guild.

A guild can hold no more than 70,000 in Guild Stock.
The obtainable amount, referred to as Guild Battle participation requirements,
will be added even after passing the limit.

■Members
The Master can appoint Chiefs. There is no limit to the number of Chiefs a guild can have.
If the amount of Guild Stock the Master has obtained in the past 3 days is 0,
the Chief with the highest amount of Guild Stock in the past 7 days will be effectively changed to Master.
If there is no Chief, a guild member will be selected as the new Master.

■Leaving
If you leave a guild, you can join a new guild 1 time on the same day.
But if you leave a second time, you cannot join a new guild until the next day at 4:00 (Server Time).

The Master cannot leave the guild.
For the Master to leave, they must appoint a different member as Master beforehand.

If a guild member leaves or is dismissed,
their Guild Stock from the past 7 days will continue to be displayed.

■Guild Battle
Guilds in the previous day's top 16 of the Guild Stock Ranking can participate in Guild Battle.

■Calculating Period
In the following time period, the Guild Stock that guild members have collected will be calculated,
and that will determine the World’s Guild Stock Ranking.
・4:00 of the previous day~3:59 of the current day (Server Time)

■When the Participation Requirement Has Been Fulfilled
When a guild has fulfilled the requirement to participate in Guild Battle,
it will earn the right to [Declare] attacks on bases during Strategy Time on the current day.
Once it becomes War Phase, guilds will be able to [Siege] bases they [Declared] to attack.

*Please refer to Help on the Guild Battle screen for more details on Guild Battle.

■Guild Raid
In Guild Raids, guild members join together to battle a boss,
and can obtain rewards based on the amount of damage dealt.
When the boss takes certain amounts of damage, their HP will increase,
and the rewards will be even greater.

On top of personal rewards, you obtain guild rewards based on
the total damage dealt by all guild members.
Guild rewards will be sent to your Presents Box.
Members who do not participate in a Guild Raid cannot obtain any rewards.

You cannot challenge a Guild Raid until 24 hours have passed after joining a guild.
Additionally, if you leave a guild in the middle of a Guild Raid, you cannot claim any rewards
unless you rejoin the guild by the time rewards are distributed.

■Guild Boss
The bosses who appear in Guild Raids are [Sonya] and [Luke].

[Sonya] can be challenged 2 times a day, and the attempts will reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).
You can obtain 50 Guild EXP only when you challenge her for the first time.
*Reaping also counts as a first challenge.

[Luke] can be unlocked by spending 10,000 Guild Stock,
and can be challenged 2 times whenever she is unlocked.
Only the Master or Chiefs can unlock her.

■Guild Raid Event
While an event is underway, a limited-time raid boss will appear,
and beating them will allow you to obtain the special event item.
The special event item can be exchanged for rewards at the Shop.
Guild Stock is not required to unlock the limited-time raid boss,
as they can be challenged every day of the event by just using challenge attempts.

■World Rewards
These special rewards can be obtained according to the cumulative amount of damage
that every player in your World has dealt to the limited-time raid boss.

■Guild Battle​
In Guild Battles, several guilds fight for bases on the map.
Guilds in the previous day's top 16 of the Guild Stock Ranking can participate in Guild Battle.

■Event Times
Strategy Phase: 7:45~20:30 (Server Time)
War Phase: 20:45~21:30 (Server Time)
For Worlds where the Grand Battle will be commenced,​
the Guild Battle will be put on hiatus from Monday~Sunday on the week of the Grand Battle.​

After the Grand Battle ends, the Guild Battle will recommence, continuing from how
the status of​ the map, base ownership, etc., were before the hiatus started.​

■The Flow of Guild Battle
Guild Battles are composed of 2 phases: Strategy Phase and War Phase.

During Strategy Phase, you [Declare] attacks on red-colored bases.
When doing so, you can also deploy defense parties to your green-colored bases.

Once War Phase begins, you will [Siege] bases you have [Declared] to attack.
When all enemy defense parties are defeated, you can capture their base.

When War Phase ends, if there is at least 1 defense party, they can defend a base.
Regardless if it is Strategy Phase or War Phase, you can deploy a defense party to
defend your guild's bases.

A character who is already deployed cannot be deployed into a different party.
If you are in control of bases, but fall out of the top 16 of the Guild Stock Ranking,
you will no longer be able to siege. However, you will still be able to defend.
Furthermore, you cannot participate in the Guild Battle on the day you join a guild.

■Characters
Characters' stats and their equipped gear will be set at 20:30 (Server Time).​
From that point, any stat changes from leveling up, etc., will not be applied to the Guild Battle.

For both [Siege] and [Defend], each player can deploy only 1 of each character.
If you have duplicates of the same character in your roster,
the one with the highest BP will automatically be selected.

■Bases
There are 3 types of bases—churches, castles, and temples.
Rewards will differ depending on the type of base.
Small bases (churches) yield the fewest rewards, medium bases (castles) yield a moderate amount,
and large bases (temples) yield the most.

■Stamina
Each character has 2 points of stamina,
and using 1 point of stamina allows them to be deployed in a siege party of defense party.
When they run out of stamina, they can no longer be deployed.​
Deployed parties and stamina reset every day at 4:00 (Server Time).

■Declare
If there is a base you want to attack, select [Declare] during Strategy Phase.
Attacks can be declared on up to 2 bases in a day.
Bases that can be declared attack on are marked in red,
and can only be bases that are adjacent to your guild's.
You cannot declare attack on a base that has already been declared attack on by another guild.

Additionally, to declare attacks on castles and temples, the following requirements must be met.
・Temples: Have control of at least 1 castle.
・Castles: Have control of at least 2 churches, or 1 temple.

Guilds that have control of no bases can declare attacks on any church.
Only the Master and Chiefs can declare attacks.

■Siege
If you [Declared] attacks on bases during Strategy Phase, you can [Siege] them during War Phase.
By deploying a siege party to the target base, you can start a war,
and if all enemy defense parties are defeated, you can capture that base.
Furthermore, the lowest number of required characters in 1 party is determined by the type of base.
Additionally, the lowest number of required characters in 1 party will be increased
in conjunction with the period of time that has passed since the opening of the World.

■War
During a war, even if the enemy party is completely destroyed, your party’s HP will not be reset,
and they will continue to fight with the state of their HP carried over.
Furthermore, any temporary buffs and debuffs received during battle will be dispelled
at the end of the war.

During the war, siege parties will be enhanced with [Guild Battle Buffs].
SPD will be increased, and the buffs’ effects will become smaller the more battles are won.
Those buffs will remain until that party is defeated.

The winning party will be inflicted with [Guild Battle Debuffs] based on
the number of enemies defeated.
Stats like ATK and DEF will be decreased,
and the debuffs’ effects will become greater the more battles are won.
Those debuffs will remain until that party is defeated.

■Defense
You can deploy a defense party to your bases to protect them.
These bases are marked in green on the map.
Defense parties can be deployed regardless if it is Strategy Phase or War Phase.
Characters deployed in a defense party cannot be deployed to another base
until their party is defeated.
The deployment of defense parties resets every day at 4:00 (Server Time).
Furthermore, the lowest number of required characters in 1 party is determined by the type of base.
Additionally, the lowest number of required characters in 1 party will be increased
in conjunction with the period of time that has passed since the opening of the World.

■Counter
[Counter] can be selected if it is within 15 minutes after a base is captured.
If [Counter] is selected, the counter will begin 15 minutes after the base was captured.

When countering, defenders and attackers will switch roles,
and the sieging guild will deploy a defense party, while the defending guild deploys a siege party.
The siege party that was deployed when sieging a base will remain deployed there as a defense party.
The defense party that was deployed to the base, but was defeated, can take back the base.
Only the Master and Chiefs can counter.

■Rewards
Rewards can be obtained from the Guild Info screen.
・Qualified Guilds: Guilds who have control of a base as of 4:00 (Server Time)
・Reward Claiming Period: 4:00~3:59 the next day (Server Time)
・Who can Claim Rewards: Guild members who have joined a qualified guild
before the reward claiming period starts.

You can check any base's rewards from their Base Info screen.
Any rewards left unclaimed when the reward claiming period ends will be discarded.​
During the Guild Battle hiatus period, rewards can still be claimed based on the results​
of the Guild Battle that took place on the day before the hiatus period.​
Rewards will depend on the number and types of bases a guild has control of.
Worlds in your Grand Battle Group

■Grand Battle
Grand Battles are special Guild Battles in which 48 guilds chosen from multiple Worlds wage war.

During 1 season, the 48 chosen guilds will be allocated to different maps.
In each map, 4 of the 48 guilds will fight for control over bases.

The basic rules, such as the way battles are carried out, are the same as those in Guild Battles.

■Commencement Periods/Seasons
1 season takes place from Tuesday~Sunday.

Ranking Calculation: Tuesday 4:00 (Server Time)
Opponent Matching Finalized: Tuesday 7:30 (Server Time)

Strategy Phase: 7:45~20:30 (Server Time)

War Phase: 20:45~21:30 (Server Time)

Characters' stats and their equipped gear will be set at 20:30 (Server Time).
From that point, any stat changes from leveling up, etc., will not be applied to the Grand Battle.

■Participation Requirements
The guilds in the top 48 of the Total Guild BP rankings
at the time rankings are calculated can participate.
Rankings are calculated for all Worlds that are part of a Grand Battle group.

The guilds and guild members that can participate will be set at the time rankings are calculated.
Guild members who either join or temporarily leave a guild mid-season cannot participate.

■Classes and Blocks​
The 48 participating guilds will be ordered by Total BP and divided into Classes.
From there, they will be randomly assigned to one of the Blocks prepared for each Class.

・Classes: [Grand Master] [Expert Class] [Elite Class] (3 Classes total)
・Blocks: [Block A] [Block B] [Block C] [Block D] (4 Blocks for each Class)

■Bases
When a season begins, each guild will have control of 4 random churches.
Each guild can declare to attack up to 3 bases in 1 day.
The rules regarding what bases guilds can declare attacks on
are the same as those in Guild Battles.

When a season ends, guilds will lose control of their bases and the map will be reset.

■Points
Points are allocated to each base.
・Temples: 4 Points
・Castles: 2 Points
・Churches: 1 Points

After War Phase ends, each guild will be given Points
depending on the bases they have control of at 23:00 (Server Time).
The rankings in a Block will be determined by each guild's Points at the end of the Season.
*If multiple guilds have the same number of Points, their rankings will be determined by
what their Total Guild BP rankings were at the start of the season.
*After War Phase ends, it may take roughly 15 mins for the final results to be displayed.

■Rewards
▶Rewards from Bases
Guild members who participated in Grand Battles can obtain rewards from the Guild Info screen.
Rewards will depend on the number and types of bases their guild has control of.
・Who can Claim Rewards: Guild members who deployed a party to a Grand Battle base,
regardless of if it was to [Siege] or [Defend]
・Eligible Guilds: Guilds that have control of a base as of 4:00 (Server Time)
・Reward Claiming Period: 4:00 the day after a Grand Battle~3:59 the next day (Server Time)​

You can check any base's rewards from their Base Info screen.
Any rewards left unclaimed when the reward claiming period ends will be discarded.

▶Season Rewards
After a season ends, rewards will be determined based on a guild's ranking in their Class and Block,
and those rewards will be distributed to the Presents Box
of all participating guild members on Monday 3:00 (Server Time).
・Who can Claim Rewards: Guild members who deployed a party to a Grand Battle base
at least 1 time, regardless of if it was to [Seige] or [Defend]
Guild members have 14 days to claim the rewards after they have been distributed.
Any guild member who leaves a guild before rewards are distributed
will not be able to claim them.

[Grand Master]
Rank 1: 4 Amphoras of Creation
Rank 2: 3 Amphoras of Creation
Rank 3: 2 Amphoras of Creation
Rank 4: 1 Amphora of Creation

[Expert Class]
Rank 1: 4 Amphoras of Love
Rank 2: 3 Amphoras of Love
Rank 3: 2 Amphoras of Love
Rank 4: 1 Amphora of Love

[Elite Class]
Rank 1: 4 Amphoras of Spirits
Rank 2: 3 Amphoras of Spirits
Rank 3: 2 Amphoras of Spirits
Rank 4: 1 Amphora of Spirits

■Chat​
You can chat with other players here.​​
Players can communicate by sending messages and stickers to each other.​​
*If we confirm that your speech or conduct is in violation of the Terms of Service Agreement,​​
we may take measures to limit or suspend the Chat feature on your account.​​
​
■Group​
This tab is for chatting with all players from Worlds​
in your Grand Battle or Legend League group at once.​
*After a certain amount of time has passed since the creation of a World,​
the Group tab will be unlocked.​
​
■World​​
This tab is for chatting with all players in your World at once.​​
​
■Guild​​
​This tab is for chatting with all the members of your guild at once.​​
​
■Private​​
This tab is for chatting one-on-one with other players, like friends.​​
​
■Start a Conversation​​
To access this screen, tap the "Select from List" button in the Private tab.​​
From here, you can select another player to chat one-on-one with.​​
The players you can select are sorted into 3 tabs—Friends, Guild, and World.​​
In this screen's Guild tab, your guild members will be displayed.​
However, if you are unaffiliated with a guild, this tab will not be displayed.​​
In this screen's World tab, only players who have logged in and sent a message​​
in the main World chat tab will be displayed.

■Inviting a Friend
When you invite a friend, you and your friend can both obtain rewards.​
The duration and contents of the Invite a Friend Campaign may be
changed without prior notice.

■The One Being Invited
After receiving an Invite Code from a friend,
enter it on the Enter Invite Code screen to obtain rewards.
An Invite Code can only be entered until the 24th day after a player has started the game.
The button to enter an Invite Code will not appear for players
who do not meet the requirements.
You are limited to entering only 1 Invite Code.

■The One Inviting
During the campaign, 1 Invite Code will be generated for you.
When a friend you shared your code with enters that code in-game, you will obtain rewards.
The more friends you invite, the more rewards you will obtain.

■Invite Code
A single Invite Code can be used to invite a max of 20 people.
You cannot use the Invite Code of someone who is from a different server than you.
*You can check your server on the bottom-left of the title screen.
As long as you are on the same server as someone,
you can use the Invite Code of someone who is on a different World than you.
You cannot use your own Invite Code to invite yourself.
You cannot use Invite Codes that were generated during past Invite a Friend Campaigns.

■DMG Dealt​
This displays the total amount of damage each character dealt in battle.​
Only damage dealt by attacks is totaled.​
Damage dealt by other means, such as Counter, Poison and other debuffs​
that deal continuous damage, and Resonance, are not totaled.​
The amounts displayed reflect the damage dealt before the following​
damage reductions are factored in:​
Cut, Shield, Multi-Barrier, Invulnerable, and Immortality.​

■HP Restored​
This displays the total amount of HP each character has restored
to themselves and their allies in battle.
The amounts displayed also reflect the HP restored by
reviving characters and HP Drain.

■DMG Taken​
This displays the total amount of damage each character took in battle.​
Damage taken from attacks, Counter, Poison and other debuffs that deal continuous damage,​
and Resonance are all totaled.​
The amounts displayed reflect the damage taken after the following​
damage reductions are factored in:​
Cut, Shield, Multi-Barrier, Invulnerable, and Immortality.​

The Cave of Space-Time has 3 Levels, and beating each Level’s boss will let you go to the next Level.
Your progress will reset every 48 hours, and the map will be changed.​
All damage will carry over from battle to battle, so healing frequently is crucial.​

In the Cave of Space-Time, you select adjoining encounters to traverse the map.​
Different events will trigger based on the type of encounters you select.​

In the Cave of Space-Time, winning battles will grant you blessings.
There are a variety of blessings that can give you the edge in battles inside the Cave.​
Prepare for all the strong enemies by collecting as many blessings as you can.​

You can get rewards, like Space-Time Coins, by winning battles and clearing Levels.​
Trade these coins for valuable items and SR character shards at the Shop.

The Tower of Infinity rewards you with gear and items useful for growing stronger.​
Beating the boss on each Floor will unlock the next Floor.

You can form a guild with other players.
Joining a guild lets you unite with guild members​
and take on guild-only challenges, like Guild Battles.

Dispatch characters with Souls and rarities set by each quest and get rewards.​
There are 3 types of quests—Normal, Team, and Guerilla.​
Guerilla quests are special, limited-time only quests.
Compared to other quests, Guerilla quests give more lavish rewards.​

Clearing a certain number of quests will raise your Fountain Rank,​
making it easier for even rarer quests to appear. ​

The Temple of Illusions lets you unite with other players and challenge bosses.
You can challenge the Temple up to 6 times in 1 day. The rewards you can obtain will depend
on the bosses you challenge. Additionally, you will earn boosted rewards by challenging
the Temple between 12:30~13:30 and 19:30~20:30 (Server Time).

Characters set in slots will become the same Lv as a base character.
Your 5 highest Lv characters will be automatically chosen as base characters,​
and the slotted characters will adopt the lowest Lv among the base characters.​

Battle other players’ parties and aim for the highest ranks.​
You can get daily rewards, like Diamonds, based on your rank,​
and rewards will increase as you rank higher.
Challenges are free for up to 5 times in 1 day.​

Here, the top Battle League players from each World compete in ranked battles.
Seasons are Tuesday~Sunday, and you can get lavish Daily Rewards and Season Rewards based on your rank.

Smelting unneeded gear gives you a chance to create high rarity gear.​
If no gear is created, the smelted gear will be converted to Fragments.​
Fragments can be traded for dark gear, holy gear, and more at the Shop.​
If S-rarity gear is smelted, dark gear can be created.​

Consume upgrade materials to upgrade gear.​
Gear can be upgraded to the same value as its Gear Lv.​

Constructing slots and mounting runes on gear will raise the targeted stats.​
The type of gear determines the type of rune that can be mounted.​
・Offensive-type runes for weapons, accessories, and hands.​
・Defensive-type runes for head, body, and feet.​

You can upgrade a rune’s Rune Lv by synthesizing it with another rune of​
the same type and Lv. A rune can be upgraded to the max Rune Lv of 15.​

A character’s rarity can be raised by using characters with the same Soul.
Raising rarity will increase the character’s stats and Max Lv.
Any materials that made the used characters grow stronger will be returned.

In Guild Battles, you fight over bases on the map against rival guilds.​
During Strategy Phase, you decide the bases to siege during War Phase.​
Guilds in the previous day’s top 16 of the Guild Stock Ranking can join the battle.​

​During Strategy Phase (7:45~20:30), you can declare attacks
on red-colored bases adjacent to ones your guild controls.
This determines the bases you will siege during War Phase.

You can defend any base your guild has captured.
These bases are marked in green on the map.
Deploy characters to prevent the enemy from taking control of your bases.

During War Phase (20:45~21:30), you can siege bases you declared attacks on.
Deploy characters into wars for dominance over the enemy’s bases.

If a base is captured, defenders have 15 minutes to counter.
When countering, defenders and attackers will switch roles and battle.
The base can be taken back after completely defeating the enemy.​

In Guild Battles, you can earn more rewards the more bases you capture.​
Larger bases will yield more rewards, and you can earn the most rewards​
from “Brussell”—the base located at the center of the map.​

Grand Battles are special Guild Battles in which guilds chosen based on BP come​
from other Worlds to take part in. Battles are held from Tuesday~Sunday,
and guilds are arranged into groups of 4. The points earned from keeping control​
over territory will determine each guild’s rank within their group.​

In Guild Raids, the total damage dealt to the boss determines the amount of rewards​ you can get.
There is a set number of times you can challenge the boss in one day.

On top of personal rewards, you can get guild rewards based on the total damage​
dealt by all guild members. The total damage will be reset every day.​

The Lv of all characters in the Level Link will become the same as the Party Lv.
From this point on, raising the Party Lv will also raise all characters’ Lv.​
The max Party Lv will increase based on the number of LR characters in your roster.​
Having multiples of the same LR character will not affect that amount the Max Party Lv increases.​

After clearing Level 2, you can choose to challenge Level 3 on Hard Mode.​
The enemies in Hard Mode are powerful, but yield more rewards.

The Towers of Azure, Crimson, Emerald, and Amber can be challenged depending on​
the day of the week. Characters can only enter if they have the Soul that matches​
the name of the tower.​

Acquiring specific groups of characters will unlock arcana.
Each arcana will boost a different set of stats and strengthen those characters.
Additionally, as the rarities of the characters in the arcana group get higher,
the arcana’s level will increase, and new effects will be unlocked.

Any characters set as favorites will appear on the Home Screen.​
Even characters obtained just once can be set as favorites at any time you like.​

By using dark gear, holy gear, and other specialty items,
you can upgrade your gear’s​ Dark Lv and Holy Lv.​
If you use holy and dark gear for upgrading, you can synthesize augmented gear with​
both holy and dark effects. Effects are determined by the body part the piece of gear is for.

By using items to reforge gear, its bonus effects will change at random.​
The bonus effects’ total points will not change—only the balance distribution will.​
Distributing points to the unique type stat of the character equipping the gear​
will also raise that character’s ATK.

If you defeat all enemy defense parties at a base, you can capture it.
When War Phase ends, rewards will be determined
by the number and types of bases captured.

Guild Battles consist of Strategy Phase (7:45~20:30) and War Phase (20:45~21:30).​
During Strategy Phase, you can declare attacks on enemy bases.
In War Phase, you will siege those bases and aim to capture them.

While the event is underway, some of the Cave’s encounters will transform.
By beating them, you will obtain special event items.
These special event items can be exchanged at the Shop for amazing items and characters.
If you reattempt an event encounter, enemies with reduced HP will have 30% of their max HP restored.

While the event is underway, the Temple of Illusions will be open for 24 hours every day.
By beating the limited quests, you will obtain Drops of Sorrow, which can be exchanged at the Shop for amazing items and characters. Additionally, you will earn boosted rewards by challenging the Temple between 12:30~13:30 and 19:30~20:30 (Server Time).

Tapping the "Lock" button will lock the state of gear being used by characters in certain content.
Only one copy of the same character (the one with the higher BP) can have their gear locked.
After a character's gear has been locked, it can be unlocked or updated at any time.

While the event is underway, the Temple of Illusions will be open for 24 hours every day.
By beating the limited quests, you will obtain Summer Sparklers, which can be exchanged at the Shop for amazing items and characters. Additionally, you will earn boosted rewards by challenging the Temple between 12:30~13:30 and 19:30~20:30 (Server Time).
